Title: How to clean a carpet by hand - Get Cool life hacks
Content:
Most of the homemakers face horrible difficulties while cleaning the carpet and how to clean a carpet by hand is one of the most asked questions. When things get dirty in our home carpets are always the first thing to suffer. Carpets are an important part of our home if not the most important part of the look and feel of our home.

Carpets have to deal with dust and dirt that come from outside along with our feet, shoes, or from windows and so on.

When the carpet is dirty the entire home also looks very dirty, so cleaning carpet is one of the biggest problems that homeowners face.

Here’s how to clean your carpet by hand.

Is hand cleaning effective for carpets?

carpet cleaning is indeed heard a little bit heavy to deal with hand but if you can apply all the processes and formulas properly then hand cleaning is very useful too.it is believed that carpet cleaning is impossible without a vacuum cleaner. However, it’s not so true. There are a lot of ways so that the homemakers will be able to clean their carpets by hand and all of the ways are not that tough also.

The convenience and effectiveness of a vacuum cleaner in home cleaning are undeniable. However, there are several cases where a vacuum cleaner cannot be used all the time. Here, in that case, hand cleaning may take some time but it is effective and useful for any of our homemakers.The  ingredients that are used for carpet cleaning are also readily available and affordable. These all are everyday use elements.

So, the answer is, yes hand cleaning can be very effective for your carpet.

What you need:

  • Salt
  • Water
  • White Vinegar
  • Baking Soda
  • Essential Oil
  • Dishwashing liquid

Equipment:

  • A brush
  • A bucket
  • A bowl
  • Towel or cloth
  • Spray bottles

Instructions:

1. Use a carpet brush

To clean dirt, dust, andhair from your carpet using a carpet brush. Just brush with an average force and make sure that all the pollutants have been removed completely from your carpet.

2. Vinegar is a good thing to use

Take a bucket of warm water and mix ¼ cup white vinegar with it. Dip a brush to that warm water mixture and scrub your carpet using the brush. Keep scrubbing the entire carpet until you’re satisfied with it. Fill the bucket with fresh water and use a rag to clean the carpet again with fresh water. When you’re done with both vinegar mixture and freshwater cleaning, let it dry properly.

3. Clean the area rugs:

Take 1 cup vinegar, 2 cups of water, 1 cup salt, 2 teaspoons of essential oil, and mix them in a bowl. Vacuum the rug to clean all the loose dirt. Before starting, apply the solution on the corner of the rug to test colorfastness, if the color doesn’t fade go ahead with your process.

Dip a brush into the mixture and start scrubbing the rug. Let the solution sit on the rug for at least 15 minutes. In the meantime, clean the bowl and put fresh water to rinse the rug using a towel or any soft cloth. Let the rug dry in the sunlight. Allow both of the parts to be dried. Once it has dried properly use a brush or vacuum cleaner if possible, to loosen up the carpet fibers of the rug.

4. Baking soda is a solution for oil stains and pet urine:

Baking soda is an amazing ingredient that you will love to use for cleaning your carpet. Oil is the hardest thing to remove from the carpet, so use baking soda when the stains are so strong that you can’t treat those with hot water.

Apply some baking soda on the stained area and leave it until it absorbs the stain. This procedure is equally useful to get rid of animal urine odor. If you’re a pet owner then you must agree that animal urine doesn’t give up without a fight. For these cases, Baking Soda can be a best friend of yours.

5. Strength of ice cube:

When you move any heavy furniture from your carpet, there will be some disgusting impressions on the carpet that you surely don’t like. For this type of signs on carpet use ice cube that will help to vanish the signs. Place a piece of an ice cube on these dents and let them melt. Afterward, blot the water and iron the area until dry. Use a towel or soft cloth on it while ironing.

Ice cube is not only useful for vanishing heavy dents but also it will work to remove  gum from your carpet. Sometimes Heavy gum takes place on our carpet that seems very difficult to reduce it can even damage or stretch the fiber. So, don’t fight with a gum rather use place an ice cube on the gum, It will freeze it and allow you to remove it from your carpet.

6. Dishwashing liquids can be your carpet cleaner also:

In a spray bottle, mix   ¼ cup dishwashing liquid with 1 cup hot water. Spray the liquid solution on a soft cloth and dab the cloth on the spot. As the stain dissolves blot with a clean part of the cloth. Keep doing it until the stain vanishes. Spray another cloth with cold water and use it to remove the detergent solution from the carpet.

Place a paper towel to make the area dry and put a heavy pot or something on it. Overnight the towel will soak up any stain deep in the carpet.

7. Removing coffee stains from carpet

At first, try to blot up as much of the coffee as you can. Mix 1 tablespoon of liquid dish soap, 1 tablespoon of vinegar, and 2 cups of warm water. Apply a little of the mixture on the stain. You can use a clean white cloth or sponge to apply the mixture. Then blot frequently with a dry cloth until the stain removes. Use cold water to remove the soap mixture and blot dry.

8. Removing Red Wine Stain

Use baking soda on the place and blot with a white cloth until the stain disappears. You can use white wine instead of baking soda.

9. How to remove mud stains:

If your carpet gets dirty with mud let the stain dry. Once the area is dry clean with a brush. Rinse the area with water and detergent. Make sure the detergent is appropriate for the fabric of your carpets.

10. Shaving cream formula

Do you believe a shaving cream can remove almost every kind stain? Yes, ordinary shaving cream is also a cleaning material for your carpet. Just apply some shaving cream on the stain and keep in for about 30-40 minutes until it sits on your carpet. Once it has set blot the cream with a dry white cloth.

Use a 50/50 quantity of water and white vinegar to make a mixture and spray the solution on that stained area. Finish with wiping the solution with a clean cloth or sponge.

11. Solution for candy stuck

Have babies in the home? Then undoubtedly this will help you a lot. Sometimes candies stuck in the carpet so badly that it becomes a struggle.

In that case, scrape the candy with a knife or a spoon. Use any kind of stain remover to clean all of the sugar. Then use a clean cloth to absorb the stain remover along with the stain. Afterward, spray some white vinegar on a plain cloth and blot the area with it. Once the stain is removed, blot the area with a clean cloth moistened with fresh water. Then blot with a dry cloth and allow the area to dry completely.

12. How to  Remove Ink and Marker

Use a small amount of solvent to a white cloth. Blot the spotted area with it and wait 15 minutes to dry the area. Rinse by blotting with a cloth moistened with lukewarm water.

Title: How to Clean Disgusting Carpet With 6 Secrets ways
Content:
If your house floor is carpeted you probably wandered a hundred times about how to clean disgusting carpet. It is easy to stain the carpet but not so pleasant to clean it. Your one wrong move might make it worst.

But, nothing to worry. You can make cleaning carpet a piece of cake just by having some clear ideas about removing stain or dirt. Let’s find out the ways to clean.

How to clean disgusting Carpet

1. Cleaning Carpet by hands

Vacuum or other steam cleaners might not be affordable for you. Don’t worry though! You can just clean it with the help of your hands.

Now a day there are many inexpensive cleaning products with promising claims are available. You might already have some in your kitchen or toilet sink. Make them useful. All you need to do is to give it time.

2. Cleaning with Vinegar

To remove soil, dust and pollutants using a carpet brush. Its time you use your elbow grease and make yourself useful. Get on your knees and agitate the carpet. Thus lose the dust from the carpet and swipe away with moping brush or vacuum if available.

Don’t get worried that you can’t clean your carpet via steam clean. Because you can simply use vinegar, give your carpet a fresh look. You just need these items –

1. A bucket,

 2. A scrub brush

3. Some white vinegar.

Vinegar is the best option to remove slime or any unpleasant stain from your carpet. Follow a homemade hand cleaning recipe:

Ingredients: a. ¼ cup white vinegar

b. Warm water

c. A bucket

First, mix warm water with ¼ cup of vinegar in the bucket. Then dip the scrub brush enough to get wet. Now scrub the carpet. Once you are done , empty the bucket and fill it with fresh water.   With the help of a rag or terry cloth towel scrub again. The towel has to be deeply dipped in freshwater. Then leave it to dry out. Try using a floor fan to dry fast.

3. Cleaning with Baking Soda

Baking soda is not just for baking you fancy cookies, it is also for cleaning. Thanks to baking soda that it is environment friendly unlike detergents. To tackle indoor carpet stain and odor go for baking soda.

Sprinkle a fulsome amount of baking soda directly over the stain. Now prepare a spray of hot water, spray it over the soda. Let it sit for at least three hours. After that, vacuum up the soda.

4. Cleaning area rugs

Area rugs attract dirt fast. By nature, are rugs are quite delicate. That's why it is a little bit difficult to clean them.

Use this toxic free recipe: DIY Area Rugs Cleaner

Ingredients: 1 cup vinegar

2 cups of water

2 tablespoons of table salt

15 drops of essential oil of your choice

Vacuum both sides of the rug and loose the dirt. You need to taste the colorfastness of the rug. Try scrubbing a small spot of the rug with water. It the color doesn’t fade then you are free to clean it with hands.

In a bowl or bucket mix the ingredients. Dip the sponge and scrub over the rub. Let id sit over it for several minutes. Get rid of the mixture and fill the bucket with fresh water. Now rinse the rug. Remove the excess water with a dry towel or squeegee. Dry outside in the sun.

5. Cleaning Carpet without a Machine

There are lots of easy ways to clean your carpet by hand. Also cleaning products are less likely to be found for carpet on the stairs. So you must clean it with the help of your hands. Especially if you live in a duplex or multi-story home.

Try this natural carpet Cleaner recipe.
Natural Carpet Cleaner for use without Machine

Ingredients required: 1 cup vinegar

2 cups of hot water

2 tablespoons of table salt

15 drops of lavender oil

Make a mixture of one cup of vinegar, two cups of hot water in a spray bottle. Add two tablespoons of salt and around fifteen drops of lavender oil to the mixture. Shake well.

Just like before using a scrub or stiff brush for the cleaning job. To get rid of any stubborn dust you must brush off your carpet with a brush. Vacuum cleaner won't be able to do it. After loosening the dust consider using the recipe on every single stair.

Spray the bottle to each stair liberally. Now scrub using your hands and scrub brush thoroughly. After that simply allow the carpet to dry. You use a vacuum cleaner at the end to remove any leftover residue. 

You may also take a quick tip to remove odor from your smelly carpet. Let your smelly rugs sink in the mixture of diatomaceous earth and water for several minutes. Then, receive a fresh and pleasant smelling carpet. Diatomaceous earth is also useful in killing bugs, fleas, or ticks.

6. Cleaning Old Carpet

Sometimes you want to make your old carpet useful again. But that old carpet is already packed with a pile of dirt. You must be wondering "how to make it new again?"

No rush! Just go through the following instructions. Here you will find everything you need to know to make your carpet look new again:

  • Do you want to brighten your old faded carpet? Then simply use a rug soaked in saltwater. Rub the soaked rug on your faded carpet. Then squeeze it to wring the excess water.

You can also just submerge the faded rug in saltwater, let it sink for several moments then dry it out.

  • You can use a mixture of ammonia and water to get rid of heavy dirt. But first, try it on a tiny area to see if it affects in any adverse way.

Simply with a damp mob (with ammonia) rub on the area you want to clean. Then let it dry.

Never use ammonia on the woolen carpet.

  • Keeping furniture in one place for a long time causes carpet dent. Don't worry! Go to your kitchen, grab a fork, and brush them straight.  For better results you can try ice cubes. Leave the ice cubes on the spot then rub it with a dry cloth. Ice cubes can straighten up fibers. Next time use plastic bags at the feet of the furniture so that it doesn’t leave any mark.
  • To stop your carpet producing static electricity use a mixture of fiber softener and three cups of water.
  • If you are still not getting your desired result, don’t just rip it up yet. Try professional carpet cleaners. They can deliver totally a new carpet getting rid of all sorts of stain.

Conclusion

We narrowed down the necessities you need to follow. Done reading them? Well, now you know how to get your disgusting carpet get cleaned. Homemade recipes work like magic in deodorizing your carpet. All you need is a little bit of your patience and a few drops of sweat.

Title: How to Clean Laminate Wood Floors Swiffer? - 3 Quick Tips
Content:
Laminate wood gives a better look to our floor. They look elegant, easy to maintain, and also protective. They cover the floor and gives an attractive look with a cheaper cost than you would spend on any hardwood or engineered wood flooring. But when it comes about cleaning it looks quite different as water does not mix with laminate wood.

We get a lot of questions about how to clean a laminate wood floor Swiffer, so here I tried to help you out with some easy tricks.

What is a Swiffer?

Before we dive into how to clean laminate wood floors with a Swiffer, let's talk about what a Swiffer is. A Swiffer is a cleaning tool that's designed to make cleaning floors quick and easy. It consists of a lightweight, adjustable handle and a disposable pad that's specially designed to attract and trap dirt, dust, and debris. Swiffer pads are available in a variety of textures and scents, so you can choose the one that's best for your needs.

Swiffer sweeper wet mop

Swiffer sweeper wet mops are a good choice for your laminate wood floor. They are specially designed for cleaning laminate wood floors as they don’t let water sit long on the wood.  Swiffer sweeper wet mop provides the right amount of detergent spray without causing any harm to the wood or your floor.

So when the question is, can you use Swiffer sweeper wet on laminate floors, then I’ll say yes you can but always use the right detergent and one thing you must be aware of, never use a wet steam mop as they can harm to your laminate wood floor.

Swiffer wet cloths

Are you worried about tough and sticky messes? Swiffer wet cloths can be a good solution for you this time. Though it’s easy to clean a laminate wood floor for its smooth surface, sometimes sticky stains create great trouble. So to deal with that type of tough mark you can use a Swiffer wet cloth.

Just use some force while cleaning, your floor will be fine as before. One thing you should keep in mind that, water should not be set long on the surface.

Vinegar:

vinegar is safe for cleaning your laminate wood floor. To make the solution mix 1/4 cup of vinegar with 1 bottle of warm water. This mixture is helpful for clearing stains and regular dust from the floor.

Use a little amount of solution with a mop or Swiffer and clean the laminate wood floor properly. Do not overwet your floor, as you know water is the main enemy for laminate wood floors.

How to Clean Laminate Wood Floors Swiffer?

Cleaning your laminate wood floors with a Swiffer is easy and straightforward. Here's how to do it in a few simple steps:

  1. Clear the Area: Before you start cleaning your floors, remove any furniture or objects that might be in the way. This will make it easier to clean the floors thoroughly.
  2. Dry Dust the Floor: Start by using a dry Swiffer pad to dust the floor. This will remove any loose dirt, dust, or debris from the surface of the floors. Make sure to get into all the corners and edges of the room.
  3. Wet the Swiffer Pad: Next, wet the Swiffer pad with water or your preferred cleaning solution. Be careful not to saturate the pad, as this can damage the floors.
  4. Mop the Floor: Once the pad is wet, attach it to the Swiffer handle and start mopping the floors. Use a back-and-forth motion to ensure that you cover the entire surface of the floors. Be sure to replace the pad when it gets dirty or saturated with cleaning solution.
  5. Dry the Floor: Finally, use a dry Swiffer pad to dry the floors. This will remove any excess moisture and ensure that your floors dry quickly and evenly.

Tips for Cleaning Laminate Wood Floors with a Swiffer

Here are a few tips to keep in mind when cleaning your laminate wood floors with a Swiffer:

  • Use a gentle cleaning solution: Avoid using harsh chemicals or abrasive cleaners on your laminate wood floors, as these can cause damage. Instead, opt for a gentle cleaning solution that's specifically designed for use on laminate wood flooring.
  • Replace the Swiffer pad frequently: To ensure that you're cleaning your floors effectively, be sure to replace the Swiffer pad frequently. This will ensure that you're picking up all the dirt and debris on your floors.
  • Use a microfiber pad: Microfiber pads are gentle on laminate wood floors and are effective at picking up dirt and debris. Consider using a microfiber pad with your Swiffer for best results.

Things you Should Never Do

1.Never use excess watery solutions or even water to clean your laminate wood. If water sits on your wood it can damage the protective layer of laminate wood. If water enters into the laminate flooring it can be a real mess, as this flooring may have some openings.

Laminate flooring can get wet only on the top. Its sides, open areas, damaged areas, and bottoms can not get wet anyway. It may cause high damage to your favorite flooring. When you are using a little amount of liquid solution or water just clean the floor with a sponge or dry cloth to make it completely dry.

2. Before using a cleaning product always or doing anything with your floor always follow your manufacturers’ guidelines. Try not to break any instruction. Make sure you are following the directions properly. You surely would not want to take any risk that can void the warranty.

3. Do not use steel wool to clean your floor, they can make permanent scratches on your beautiful flooring

4. Just avoid all types of wax, bleach, and chemicals to make your floor shiny. This type of element does permanent harm to wooden flooring. Always remember these floors are not real so you should be more careful when taking care of it.

5. Never use any rough fiber to clean your laminate floor, they are not good options at all. Always do use soft cloths like cotton.

FAQ:

1.Will Swiffer ruin laminate floors?

No, Swiffer will not ruin laminate floors. It is completely safe to use for your beautiful and precious floor. You can use any wet Swiffer or Swiffer wetJet on the laminate floor. Since they are specially prepared for cleaning laminate floors using a Swiffer is always a good choice you can make.

As I mentioned before, that Swiffer does not let water sit too long on the surface so you need not worry about any harm, just use a little amount of detergent and sweep properly. It will clear all stains, pet hair, and loose dirt. It is safe.

2. Can you use Swiffer wet on hardwood floors?

Swiffer wet jet is a kind of material that you can use to clean your hardwood floors. The wet pad attached with the gadget swipe out the extra liquid solution so that your floor remains well and healthy.

Swiffer wetJet can be used on all finished wood floors with a dry or wet cloth. Before cleaning, the hardwood floor should be completely dried. Deep clean with a steam mop is recommended with high awareness and sincerity since the steam can enter into the floor through small openings.

So steam cleaning is a good method only when you have a properly sealed floor. WetJet cleans all the dirt dust and debris. Also, You will feel  green and refreshed as It smells good.

3. Is Swiffer wetJet wood safe for laminate floors?

A laminate floor is a sensitive type of floor. So the methods, techniques, and products for cleaning this type of floor should be selected carefully. To protect dirt and dust attack may not seem easy all the time, Swiffer WetJet is a solution when you are confused about your floor cleaning products.

Swiffer WetJet Power pads clean all the specks of dirt, stain, sticky spots with greater strength.

Also, WetJet will provide you with very fresh smells, that will make you refreshed and your laminate wood surface will be greener. So, Yes, Swiffer WetJet is safe for laminate floors.

Final Thought

Use furniture pads under furniture and mats under pet dishes to avoid scratch marks and keep your floor scratch and stain free as much as you can.

A neat and clean floor gives an attractive look to your house.  No matter how busy your daily routine is, just try to find out a little time regularly for cleaning your floor. Your ordinary concern can make your floor shine every day.

Title: How to Clean Sunbrella Indoor Upholstery Fabric?
Content:
When you are using a Sunbrella fabric for indoor upholstery, what do you do to keep it clean? Do you clean it yourself or bring it to the laundry? Well, it's much easier to take help from an expert. But when the fabric is being attached, it won't be that easy to clean. That's why you need to clean it yourself.

But as upholstery, it will be tricky to clean it properly. We know that Sunbrella is known as water and sun resistance. It also has a stain resistance facility. All these features make it more durable than other fabrics.

That's why you don't need to do lots of things to keep it clean. Following some easy steps and applying it in the right way will be enough. So, let's dive right into the descriptions of several ideas that will surely solve your problem.

How to Clean Sunbrella Indoor Upholstery Fabric

Regular cleaning

To keep the upholstery clean, you need to wash it regularly. And for regular wash, you can simply use water. And for making a quick solution, take water in a spray bottle and spray it all over the surface. Then gently rub it and let it for drying. Make sure you won't rub it too hard.

You can also use a liquid cleanser to clean it properly. But you have to choose a mild one for doing that. This process can give you a better result in a quick way. Do the same as before. And you can spray one more layer of liquid if needed. Gently do the same processes as before and dry it out properly. You can do these steps at least once in a week so that the surface will remain clean.

Clean with a soap solution

When you see some dirt remaining on the surface, and it looks not so good, then you can wash it with soap liquid. It's useful, especially for cleaning indoor upholstery. And for doing it, take mild soap in a spray bottle, and add water in it. Then mix it well, and spray it on that place. Don't rub it at all. Just take a sponge or a soft brush to gently clean it.

After that, wipe out the residue of soap, and moisture with a soft cloth or towel. Then air-dry the place. Repeat the WIPING-OUT process if there is any moisture left on the surface. Again dry that place out, and that's it.

Clean by using the washing machine

If you have a sofa, cushion, or another kind of thing that is made of indoor upholstery fabric, and that has zippers with it for easy-removing, then you can wash it in a machine. But before doing that, you need to know if the fabric is being recommended to do that or not. And if it does, then nothing will be better than doing it.

Washing this fabric in a machine is easy and simple. All you need to do is, wash it in the right way. And for doing it right, all you have to do is close the zippers. Then put it in the machine with cold water. After that, add a mild detergent. After a while, take the fabric out of the machine and simply let it there to air dry.

Use ammonia solution

If you have a bloodstain on that fabric, then what will you do? Well, at that time, the soap solution won't be enough. You need a special treatment for it. You can use an ammonia solution to remove dried blood stain easily. And for doing it in the right way, first, you need to clean it with the soap solution. It will help to remove the stain as much as possible.

Then make an ammonia solution. For doing it, you will need:

  • 1/2 cup of ammonia
  • 1/4 cup of dishwashing soap
  • 4 liters of water

Mix all the ingredients well and through a spray bottle, spray all over the stained area. Rub it mildly, and let it dry in the air.

Vinegar cleanser

If there are some strong-smelling stains, then you can use soap and vinegar solution. It can remove strong stains and smells like beer, wine, or any kind of food coloring. And for making it, you will need:

  • 1/3 cup of white vinegar
  • 1/4 cup of liquid soap
  • 4 liters of water

Take all the ingredients together, and mix it well to make a liquid mixture. Then take a spray bottle and transfer the mixture into it. Spray this liquid on the stained place. Take a soft sponge, and mildly rub that place. Then rinse it off with clean water. Spray water on that place for easy-applying. Then simply leave it to air dry. This vinegar mixture will remove all the smell easily.

Apply bleach cleaner

When the stain is severe, and you will doubt if the previous processes won't work well, then you can use a bleach solution. And for making it, you will need:

  • Bleach
  • Mild dishwashing liquid

Take 1 cup of bleach and add 1/4 cup of dishwashing liquid. Mix it all and put it into a spray bottle. Now it's ready for use on the stained area.

Gently spray the mixture on the stained place, and leave it for a few minutes. Let it soak for at least 10-15 minutes, and then use a soft brush or a sponge to clean the excess. You can also use water, and spray it all over that area for removing residues. After doing it, let it air dry, and then use it as before.

Tips For Clean Sunbrella Indoor Upholstery Fabric

1. Make sure you mildly treat the fabric.

2. You shouldn't rub that place too much. It can fade the texture away from that fabric.

3. Avoid using the dryer to dry it out. It may damage the fabric.

4. Make sure, there's no water remaining in it. You have to dry it completely.

Wrap Up

As you can see, we described several tricks to remove stains from the Sunbrella indoor upholstery fabric. Sunbrella is a material that eventually has a water and stain resistance facility. So, you won't have to take so much pressure to get an idea of removing stains. A little effort can do a lot. Also, we shared some interesting hacks too. So, you can go and try these out.

Besides, regular cleaning is important. If you keep cleaning the surface regularly, there will be less dirt remaining, and you can manage to have a clean and new-looking surface all the time. That's why keep doing it, and have a fresh surface. It is because that will make you feel fresh too.

Title: How to Clean Discolored Vinyl Flooring
Content:
Do you have vinyl flooring at your house? If you have then you surely face discoloration situation of it. The reason is whoever is having a vinyl flooring must see the yellowish stains on that floor.

There can be more than one reason for having that problem. But there is more than one solution too for this problem. If you are facing this kind of problem then you have to check out the tricks of getting rid of it. Let's see what the hacks are and how they work.

Causes of discoloration

If we talk about the causes of discoloration, we will find several sides to it. There are different reasons why the vinyl surface got discolored. Vinyl is something that is a synthetic material. It's versatile, cost-efficient, and stain-resistant. That's why you won't have to take much trouble cleaning it.

Vinyl contains several kinds of harmful toxins like phthalates, lead, styrene, and many more. This kind of floor is affordable and it looks rich as well. But the application of bleach can affect the tile. When you are doing deep cleaning, you might see the bleach stain on the surface. Harmful chemicals can also make the floor yellowish. Though flooring lasts for a long time the harmful applications can ruin the color of it.

When the substrate is installed in the wrong way, the dyes of the bleach make the floor worse. The yellowish stain is caused because of chlorine bleach that is used for cleaning the floor. It has moisture and this moisture is gradually getting into the layers of tiles. That's how it affects the floor. The sun and heat are also a reason for this discoloration. All the things are responsible for this.

Cleaning the Vinyl flooring yourself

For doing the cleaning process all by yourself, you can do several applications. You can clean the floor in a regular process. And for that, first, you have to remove all the dirt and debris. You can use a vacuum cleaner for easy-using. Make sure you remove all the food, hair, and other residues as well.

Then take soap water or any other kind of liquid cleanser and wipe the floor out with a mop. You can also use baby shampoo as it is a safe cleanser. Besides, you can do deep cleaning once in 10-15 days. Deep cleaning is not necessary to do frequently. It will also be necessary when there are lots of stains and dirt.

Cleaning discoloration of Vinyl flooring with natural ingredients

Vinegar

To clean the floor, you will need vinegar. It contains harmless products that lightly clean the surface. This is so mild that it won't harm the tile and also helps to reduce the discoloration.

To make the vinegar solution, take the apple cider vinegar and pour it in a bucket. Add warm water in it and mix it well. It's ready to be used on the floor. Now take a mop and dip it into the mixture. Then, gently clean the floor. After cleaning it, leave the floor for drying out.

Baking soda

Baking soda is the other ingredient that works like magic. To make a baking soda mixture, take 1/8 cup of baking soda and mix it with warm water. You can also add lemon to it. The amount of lemon should be 1/4 cup. The lemon-baking soda mixture is well-known for removing stains and yellowish thing of any product. When the mixture is ready, apply it to the places where the stain exists. Then leave it for 12-15 minutes and then wipe it out to clean properly.

Jojoba oil

If you want your floor to illuminate and shine, you can use jojoba oil. And for using it, add few drops of oil in the cleaning mixture. Then do the same technique to clean the floor. To get a mild smell, you can use that oil that has a fragrance in it. You can also use some essential oil in the mixture for getting a better result.

Rubbing alcohol

Take rubbing alcohol and soak a soft cloth in it. Then apply it all over the floor by gently rubbing it. This method is excellent for heavy, pigmented stains. It is useful for cleaning the vinyl floor effectively. It won't damage anything but clean the surface properly.

Method of Whitening Vinyl Flooring

When you are thinking about the discoloration, you should know that it is not a tough thing to remove. For sunlight and heat of it, the vinyl floor gets stained, and that makes it discolored. There also can be a lot of spots on the floor. All the things can be removed by a little effort. You just have to know the correct process of cleaning.

As you already know, baking soda is a great source of reducing and removing the spot. You can surely count on this method. You can also use lemon and apple cider vinegar with it. These processes are much more effective than regular, harmful bleaching.

Besides, you can use WD-40 for eliminating scuffs. Rubbing alcohol is also a good liquid to remove discoloration. Further, you can apply the steaming process on the surface. It will help you more to remove stains easily. Overall, all of those techniques have wonderful elements that can easily remove the stains and make the floor as new as before.

Cleaning Vinyl flooring with dish soap

Using dish soap is a good option for easy cleaning. It's easy to use and available as it can be found almost in every house. To make the solution, take warm water in a bucket, and add dish soap into it.

Then take a mop and dip it in the solution until it will soak well. After that, remove the excess water and then wipe the floor out nicely. Though it is a simple process and you can do it anytime. For deep cleaning, you can add baking soda, vinegar, or any other type of ingredient into this mixture.

Tips to Clean Discolored Vinyl Flooring

1. Try to clean the surface regularly.

2. Make sure you won't use any abrasive cleaner.

3. Avoid any kind of acidic elements because it can harm the texture of the floor.

4. Do not harsh on the floor. If you are using any brush, make sure you won't scrub too hard with it.

Wrap up

As you can see, we are describing several home methods that are useful and a handful too. You don't have to go to the stores to buy any harmful bleach. It won't give you effective results rather make the floor more yellowish than before.

That's why you should try these tricks to make your floor as new as always. Besides, it's not tough to maintain cleanliness and decrease the discoloration of the vinyl floor. If it's not possible to deep clean the floor then use these simple hacks to get the effective results easily.

Title: How to Clean Burnt Grease from Frying Pan?
Content:
Cooking is interesting. There are many people who will agree with this statement. But do you ever think about cleaning all the mess that you did during cooking?

If you are going through this situation then you will know how troublesome this work is. And the most annoying part is to clean the burnt surface of the frying pan. It's tough to get rid of the grease as well as the stain.

Doing this job is a pain. And to decrease your pain, we suggest you to get the easy methods of cleaning burnt pans. Let's see what the methods are and if they work effectively or not.

How will you prevent burning?

Cleaning is tough. That's why you have to be careful that you won't burn the surface of your frying pans. It is because if you won't be careful and burn the pans more than it should be, then you will face much trouble to clean all the mess.

That's why you have to prevent burning grease and its buildups. To prevent it, you have to take some steps. First of all, you have to use a non-stick pan to avoid stickiness. But if you don't have frying pans like this, then you can season your regular frying pan. It can give you the same effect.

And for doing it, just take the pan and add high-smoking point oil to it. After that, start the flame and heat it up. After finishing the heating process, then you have to dry it out. You can also wipe it out with regular kitchen wipes.

That's how you can make a non-sticky surface of your previous pan. It can cook food quickly and it will save you from unnecessary work. Thus, you don't have to work hard to remove the worst burnt grease.

How to Clean Burnt Grease from Frying Pan - 8 Method of Removing burnt grease

When it's about cleaning the burnt grease from your frying pan, you can apply several methods. These methods will be useful for you as it will reduce the pressure of yours to clean it properly. So, let's check what the incredible methods are.

1. Baking soda

First, we talk about baking soda. We all know how amazingly the baking soda works for removing any kind of stain. It is also great for removing burnt grease from the surface of the pan.

And for applying it, you just need to take the burnt pan and sprinkle soda on the burnt area. Let it sit for a few minutes. You should add some water on it so that it can soak properly. After a while, scrub it off and you will see how incredibly the stains come out from the surface.

However, it can be a bit pricey but it works like magic. It removes stains from both the stainless steel and the other types of pans too. To get a better result, soak it for a long time before scrubbing.

2. Vinegar

As we know that, vinegar is an acidic product that is used for cooking, and even for some household activities. There are 5-20% acetic acid that the vinegar contains. And this amount of acid helps to remove stains easily.

Besides, vinegar is available in almost every house. That's why you can choose this element if you don't have a cleaner around you or you want a better result.

Besides, it's useful for stains. For getting better results, you need to pour some vinegar on the burnt place, and leave it for 15-20 minutes. After that, take a scrubber and scrub it nicely until the stains come out. It's easy and simple.

3. Soak and scrub

No matter what element you use, if you don't soak it then you won't be able to get rid of the stains. That's why you have to soak the ingredients on the pan, and then do the next process.

Soaking is an ancient procedure that is used by almost all people. It's effective for removing tough stains in an easy way.

However, scrubbing is not enough. It just does half of the work. You also need to scrub the stained places after completing the soaking process. That's how you can get the effective results.

4. Bar keepers friend

Bar Keepers Friend is a stain cleaning element that has been used since 1882. It's effective for reducing and removing stubborn stains. It's a powerful cleanser, and it's specialized for cleaning this kind of stuff.

It's actually good stuff, and it works very impressively. And to get the impressive outcome, you need to use it properly.

Using it is an easy process. You need to apply this powder-textured element just like the baking soda. Simply sprinkle the powder on the stained area and add some water to soak it nicely. After 5-10 minutes, scrub the places and wash as usual.

You can see it takes all the grease away, and it works very quickly. Overall, it's a thumbs up for this element.

5. Ketchup

It's basically an experimental process you can say. Ketchup has an acid that can remove the stains of the pan. You just need to apply the ketchup on the places that are burnt.

But if we compare it with the previous elements, then we won't recommend you this as it will take much time. And if you want to clean the entire frying pan with this then it will be tough to clean because the cleaning process of it is slow. But if you don't have any alternative around you then you can use this as an experiment.

6. Heat and scrub

Heating is another effective way to clean the frying pan surface. All you need to do is, take the burnt pan and pour any of the elements like baking soda, vinegar, salt, or things like that.

After that, start the flame. You can mix a little amount of water with it. Heat the pan in a high flame for a few minutes. Once you are done, then turn off the flame and scrub it as before. Make sure the heat won't hurt your hand. Because of scrubbing, you will see the burnt grease coming off the surface. And when you will scrub all over the surface nicely then wash it with plain water and leave it for air dry.

7. Baking powder, sea salt, vinegar

You can mix baking soda, vinegar, and sea salt all together. It can provide you better results. And for doing it, take a bowl and mix all the ingredients to make a paste. Then apply the paste on the stain and soak it for some time.

After that, scrub it well, and wash the surface with water. You have to make sure that you soak the pan with that paste properly. That's how you can get the better results easily.

8. Cream of Tartar

Cream of Tartar is another element that is used for cleaning. It can clean the burnt pans too. It seems good how cream of tartar removes burnt grease.

The ingredient is called cream of tartar, but it's not in a cream-based formula. It's a powder-based element that you can use for reducing stain. And for doing it, use this powder and cover the pan with it. Add some water and then scrub it perfectly.

As you use it, you can see some changes but it cannot remove all the stains. It works slowly and thus provides average results. You might get a benefit like the bar keepers friend but it has to be soaked for a longer time to get that result.

Final Verdict

We can see through the methods that almost all the methods have the same procedures of cleaning. However, we will recommend you to use baking soda and bar keepers friends. These two are amazing. But baking soda can be a bit expensive for you. At that time, use a bar keepers friend.

But in an overall sense, you can apply any of those methods. And we assure you that you won't be disappointed.

Title: Can You Flush Hair down The Toilet?
Content:
When you are using the bathroom, it's very important to maintain hygiene and also keep it clean. It's also important to extend the longevity of the bathroom and toilet as well.

Many people try to keep their bathroom clean, but most of the people are still doing it in the wrong way. They do those things that will even decrease hygiene. We know that the most important thing that should be maintained is to keep all the extra waste out. And for maintaining it, people flush down many of the things that they shouldn't.

They flush wipes, cotton buds, sanitary items, and many other things down in the commode. But doing that isn't an appropriate thing. And they also flush down hair the most. Let's see if this is fine to do that or not.

Can You Flush Hair down The Toilet?

You already know that hairs are good at clogging whether you are in a bathroom, and washing your hair, or you are using a hairbrush. It will clog both the areas to the hairbrush and the drain of the bathroom.

Like the same way, it will also clog the area of the commode if you flush hair down the toilet. The reason is, hair breaks down slowly. That's why you can absolutely say that doing this isn't a proper thing that you often do. You absolutely cannot do that.

Besides, hair is the most common element to clog the pipe. That's why doing it is not safe. Further, when the long hair goes into the toilet, it creates a web that can easily stop any type of flow. That's how the toilet gets clogged easily.

It's so easy to make a ball of hair and throw it into the toilet. But if you realize what the outcomes will be then you will not do that at all. The hair and the other materials can stick together easily and help to make a clogged pipe. That's why we will keep saying repeatedly that flushing the hair down the toilet is not a good option to do.

Will hair block the toilet?

As you knew earlier that the one thing that can go through the toilet is human waste. Many of the people flush toilet papers into it but it's also an inappropriate thing to do.

Moreover, hair is a thing that can easily clog the toilet. It can clog pipe downstream of the toilet too. Further, there is another thing that can be problematic when you are flushing hair down the toilet. And that is the hair down the drain that can make all kinds of havoc.

Hair is a biodegradable property, and that's why it can leave down there for a longer time than other elements. It also can clog the outer filter and that's why you need to dig up and clean out the filter nicely. So, it's clear that the hair can clog the toilet and block that line.

What should you do then?

It's proved that flushing hair down the toilet is an inappropriate idea. That's why you have to be careful especially when you are in the bathroom. It is because flushing it down will completely clog the flowing area. It will make the water flowing stop, and it might bring a lot of trouble to you.

But what should you do then? You can do two things to avoid this stress. Firstly, you can throw the hairs away. That's the simple thing to do. The other thing is, you can compost it.

At first, you can try to compost the hair. Yes, you should know that hair is compost-able. You can compost it to get rid of the clogging. Many of you might not know that it's a good source of nitrogen. And that nitrogen is good for soil. That's why you can use hair for composting instead of wasting it.

And for doing that, you should simply mix the hair in the compost pile. You can also add the other elements with it and compost it. Make sure you do the process by adding a small amount of elements because that will be easier to compost.

But if you don't find the composting procedure useful, then you can simply throw all the hairs away. The best place to throw it is in the trash bin. That might not be environment-friendly but it will surely help to get rid of the clogging of the toilet. That's why you can surely apply any of the two options and thus you can stay away from the trouble.

What can you flush down the toilet?

There are not all the things that you can flush down the toilet. There are some things that you can flush. It's important to know what the things are that can be disposed of through flush.

When the right thing is going down the toilet, it won't harm anything because it will flush away and nothing can be clogged up. And all the watery things that are being flushed, eventually go to the rivers and sea. So, it will be a beneficial thing that we got from nature.

But if the things are not flushed and put it in the bin then it can harm the normality of nature. But first, you need to know what the things are.

Any kind of liquid and wastewater can be flushed down the toilet. It won't create any difficulties to the commode, and thus these kinds of things can be flushed down easily. So be careful before flush anything down.

Things you should never flush down the toilet

Not all kinds of things that you can flush down the toilet. There are certain things that can be flushed away. It is because flushing down all the things can be inappropriate for the toilet. The commode can get clogged up for flushing down inappropriate things.

We have learned earlier about what things we can flush down the toilet. Generally, any kind of wastewater can be flushed, and it's obvious to have that facility because the toilet is made for that purpose.

But there are some elements that people generally flush. But doing that isn't the right thing. Those elements can clog the commode area and the other areas too. And there are several things such as, any kind of wet wipes like makeup wipes, baby wipes, toilet wipes, and many more. Most of the people think that flush those wipes down is fine. But it's not a right thing even if there is written "flushable" on the cover.

Besides, any kind of cotton pad or cotton wool is also an inappropriate property to flush down. There are also some elements like cleansing pads, dental floss, cigarette butts, toilet roll tubes, sanitary napkins, medicines, nappies, tampons, plasters, and these kinds of things cannot be flushed down the toilet at all as it can cause damages to the water flow of the toilet, and that made it harmful.

Wrap up

We often don't realize what we are flushing down the toilet. Of course, it's an obvious thing to be an absent-minded human in that case. But it should be noticed what you are flushing down through the water. It is because there can be some inappropriate things that shouldn't be flushed down.

That's the reason you should always be aware of that thing to avoid the upcoming trouble. Besides, doing it can also keep the toilet clean. And we hope that we could help you by sharing some information. Know the details well and try to apply it in your daily life.

Title: How to Clean Hair Brushes with Baking Soda?
Content:
Cleaning the brushes with baking soda? YES! You heard it right. Though there are lots of ways to clean it like you can use toothpaste, vinegar, baby oil, but using baking soda is one of the most effective ways to clean.

Baking soda has that element that can effectively heal lots of problems like skin problems, mouth problems, the stain of the elements, and lots more.

And it's effective for removing dirt of the brushes too. Let's see how you can clean the comb with some simple steps.

How to Clean Hair Brushes with Baking Soda: Step by Step instructions

When you see that your hairbrushes are getting dirty, you need to wash it. If you didn't wash it quite often then it will become so dirty that there's no other option than deep cleaning. And for both regular and deep cleanings, baking soda is a great solution.

There is a certain trick of cleaning the hairbrushes with baking soda. To know how you will do it, let's dive into the method and see the steps.

Step1: Remove all the hairs

The first thing you have to do is to get rid of all the hairs that are being stuck to the brush. If you don't do it then you cannot clean the brushes properly, and you will face trouble while doing it. Besides, if you put the brushes in the water then the hair will be tough to remove.

Moreover, when you are using baking soda to deeply clean the comb, the hair could block the dirt that you want to clean. No matter how many times you clean the comb, the hair won't let you do that properly.

Further, it will look weird if the hairs are being stuck with the brush while you clean it. That's why you need to clean up the hair from the brushes. That's the first thing you have to do before getting into the next steps.

Step 2: Fill the sink with water

Before mixing the ingredients, you need to fill the sink first. The reason for doing it is, you can easily do the cleaning process. You just have to dip the brushes in it and clean as it needs to be cleaned.

Further, if you store water in a sink before cleaning, you will waste less amount of water. That's the reason you have to fill the sink.

And make sure you use hot water instead of cold or room temperature water. This will help to remove the dirt of the comb easily. Moreover, you have to make sure that you use the hottest water you can. The more hot the water is, the more easily you can get rid of the dirt of it. That's why this should be the second step that should be done before doing the next procedures.

Step 3: Damp the brushes

After collecting the hot water, now damp the brushes into it. Add a water-based shampoo and mix it well. Adding shampoo is important because it can help you to get rid of the dirt and futile from the comb easily.

You can also use shower gel and mix it with lukewarm water. Now put the brushes into the water and then let it be for 5-7 minutes. After doing that, rinse those brushes off with cold water and wipe it out.

One thing that you should be careful of is to avoid using any harmful dish-washing liquid, or any detergent. The reason is the material. As you know, the brushes are made of plastic or wood. Using harmful washing elements can ruin the material of the brush.

Step 4: Mix all the ingredients

After doing that, now find out what ingredients you will need to start cleaning the hairbrushes. Take all the elements in one place, and then start the mixing procedure.

Take lukewarm water and put 3 tablespoons of baking soda in it. Mix it well. Don't take too much hot water that is not touchable. You can also add some apple cider vinegar into it. Then mix all the ingredients nicely to get into the next steps.

Step 5: Damp the hairbrush

When you are done with mixing the ingredients, now it's time to clean the brushes. And for doing it, you need to damp the brushes well. Let it there for some time so that all the baking soda mixture can go to the brushes and you don't face any problem while washing it.

You have to soak the brushes for about 20-30 minutes. After soaking it, start cleaning using an old thin toothbrush. You will see the dirt can easily come out from the inner corners of the brushes. That's the result of the soaking procedure.

Step 6: Wiping out

After finishing the deep cleaning, the next step is to wipe the brushes out in a nice way. Take the wet brushes, and wipe it out using a towel or tissue paper. It can help the brushes to remove the excess water. You should do the wiping procedure in a dabbing movement and that will help the brushes to get rid of the excess water easily.

You can use another technique for drying it out. Use an electric hair dryer, and that will help you to dry it out in an easy way. But make sure the heat of the dryer won't be that much high that the material of the brushes can't take it.

But if the brushes are waterproof or made of plastic then, you don't have to do anything. Just wait, and it will dry out automatically. And if the brushes are made of wood then, you need to follow the drying procedures.

Step 7: Repeat

After doing all the procedures, then you need to recheck if there is any dirt remaining on the brushes or not. And if you find any of it then you will need repeating the processes.

Do the cleaning processes the same way until you will find the brushes properly cleaned. Also, you need to clean your brushes when it's needed. You need to do the cleaning procedures twice in a week to maintain the cleanliness.

That's how you can always have a nice, clean, and shiny hairbrush that will also help to maintain the blood circulation of your hair and protect it from damages.

Wrap Up

As you can see, we described several rules of cleaning the hairbrushes with baking soda. But many people think that using baking soda is harmful. But let me enlighten you. it's the most effective way to clean any kind of dirt or stain.

But if you still don't agree with it and don't want to use this method then you can also follow some simple tricks to keep your combs cleaned. And that is to use coconut oil or any kind of baby oil. It's an easy process to remove all the dirt within a few minutes.

Furthermore, it's very important to use a clean comb because it will be effective for your hair. That's why you must maintain the cleanliness of the comb and remove the dirt by following those steps.

Title: How to Clean Pots and Pans to Look like New?
Content:
When it's about cleaning burnt pots or pans, we all know how difficult the cleaning is. The toughest time will be that moment when you are all done with your cooking, and now you have to clean all the mess.

And the main equipment that has to be cleaned is the pans and the pots. And it's tough too. But different tricks will make this task easier if you maintain these well. Let's see some of the tricks and know how it will work.

How to clean Pots and pans to look like new

When it's about cleaning the pots, and the pans, things get tougher. The reason is, these things become greasy, crusty, and sticky. It will be difficult to work to remove all this mess. And there are lots of ways to do it properly and make it new as before.

Let's dive into the section and see the ways of how you can do all the things easily.

1. Vinegar and baking soda

Both vinegar and baking soda are natural ingredients. And the more you use natural products the more you will get the better result with less harm.

Well, all know that baking soda and vinegar are good elements that can remove dirt and stain easily. So, if you have pots or pans that should be cleaned deeply, then you can use these elements.

All you have to do is to take water, vinegar, and baking soda into the pot or the pan and soak it for a few hours. After that, scrub the surface with a scrubber. You can also use a spatula or a spoon for doing it. Once you are done, then rinse the pan off and let it dry.

You can just also use baking soda if you don't have vinegar. Just sprinkle the soda all over the pan and rub it for a few minutes. Then rinse it off and dry just like before.

2. Use sugar cubes

You might be thinking of how the sugar cubes work. Does it useful for removing sticky stains of pots? Well, there will be lots of questions like this.

But trust me, it works! Let me give you some clarifications.

Though you will be using sugar cubes, you can find rough edges of it. And it can help you more to remove the food that is stuck on the pan. That's why you need to take those ice cubes that have hard and rough edges.

And to start the procedure, at first, soak the pans, and the pots with water. The reason is if you use those cubes first, and then soak it with water, then the sugar might get dissolved and it loses its roughness.

After soaking the pots, remove the extra water from it and add sugar cubes. After that, scrub all over the surface with the sugar for a few minutes. Once you are done with scrubbing, and you can see the difference between before and after condition, then you have to rinse it off and air dry.

3. Clean with Lemon

Lemon is another ingredient that is quite good at removing stains. It can also remove the crusty pan and pot. The acid in the lemon works magically to remove unwanted stains. By using lemon, it not only can remove the dirt but also make it smell fresh.

For cleaning the greasy pans, at first, take lemons and cut it into some small pieces. Then take the pan or the pot that has burnt and pour some water in it. Start the flame and boil it for a few minutes.

Once the water is boiled, then take the pieces of lemon and start scrubbing it all over the area. It can erase all the grease of the pan and will look as new as before.

4. Dryer sheet method

If you don't have a scourer, you can use dryer sheets instead of it. Yes, you heard it right. It's a confusing thing that it will work or not but it works effectively.

And for doing this method, you will need dryer sheets, dish soap, warm water, and a brush. At first, pour some dish soap on the surface of the pan. Then add some hot water on it, especially on those areas that are covered with grease.

After that, take the dryer sheet and submerge it in the water completely. Let the sheet sit properly. After a few hours, remove the sheet from the pan and you will see it can peel off all the grease of the pan. It's super simple and doesn't need any scrubbing.

5. Clean with Rhubarb

Using rhubarb is a traditional way to get rid of stubborn stains of pan or pot. It's an effective way that can remove grease, oil, and food that are being stuck on the surface.

And for cleaning pans with rhubarb, at first, you need to make rhubarb and put it in the pan. Then boil it for about 10-12 minutes. When the boiling is over, then remove it, and clean it with plain water. That's it. It's the easiest procedure that you can try to clean all the grease and make it a brand-new one.

6. Boiling method

The other reliable technique to remove stains is the boiling process. It can grab all the sticky food and grease out from the pan and remove all the germs too.

And to do the boiling method, you will need baking soda. Take the burnt pan or pot, and put some soda in it. Then add some water and start the boiling.

When the water will be boiled, it can take all the grease out from the pan and you will have a shiny, new-looking pan by this simple technique.

7. Salt and dish soap

There is another amazing way to transform your burnt pan into a brand-new pan. And for doing it, all you need is salt and dishwashing liquid.

Take the ingredients and mix well. The consistency will be like a thick paste. Once you are done with making the paste, put it to a dry cloth and clean the surface of the pan with it. You have to make sure that you won't scrub the surface too hard. It can damage the texture of the pan.

If you feel that you need to scrub more, then add more salt and keep gently scrubbing it. Once the stains are gone, wash it off with plain water and it's enough.

Final Verdict

You saw the amazing cleaning hacks that can remove all the grease and dirt from the pots, and pans. Apply any of the methods and you will surely get the better result.

Though burnt pan is tough to clean and make it like a brand-new one, we shared different effective ideas with you. Let us know which one is your favorite.

Title: How to Wash Sunbrella Fabric in Washing Machine
Content:
Do you have the trouble of how will you wash Sunbrella fabric? Though it is a different kind of fabric, having troublesome thoughts are usual. That's why you should figure out the solution to it. And we are here to help you out.

Sunbrella is a fabric that has different types of features. It is UV, water, and stain-resistant. That's why it doesn't gather lots of stains, and makes it dirty. But when something makes it dirty then you have to clean it up. And for doing so, you need to follow some methods. As you know, there are lots of washing methods that can help clean this mess. You can do it yourself by applying some home solutions with your hands.

But these are being troublesome and it creates a lot of mess. That's why cleaning it in a washing machine is the easiest option you can ever find. There are some techniques for cleaning Sunbrella fabric in a washing machine that we are going to share with. Let's dive right into it and check it out how things are going to happen.

What is Sunbrella fabric?

Sunbrella fabrics are a type of fabric that is made from a 100% solution of dyed acrylic. It is water, and UV resistant. The fabric is stain resistant, and fade-proof. All the things make it more durable and long-lasting.

If we compare it with other fabrics, we can see that it is of high-quality textile, it is easier to clean, and also dry out as it is water-resistant. The weather and sun don't affect the materials of it. This fabric is designed to make it like that. And it is breathable too. That's why you can feel completely comfortable when you are on it.

Moreover, it can prevent damages, scratches, and also cut. The material of it is quite good as it has a 303 fabric guard. It is also mold and mildew resistant. It's generally used for outdoor decor as it has a sun-resistant facility. It's a well-known fabric all over the world because of its long-lasting, and stain-resistant feature.

Further, it is not only available in one color or material. You can find several designs, and colors for organizing your place. Nothing can make your outdoor look as stunning as this fabric can. In a sense, it is the best outdoor decor fabric one could ever have.

How to Wash Sunbrella Fabric in Washing Machine With Simple way

Cleaning your Sunbrella isn't a tough work to do. It's even easier than any other fabric. The reason is, it is stain-resistant, and it eventually doesn't get that much dirt. However, cleaning it in the washing machine is much easier. You don't have to do lots of things. You just put that fabric in that machine and simply wash it.

But there are some techniques for doing it. If you can do it in the right way then you will get better results of it. So, let's see what the methods are and how you should follow these instructions step by step.

Step 1: Select the right fabric

At first, you have to think if the fabric is suitable for cleaning in the machine or not. Not all types of fabric are appropriate for cleaning in machines. First, you need to think if the fabric that you want to clean can be cleaned in a washing machine or not. Besides, some Sunbrella fabrics are not suitable for this process. It can damage the design, and texture of it.

As you can see, Sunbrella Upholstery's type of fabric won't be suitable for machine-cleaning. You need to wash it by your hands. But the one that has a removable facility, can be washed in machines. Like, the cushion covers or other stuff that has zippers with it can be cleaned easily in the machine.

Step 2: Washing process

When you are washing those fabrics that have zippers, then make sure you close it before putting these in the machine. Once you are done with it, then you should put all the fabrics in the machine on a cold wash cycle. Then add a mild laundry detergent in it. You can also add a cup of bleach and let the machine start. Let it be for some time until the cleaning process is being finished.

Step 3: Drying it out

After finishing the cleaning process, bring all the fabrics away from the machine. Then let it be for some time to get all the excess water out. After that, you need to dry all the things out. To do the things out, you need to dry it in the air.

Make sure you won't use any kind of electric dryer to do the process. This can make the fabric too hot, and thus, damage it. This will harm the material, and its quality too. Simply let it be for some time until it dried out completely.

Tips

1. Don't use any dryer Try to dry it out. You just have to dry it in the air.

2. Make sure you let the zippers open while cleaning it

3. You can use a sponge or soft towel to deeply clean it.

4. Don't use too much detergent. It can damage the texture of it.

5. If you find a severe stain, then you can gently rub it after taking out the fabric from the machine.

Wrap Up

If you don't want to create a lot of mess then cleaning the Sunbrella fabric in the washing machine will be a good option. And that's why we are sharing some effective ways to wash it like that. We hope that it will help you while doing the procedures. Try this out and make sure you will correctly follow the rules.

And this way, you can wash Sunbrella fabric in the washing machine easily. But you also have to make sure that you won't do it excessively. This might harm the texture of the fabric and make it faded. Besides, don't run the machine for too long.

Also, use the mild detergent for a mild wash. Avoid using bleach if the stain isn't too much. But if the stain is severe, then you have to rub it after the mild washing. Follow the steps and apply them well. This will surely give you an appropriate result that you want.

Resources:

https://www.ballarddesigns.com/howtodecorate/2013/07/how-to-care-for-sunbrella-fabrics/

Title: How to Clean Baseboards with Dryer Sheets?
Content:
You might know a lot of things to clean baseboards. But do you ever think about using dryer sheets for doing the cleaning? YES, you heard it right, dryer sheets!

You might be thinking, it's not the purpose why the sheets are made. Thinking it is right but exploring all the other methods is also important. We are human and exploring different things is in our blood. So why not here?

And by exploring, we get to know that using dryer sheets are useful for cleaning many things. It's also great for cleaning baseboards. Let's see what the methods are and how you will do it in a proper way!

Method of cleaning baseboards with dryer sheets

The ingredient that you will need is simple. You will just need a box of dryer sheets. And that's it! That will be enough for a basic cleaning. But, you can also use the other types of methods too. Let's see the entire process of dryer sheets to clean baseboards completely.

Step 1: Wiping out

For getting started, at first, grab the dryer sheets. After that, wipe the places of the baseboards with that sheet. It will reduce the dirt by dusting off nicely. Do it for some time and you will see how the sheet can easily clean all the areas, and that's why it will become dust-free.

Step 2: use a brush

After dusting all the dirt off, now you can use a brush to get rid of the dirt completely. Using a brush is not compulsory. If you don't have a brush then you can surely skip it. All you need to do is to dust the dirt off properly no matter which equipment you use.

Step 3: use the Swiffer-type mop

You can also use a Swiffer-type mop to get the better results. It's an optional thing so that you can skip it if you don't have it. But if you have a Swiffer-type mop, then simply attach the dryer to the bottom of the head of the mop and start using it. That will be quite effective and give better cleanings too.

That's it! All these steps are enough to clean the baseboards quickly and effectively. But there are lots of other facts that are equally important to know before you are thinking about using dryer sheets to clean the baseboards. Let's see what they are!

Can you reuse the dryer sheets?

When it's about fabric softener sheets, then yes, you can reuse it. Generally, dryer sheets can be used for at least two times. The sheets are made like this so that you can do the best use of it.

Dryer sheets can do an amazing job for removing dirt, and the other kinds of annoying things that are tough to remove.

If you want to make the best use of it, then you can use it four times. It will be safe to use. But you need to do it in the right way. And when you are going to do it, you should cut a little bit of a corner every time you use it. That will help to get the proper use easily.

How to reuse it?

Fabric softener sheets are useful to remove pet hair or any kind of dirt from clothes, baseboards, or other kinds of stuff in an easy way. When dust builds up, dryer sheets help to reduce and remove it and make it a new one without taking much trouble.

And to reuse it, you can find several reasons as it is used for different purposes. When you are done with cleaning the baseboards with a sheet, now what should you do? You can now clean the dirt from the other types of places of materials.

You can clean the dust of your windows, wipe out the screen of your phone, computer, and television. The other thing you can do is to clean some small furniture like shelves, rack, and many other things like that. Dryer sheets are wonderful for cleaning stuff and make it a shiny, and new one. That's why you should definitely try to do it.

Is using dryer sheets the easiest way to clean baseboards?

As you can see through the procedures that using dryer sheets for cleaning baseboards is an effective as well as quick process. The reason is, you don't need to make a solution to do it. Also, you don't need to take any preparation for this if you are using dryer sheets.

That's why you can consider this method as the quickest way to get rid of dirt. Although there are different other kinds of methods too such as baking soda solution, or vinegar solution and the other homemade solutions like these, this will take much time and effort. Compared to that, using dryer sheets is more useful and gives you less trouble than any other methods.

Is dusting important before cleaning?

When you are doing the procedures of cleaning baseboards, there are some certain things that are important. And one of those important things is to dust off all the dirt first.

The reason why this is so important is, if you won't dust all the dirt off and you will start cleaning that area anyway, then you won't get the better result. You have to dust off to get rid of excess and unwanted things that are on the baseboards.

Besides, if you use a homemade liquid solution, then it will get worse. And the entire process will go in vain as it will create things messier.

And for avoiding all the things and also to clean the baseboards perfectly, you need to dust off first. It will make things easier and you can get new and shiny baseboards like before. Moreover, it will save the texture of baseboards. That's why dusting off is a must.

Are Dryer Sheets safe?

While using a new product or experimenting a new method, several things will roll on your mind. But the most serious and important thing is the safety of it.

And though you are using dryer sheets, you have to be careful of its safety. There are some dryer sheets that are made of toxic chemicals. Some health experts describe that this kind of sheet can be dangerous.

The problems that you might face while using this kind of toxic sheet are, it can irritate the eyes, create rashes to the skin, and even give migraine, and asthma attacks.

But you have to understand that not all chemicals have side effects. Besides, there are some non-toxic dryer sheets that can be found nowadays. You can also get this kind of product. It will be safer than the other one for sure.

But in an overall sense, dryer sheets won't affect you much. Even it will make your work easier. That's why you can consider it as an ideal way to use dryer sheets for cleaning baseboards.

Overall, it's a safe and fast way to remove dirt from the baseboards and you can use it without taking much tension.

Tips

1. Throw dryer sheets away when you will finish your work.

2. Don't over-use it.

3. Try to get the non-toxic dryer sheets for better safety.

4. Dust off and wipe out well to get the perfect results.

Wrap Up

We have talked about all the things that we knew about using dryer sheets for cleaning baseboards. We also read the different purposes of using this thing and how you also can reuse it. In a sense, dryer sheets got more facilities.

And making it work is your responsibility. No matter where you use those sheets, you have to use it correctly. That's why you need to know the details about dryer sheets first.

Know all the details well and then start experimenting with it. It is because safety should be the first priority. So, know all the details, use it well and don't forget to share your experience with us.

Title: Cleaning Car Seats with Baking Soda: A Complete Guideline
Content:
Owning a car is the dream of every person. Nowadays, it has become a necessity instead of a luxury. The maintenance and cleaning of a vehicle play a vital role in keeping the charm of it.

For example, if your car seats are dirty, it will minimize the beauty of the vehicle and ruin your impression on others. There are a lot of methods for cleaning car seats, but an effective and economical way is to use baking soda for this purpose. So, let us find out how to clean car seats with baking soda:

What will you need?

To deep clean car seats with baking soda, here are some necessary things you will need:

- Spray bottle which is empty and clean

- A new toothbrush, you can use a broad scrub brush too, but a toothbrush is preferable.

- A clean towel, you can use micro fabric cloths for better results.

- 1/4 cup of baking soda is enough to clean a seat.

- One cup of water, warm waters are more useful.

You need a spray bottle, towel, a toothbrush to hold the solution, which is a mixture of baking soda and. of course, one cup of warm water. It will help you in removing bad smells from your car.

How to Clean Car Seats with Baking Soda

To remove the car seats, we must follow a simple procedure. It can be seat occupancy sensor, cushion, or the whole front seat, and it should be easy for you like car seats cleaning hacks if you follow this guide:

- Disconnect the battery first and move the position forward.

- Look at the end and locate the bolts in the back. If it has a plastic cover, then remove it to find the seat bolts.

- No matter what type of bolts you find, locate them at each of two-seat rails.

- Connect the battery and move the seats to the back.

- Then find bolts again and remove it in front of the seat rails.

- Disconnect the battery, lift the seats, and then disconnect the electric cables.

- Disconnect the cables back of the seats and remove them from the car.

- You can install the seat in the reserve order again.

How to clean your car seats with baking soda?

Baking soda is present in many homes due to its richness in antiseptic and antibacterial properties, which make them fantastic for removing stains, dragging dirt, neutralizing bad odors, and killing bacteria.

Ingredients

- A glass of baking soda

- The soap you use to wash clothes

- A vacuum cleaner.

- A sponge

Steps to follow

- First of all, vacuum the seats and the mats to remove all the dust, to clean the upholstery with greater ease, and to obtain better results.

- Focus attention on the corners of the vehicle, as they tend to accumulate a large amount of dust and dirt.

- Then soak the sponge in water with laundry soap and drain it very well.

- Pass the sponge through the seats, rubbing gently to remove small stains and end the bad smell.

- Dry them and remove the moisture as soon as possible.

- When the upholstery is dry, prepare a homemade solution by pouring the baking soda into a bowl or glass.

- Wait some minutes. When the mixture has dried, the vacuum cleaner returns to be able to demolish the remains of bicarbonate.

If you want to keep your car seats in perfect condition, you should clean them frequently and avoid eating and drinking inside the vehicle.

We should also note the importance of acting quickly when the seat is stained to prevent dirt from adhering to the fabric and is impossible to remove.

Cleaning cloth Seats

Cleaning cloth seats are a little bit different because you have to use fabrics and have to do it carefully. Here is how to clean black cloth car seats:

- Firstly, mix the baking soda with a cup of warm water.

- Make it a solution, and make sure the mixture is dissolved.

- Take an empty spray bottle and put the solution into it. Spray bottles must be a fresh one.

- Let the solution to be dried up and then use a toothbrush to paste the solution in places you need.

- Use a micro fabric towel in scrubbing the paste and then wait a few minutes to dry it up.

Following this method will make sure that your seat is stainless and odor observing.

Cleaning leather Seats

- You must make a solution by mixing 250 milliliters of water with a quarter cup of baking soda.

- Then you should apply a minimum amount of this mixture on the leather seats of the car, rubbing with a toothbrush.

This is the best trick to remove tough stains because the bicarbonate has an extensive fiber. This mixture must be left standing for half an hour and then cleaned with a microfiber cloth.

Cleaning Upholstery Seats

- To begin, you will have to remove the car seats to be able to clean them comfortably and then dry thoroughly.

- You have to bicarbonate them on top and then rub them vigorously with a moistened brush.

- Then you have to remove all the bicarbonate carefully and let the seats dry. In the case that there are stains without removing, it can be affected again by repeating the process but only in that area.

This way, we will be able to clean the car and eliminate bad odors after the summer in a cheap and fast way, without using aggressive products or with allergens.

Cleaning Child Car Seats with Baking Soda

- Firstly, vacuum the seats and select up the crumbs and debris before washing.

- Spray the seat cover with the solution of baking soda and warm water and start deodorizing your seat and breaking down any visible stains.

- Then uproot the seat cover and wash it with a light detergent.

- While washing the seat cover, figure on the bottom. Turn the bottom the wrong way up over an outsized ashcan or call at the yard. Shake the seat or tap rock bottom for a moment or two to dislodge.

- If there any specks of dirt and debris remaining then you can urge them by using a vacuum cleaner.

- Then, Pull the seat cover out of the washer and hang it up to air dry.

- Use a wet wipe or a humid cloth with the sodium bicarbonate mixture thereon to wipe down the whole exposed seat surface and spray the straps liberally and rub them with the toothbrush.

- Let the seat cover to dry up and replace them within the car.

Cleaning Other Parts of Car with Baking Soda

Rather than cleaning the seats of your car, you can also use the value of baking soda by using it on other parts of your car. Here is how:
