- You can wash outside of your car by using baking soda. Moreover, you can rub away dirt and debris as well as shine your license plate, wiper blades, headlights, taillights, and also your side mirrors. After Finishing rubbing, scour it with water.

- Sprinkle bicarbonate of soda in your floorboard to remove any dirt and to absorb odors. Spay the bicarbonate of soda into the ground mats evenly, left it there for two hours, then vacuum the bicarbonate of soda up.

- If you keep baking soda in your vehicles to refresh the air in it have, and you will enjoy every bit of it.

Conclusion

When you have vehicles, you will have to wash or clean them regularly. Baking soda is an excellent solution to it as it is cheap, and you don't have to be an expert to clean your car parts through it. So, you should give it a try and use the benefits of baking soda to clean your car.

Title: How to clean your car seats with a Few Household products
Content:
Our cars are our best companions in everyday hustles. If it gets dirty then it makes your daily commute uncomfortable. So it’s important to keep your car seats clean. And luckily you don’t have to pay costly price to clean your car seats.You can do it easily with just a few household products. So to keep your car clean let ushelp you with somecar seat cleaning hackswith your everyday used household products.

 You can do it in so many ways. But we will shaare with you some easy ways which are also effective.

How to clean your car seats with a Household products

1.Cleaning your car seats with baking soda:

Though baking soda is an essential for baking but it has the ability to clean and freshen up things, it is a natural deodorizer and it helps to remove stains easily.

What you will need-

Here we will talk about the ingredients you will need to clean your car seats with baking soda.

You will need one fourth cup of baking soda, one cup of hot water, an empty bottle of spray, a big scrub brush and a clean fabric cloth or a towel.

Mix the one fourth cup of baking soda with one cup hot water. Then put it into the spray bottle. Vacuum all the dirt from the car seats.

Cleaning cloth seats:

Cleaning cloth seats with baking soda are super easy and it also deep cleans the car seats and removes the bad odor. Just spray the mixer of water and soda all over the seats. Remember to not spray the mixer a lot. It may fade the color of your cloth seats. Just spray enough to wet the dirt.

After spraying the soda, scrub it with the big scrub brush gently in circle motion. Then wipe the dirt with a clean fabric cloth or with a towel. And also remember to wipe it before it dries. Which will cause the dirt to sit back again. And after you finish wiping the dirt, use a dry towel and gently press it over the seats to drain the wet as much as possible. Keep the windows open and let the air do the rest drying for you.

Cleaning leather seats:

You need to be extra careful to clean the leather seats because the quality of leather is quite different from the cloth seats.

First remove the dirt and dust from the leather seats with a dry cloth or towel. Sprinkle the baking soda all over the seats and let it sit for about 20 to 30 minutes. Take a vacuum cleaner and vacuum the soda from all over the seats. If any hard stain is left sprinkle a little again over the stained area, rub it with a wet cloth and leave it for another few hours. Then wipe it off with a dumb cloth or towel. And finally smooth the area with a dry cloth.

After removing the stain apply some leather conditioner to protect the leather from any kind of damage.

2. Cleaning your car seats with vinegar:

Vinegar has a very strong cleaning power, it is also a good deodorizer, bacteria killer and it also takes care of your car seats fabrics.You will need a very few ingredients to make this cleaner. And you’ll be amazed to see the results. It works like a magic.

What you will need-

You’ll need one cup of vinegar, one cup of hot water and a few drops of dish liquid soap and a spray bottle.

Mix the ingredients together and put it into a spray bottle.

Cleaning cloth seats:

Cleaning your cloth car seats with vinegar is same as you did with baking soda. Spray the mixer all over the seats and use a scrub brush to scrub the dirt and stains. Then with the help of a wet cloth or cold water rinse all the soaps from the seats.Then again with the help of a cloth or towel try to dry the seats as much as you can.

Cleaning leather seats:

The vinegar mixer also works on leather seats. You just need to be a bit careful when cleaning. Do not use a scrub brush. A soft wet cloth will do its best wiping the dirt from your leather seats.

If the smells of vinegar disturbs your nose then keep the car windows open while driving and let the air drain the extra smell or you can add some essential oils with the mixers to avoid the vinegar smell.

3. Cleaning your car seats with detergent:

Detergent is a very used household product. And it has the ability to clean almost anything. You can use laundry detergent or any specific upholstery detergent you want.

What you will need-

Mix some detergent with warm water and take a fabric cloth or a towel.

Cleaning cloth car seats:

Apply the mixer directly on the stain and scrub it with a toothbrush or scrub brush then rinse the detergent from the seats with cold water or a wet towel. Dry the seats with a vacuum or keep the windows open and let the air dry the rest.

Cleaning leather car seats:

First you have to dust free the seats. Then apply the mixer all over the seats with care. Scrub the dirt and stains with a fabric cloth or sponge. Rinse the detergent with water or a towel.

You can also use toothpaste, lemon juice and rubbing alcohol to remove stubborn stains from your car seats but you need to be really careful in using these products because over application of these can damage the seats of your car.

Conclusion:

I hope these products will help you to clean your car seats with a Household products and make your car seats look like new again because we know it will. Every one of these products are available in your own house and are very cheap. So you don’t have to spend a lot and will get your desired clean car seats.

Title: How to Clean Baseboards without Bending Over?
Content:
Cleaning baseboards might seem tough, but trust me it's the easiest way that you can do. All you need to do is to follow the rules and maintain hygiene. Besides, if you are not able to bend over while cleaning this stuff or you want to do it as simple as possible, then you should know the tricks.

And what are the tricks? Is it effective? Well, to know the answers, let's check out all the stuff and see how it's being the easiest way.

Why do baseboards get so dirty?

Baseboards are made of a material that is used for interior decoration of a house. There are some real wood baseboards that are made from softwoods. And the boards are primed and painted nicely before attaching it to the walls.

That's the process of attaching the baseboards to the walls. But what process should you apply for keeping it clean? That's a necessary thing to know. But first, you have to know why and how the baseboards get dirty.

Though it's a household thing, that's why it's usual to get dirty easily. Suppose you are in your kitchen, and you are working and doing different stuff there. The place will surely get dirty and thus the baseboards might get dirty too.

They can catch food easily, and that's why the places will become greasy. There are some Mudroom baseboards that are also good at picking dirt. That's the reason the baseboards get dirty easily.

How to Clean Baseboards without Bending Over

You can do the cleaning process in several ways as it's simple and easy to do. But you have to work a little bit to get the perfect result. If you don't want to bend over and work more or you have a problem to bend over, then you have to apply the processes differently. Let's see what the different procedures are.

# Traditional way

Step 1: Dusting

First take a broom and clean the baseboards. And for doing that, simply take the broom and dust off the areas of the baseboards that are dirty.

This is the easiest way to get rid of dirt especially when you have no vacuum cleaner. Try to purchase that broom that has longer handles. That's why you don't have to bend over while doing this.

And to do it in the right way, first sweep the baseboards a couple of times. After that, collect all the dust and put all of that in a bin. Make sure you dust off the areas nicely to get into the next procedures.

Step 2: Vacuum

When you have a vacuum, you don't need to worry at all. It will make your work easier for sure. And you can use both broom and vacuum for better results.

For cleaning all the dust properly, you can use an upholstery brush. It will help to catch all the dust in an easy way. That's why it will be helpful for you too.

And for avoiding the bending over, you need to take that vacuum cleaner that has a long wand. It can help you to not bend over when you will clean the baseboards. You can also use detachable attachments to reach hard places and to clean the toughest part of it easily.

Step 3: Wiping Out

After doing the dusting and vacuuming properly, you need to wipe the places to clean it. Dusting and vacuuming might be able to catch the upper level dirt. But wiping can clean the places completely. You can also do it by hand, and that's why you can clean the way you want.

And for doing it, you can use baby wipes. Take baby wipes and wipe the places appropriately. Make sure you will wipe out the corners too. There should be no dirt remaining on the surface.

Moreover, you can simply use thin clothes to do this. Take the cloth and soak it in water. Then take it off from the water and remove all the excess water as well. After doing it, do the same process just like the previous descriptions.

Step 4: Make the solution

After cleaning with wipes, now it's time to make a solution that can deeply clean the baseboards. And the traditional way to make a cleaning solution is easy.

And to make the solution, all you need to do is to take a bucket and add warm water into it. After that, add your preferable cleanser, and mix it well. Make sure the cleanser is totally chemical free.

Further, there is a soap called Dawn dish soap that has a quality that can easily remove grease of baseboards, sinks, floor, dishes and places like that.

You can add Dawn dish soap or just the regular dish-washing soap into the water. You have to take 4-5 drops of Dawn dish soap into the warm water and mix well before you use it. That's it! The homemade cleaning solution is ready to use.

Step 5:  Cleaning

When you are done with making the solution, now you have to use it in a proper way. And to do it, you need to take a thin and soft cloth to soak it in the solution. After being properly soaked, you have to remove all the excess water and then start the cleaning process.

Start cleaning the baseboards from one place to another. You need to clean it in back and forth motion. That will be helpful for removing stains and grease as well. After cleaning it well, you have to wipe it out so that there will be no water remaining, and it can dry it out easily.

Cleaning Baseboards with vinegar

Vinegar is a quick and effective solution for removing stains, dirt and greasiness. That's why you can also use this ingredient for removing grease on baseboards.

And for using it, just take warm water in a bucket. Then add any kind of liquid soap and vinegar into it. You can also add some drops of essential oil of your favorite fragrance. Then mix the mixture well and use as usual.

It's an effective way to get rid of dirt, stain, and grease of the baseboards. It's a simple way so that you can easily do the processes.

Clean with a microfiber cloth

Microfiber cloth can do an amazing job for removing dirt, stain and grease. When you are using microfiber cloth, you can catch dirt easily. The reason is, microfiber cloth is effective to collect small particles of dust. That's why you can get effective results while using it.

And for doing complete use of it, the process is just like before. You just need to dip the microfiber cloth into the cleaning mixture and remove access water. After that, wipe out the areas that are looking dirty and greasy. After cleaning the areas properly, let the places dry.

Tips

1. Make sure you remove all the dust easily before starting the cleaning with liquid.

2. Use the detachable attachments of vacuum to get into the tough-to-reach places and clean it well.

3. Don't use lots of water for cleaning the baseboards. It can damage the texture.

4. You can use a dry-cleaning sponge to gently scrub the entire area. But make sure you won't scrub the places too hard. You just need to scrub the baseboards once or twice in a year.

5. Make sure you take that broom that has a long handle. It is because it can help you to clean easily without bending over.

Wrap Up

Well, you saw earlier what the tricks are and how you can apply these tricks in an easy and appropriate way. You don't need to do it the exact way. But you need to do it effectively. Also, you must maintain hygiene. That's how you can clean the baseboards properly and keep it as new as before.

So, check the techniques and try it out if you have dirty baseboards.

Title: How to clean Bug Zapper?
Content:
Do you have a bug zapper in your house to kill insects? And you used it for some days after purchasing it, and now it's time to clean it up. But you have no such idea how you will do that.

Well, cleaning it out isn't that tough. But all that matters is doing it correctly. Otherwise, you can damage that device, and you won't be able to use it for so long. To clean it properly, let's see what those easy steps are and how you will use it for getting appropriate results.

What is a Bug Zapper? 

A bug zapper is known as an electronic device that is being used for killing insects. It has an electric discharge insect control system that helps to find the insects and kill them. As we all know, insects are something that annoys, and bite you. Some are even eating your food, damage your furniture, and other important stuff of your house.

When you are living in an area, it's natural there will be insects around you. And though it harms you and your things as well, you need to kill to get rid of them. And at that time, you will need a device that will easily kill them.

There are different kinds of insects around us. But it won't be possible to kill all of them with our hands. That's the reason you need to use a tool that will do it without much trouble. And bug zapper is the one that ensures to kill all of it electrically. That's the reason why the bug zapper is generally used for.

How does a Big Zapper work?

Though it is an electronic device, it works through electricity. There is a UV light bulb that helps to grab the insect. The high voltage electrical wire is used for attracting the bugs into it.

There is a plastic or a metal cage that is placed inside the zapper. This cage is used for storing the insects and kill them. Besides, ultraviolet light is being emitted from the fluorescent light bulb. It will help to attract insects easily. Just like they are attracted to the flower patterns because the UV light reveals it. And this technique is also used in the zapper that ensures all the insects are going inside the cage and stuck in it.

Now, you might have some confusion whether it works or not. The answer is, YES! It works. You don't have to take any doubt about its effectiveness. But the better question should be whether it can kill the most annoying bugs or not.

Well, not all types of bugs can be killed through this device. There are other kinds of biting bugs that are not possible to be killed. But you can kill most of the bugs through the electricity of this zapper.

Methods of how to clean Bug Zapper? Step by step

You saw the working process of this bug zapper. But after killing lots of insects with this device, one thing is compulsory, and that is to clean the zapper properly. Knowing all the facts about cleaning the mess is as important as knowing the process of using it. The reason is, if you won't do the cleaning process in the right way then you won't be able to use it for long. It will be damaged, and won't work properly.

Besides, as it is an electronic-based device, you need to clean keeping that fact in your head. Let's get the methods of cleaning it with any further delay. But before proceeding with those steps, you will need:

  • Mask
  • Gloves
  • Vacuum cleaner
  • Toothbrush
  • Canned air (you can use a hairdryer instead of it)
  • Garbage can
  • Liner bag

Step 1: Set your place

At first, decide where you want to do the cleaning process. It would be best if you go outside to clean it no matter the zapper is inside the house or outside. It is unnecessary to clean the zapper somewhere inside the house and make a mess. That's why you should choose a place outside of your house, and then start the cleaning procedures.

After that, you have to prepare your cleaning supplies. Also, take garbage cleaning can, vacuum cleaner, dryer, and all the other stuff to that place and make these things prepared.

Step 2: Use safety equipment

Safety is a compulsory thing in any procedure. And in the cleaning thing of the bug zapper, you also need to take safety first. That's why before proceeding with any procedures, put your mask and gloves on.

Besides, you should be safe before doing the cleaning thing because the entire clean-up is full of germs. And inhaling the bad smell of dead insects can be an unhealthy thing. That's why you must wear that safety mask and gloves if you are going to do the cleaning process on your own.

Step 3: Remove the bugs

Once you are done with all your safety thing, now it's time to clean the dead bugs. Make sure you unplug the zapper before doing it. Take the tray and clean all the debris with a toothbrush, and transfer it to the trash can.

You should use a vacuum cleaner to clean the remaining garbage. You can also wipe out all the places by using a paper towel. And if the wiping-out doesn't work well, then you can use white vinegar instead of water.

Step 4: Replace it

After finishing all the cleaning, now it's time to replace it in place. Reassemble all the parts together. Make sure no moisture remains on any part of the zapper. Dry it well, and then correctly assemble all the parts.

Lastly, collect all the supplies, and the other equipment and store it properly. After that, plug it in, and that's all you have to do.

Final Thoughts

As we all know, a bug zapper is used by electricity, and it's quite effective too. As it is an electronic device, you should clean appropriately. You have to keep it clean when needed. It can extend the life of the device, and you can use it longer than before.

That's why you should be careful about cleaning it so that you can use it to get rid of harmful and annoying insects and to be protected.

Title: Steam Cleaner for Curtains and Upholstery
Content:
What is that one device that makes your cleaning easier? Can you guess? Well, it's a steam cleaner. And if you face any problem of cleaning things like curtains and upholstery, then the steam cleaner for curtains and upholstery will be the best option.

There are several types of steam cleaners such as handheld, vapor, steam vacuum, garment, commercial, cylinder, steam mops, multi-purpose, and many other types of steam cleaners that you can find.

Have a look at what the cleaners are that will be suitable for cleaning curtains, and upholstery and how you should use it.

Types of steam cleaners

There are several types of steam cleaners that are available out there. But we are going to describe some of them that are extremely good at cleaning curtains and upholstery. Let's take a look at the varieties of some of the excellent steam cleaners to get the specific idea.

1. Handheld Steam Cleaner

If you are a person who wants a portable steam cleaner, then you can choose the handheld one. It's a lightweight product and easy to use, so it can go through tough places as well.

Further, it's a great product for using it for sanitizing. It can remove dirt and debris, and kill all the germs and harmful bacteria.

So, you can say, it's a wonderful product to keep the upholstery clean, and it's safe too. So, if you want a safer steam cleaner, then the handheld one will be the best choice. Though it has a deodorization formula that can clean the places, and also remove the odor, it will be a suitable one for cleaning upholstery.

So, overall, we can say, it's a proper steam cleaner, and if you want a good-quality cleaner for your own, then the handheld cleaner will be the one.

2. Garment Steam Cleaner

Garment steam cleaners are the type of devices that are basically used for ironing clothes. It helps to remove the wrinkles and straighten out any kind of clothes and fabrics. It's kind of a clothing iron but it can also be used as a steamer.

Although it's a clothing steamer iron, it can also be used for cleaning the curtains. The steaming process of this product has the ability to clean the curtains properly. You can also try this out for cleaning upholstery.

Overall, it's a good one to use for several purposes including curtains. The usage of a garment iron and steam cleaner is almost similar. That's why you can use it without any doubt. Moreover, it's also useful for silk, satin, polyester type of fabrics. So, in a sense, it's a good one.

3. Cylinder Steam Cleaner

Cylinder steam cleaner is also known as a canister steam cleaner. It has a large size compared to the other types of cleaners. And the reason for this kind of size is the water tank that is included with it. And that's why the weight is also getting heavy.

Besides, You can use it for cleaning upholstery. It might be difficult to manage this cleaner for its heavy kind of weight. But apart from that, it's a versatile steam cleaner that can easily be used in different places. Besides, it's useful for removing bacteria. It's effective for sanitizing the areas that you want to clean.

And last but not the least, you can use it for a long time as it has a large tank. It's an expensive type of product but overall it works well.

4. Vapor Steam Cleaner

Vapor steam cleaners are the one that can easily clean the dirty places. It's effective because it has an easy-drying facility. So, if you want this feature for your easy working, then you can choose this one.

Moreover, it's almost the same as the cylinder steam cleaners. You can get the same benefits with this too. But the easy-drying facility is the difference, and an extra advantage. It maintains versatility. You can use it to clean several places. You can use it for cleaning upholstery.

It's also very efficient at killing bacteria and germs. So, you can take it without a second thought.

Using procedures of Steam Cleaners

We are trying to give you the proper description of some kinds of steam cleaners. Now, check the procedures of those cleaners to get things clearer.

1. Method of using Handheld Steam Cleaners

As you know, handheld steam cleaners are portable, and easy to use. So, you don't have to take much pressure to use it. Let's take a look at the simple steps to use the steam cleaner.

Step 1

First, you need to attach the nozzles. There could be several types of nozzles that are included with the machine. But choose the preferable one that you will need and then attach.

Step 2

After that, fill the unit with water. Make sure you will detach the plug while filling.

Step 3

Then connect the plug, and you will see the steaming process goes on. When it's ready, then switch on the steam button and start cleaning.

Step 4

After finishing the cleaning process, make sure you switch off the plug. Detach the nozzles and clean it.

2. Method of using Garment Steam Cleaners

Garment steam cleaners have a different way of using. Have a look at this.

Step 1

In this first step, you need to fill the tank with water. It will get the steam ready quickly.

Step 2

Connect the plug so that it can start heating.

Step 3

Run the steamer on the curtains or any dress. But make sure it's hanging.

Step 4

After finishing the steaming, let it dry.

Step 5

Switch off the plug to detach the power connection.

3. Method of using Cylinder Steam Cleaners

Though it's a heavyweight device and large in size, you need to use it by maintaining some rules. Let's see what these are.

Step 1

First, get the tank filled with water.

Step 2

Attach the handheld component according to your task.

Step 3

Heat the cylinder for about 2-3 minutes.

Step 4

After that, take it and clean the places you want.

Step 5

Unplug the cleaner when you are done.

4. Method of Using Vapor Steam Cleaners

A cleaner that is great for cleaning, needs a proper way to use. See the rules that you should follow for a perfect cleaning.

Step 1

Attach the jet nozzle according to your cleaning task.

Step 2

Pour water in the tank.

Step 3

Plug in to get the steamer connected.

Step 4

Now, let it be for a couple of minutes to heat the water properly.

Step 5

Now, allow the machine to work in an appropriate way to make the places clean.

Step 6

Clean the steamer to get rid of all the dirt.

How to clean curtains with a steam cleaner?

When you are using a steam cleaner to clean the curtains of your house, you need to follow some rules. Let's check the method and learn how you can clean the curtains without getting them off from the wall.

Step 1

Read the manufacturer's instructions before you are going to do any cleaning.

Step 2

Then, turn on the machine and start doing the cleaning from top to bottom.

Step 3

If you are noticing that the curtains are being watery because of the steam, then try to do the cleaning a bit far from the curtains.

Step 4

Turn off the machine when you are done with cleaning.

How to Clean Upholstery with a steam cleaner?

When you are going to clean the upholstery, you need to do it with much care. Though it's a tricky task to clean upholstery but you can do it properly if you maintain the rules. Let's see what the method is.

Step 1

Select the suitable steam cleaner for upholstery. You can use a cylinder steam cleaner for better service.

Step 2

Read the instruction manual to know the suitable procedure for cleaning your type of fabric of the upholstery.

Step 3

Start the steamer and do the cleaning carefully.

Step 4

Turn it off and get it cleaned after finishing the cleaning process.

Curtains and Upholstery Tips

  1. Read the instruction manual first before getting into any process.
  2. Make sure the tank is necessarily full.
  3. Heat the steamer properly.
  4. Clean the brush and the nozzles of the steam cleaner after the process is over.

Final Verdict

We have tried to let you know almost all about steam cleaners. We hope that you will get some benefits by knowing all the things. Research about the other types of steam cleaners as well. There are lots more than those. And according to your job that you are going to do, you need to pick one among them.

Let's hope for the best. And don't forget to share your experience with us.

Title: How to Clean Sperry Topsiders?
Content:
When you have sperrys but it gradually becomes older, you might think, what should I do to clean it? Or, what should I do to make it a new one? Well, it must be done by maintaining certain rules.

There are several types of cleaning procedures that can easily clean sperry topsiders but you should apply that one that can do both cleaning and protecting. The reason is the material of it. A wrong type of procedure can damage the texture.

That's why maintaining all things is important. Let's see what the effective ways are and how they can do the entire procedure.

How to Clean Sperry Topsiders?

For doing the whole method, there are some ingredients that you will need to prepare before going through the technique of cleaning.

And for doing that, you will need:

  • Baking soda
  • Leather protective spray
  • Leather brush (use a toothbrush instead)
  • Leather cleaner
  • Leather conditioner
  • A clean cloth

Step 1: Laces out

If you have laces with your sperry topsiders, then you need to remove it first. The reason is, if you won't detach the laces then you will face difficulty while cleaning it.

Though the laces are made of rawhide, that's why these things have to be cleaned properly. And that's why you need to do it differently. It is because the texture of the lace is different.

Besides, you have to clean the laces first before cleaning the entire shoe. And to do it, you will need to follow the rules correctly.

At first, take the laces out carefully from the sperry topsiders. Then put the laces into a bowl and add dish soap and cold water. Soak it for some time, and then rinse it off after cleaning. Leave the laces for a day to air dry properly.

Step 2: Loosen the dirt

The next step will be the cleaning of the shoe. And the first step should be the cleaning of the dirt that shows on the upper level.

If you find loose dirt that can easily be cleaned out then you must do it. And for that reason, you need a brush. You can use any kind of leather brush. But if you don't have that kind of brush then you can use an alternative. And the alternative can be any other kind of brush-like toothbrush.

Take that brush, and gently dust off the dirt from the surface. Make sure the brush has soft bristles. That will help you to get the dirt off easily without doing any harm to it. That's why you need to maintain the step and clean it like this.

Step 3: Use water and soap solution

For cleaning it properly, you can use any cleaner. Or, you can use a homemade remedy. After dusting off all the dirt out from the shoe, now it's time to deep clean it.

And to clean it in a proper way, at first, make a cleansing solution. And to make it, you need to take a bowl and pour mild dish soap and water. You can also add baking soda into it. Then mix all the things well until the entire ingredients get dissolved.

After that, take a microfiber cloth and soak it with the solution. Use the cloth to clean the surface properly. Clean it by doing a circular motion. But make sure you won't put much pressure on it.

After cleaning the surface completely, now wipe them out with another dry microfiber cloth and leave it for some hours to dry it out.

Step 4: Clean the soles

Cleaning the soles is as much important as cleaning the entire sperry. That's why you also should focus on this point.

Though the soles of the sperrys are important for easy wear, it also helps to give you much comfort when you are wearing it. But, the soles are the reason for the foot odor. That's why you need to clean it regularly. And when you are cleaning the entire sperrys well, you also should clean the soles too.

And for cleaning in an appropriate way, you need to follow some steps. The first thing you can do is, clean it by applying an effective homemade solution. And for doing it, take a leather cleaner brush or a toothbrush. Apply baking soda on it and gently scrub it with that toothbrush. When you see the stains are coming out, then rinse them off and let it dry.

Step 5: Apply leather care products

After finishing the cleaning with a liquid solution, applying leather care products is convenient. And for doing it, you need to take a leather conditioner. After cleaning, and before polishing, you have to apply the conditioner because it can make a protective layer on the leather surface.

Moreover, this step will protect the leather from further damage. That's why using it is important. And for using it on the sperrys, you need to follow some directions.

Take a soft cloth for doing it. Now, take a small amount of conditioner and apply it on the leather. Make sure you apply a thin layer so that it can absorb quickly. Now, let it be there to absorb. And that's why you need to let it sit for 15-20 minutes. And after that, take another dry cloth and remove the excess.

Step 6: polishing

After getting done with all the cleaning procedures, now it's time to give the sperrys a nice finish. And for doing that, you have to polish it. And for doing it, you will need to use shoe polish. It can give the sperrys a nice shine and a complete finish.

To use it, first, apply the polish on the sperry surface in a proper amount. Now, take a soft cloth and apply the polish all over the area in a wiping motion. You can also apply it in a clockwise motion so that all the effectiveness of the polish will go into the leather. It will help to absorb and thus it will give the sperrys a beautiful shine.

When the applying process is done, now take another soft and clean cloth and remove all the excess product from both the leather surfaces. Remove it by applying a counterclockwise motion. That's how the shoe will look shiny.

Step 7: Shoe buffing

Well, only polishing is not enough. If you want to give your sperrys an extra shine then you need to buff it out. It's also an important step for your shoes to look gorgeous and new. Also, it will protect the sperrys from further damages.

That's why you can use it for a long time. Besides, buffing will make the sperrys to look like new so that you don't need to buy a new pair and waste your money. All you need to do is, clean and polish it well.

And for doing it, you will need a microfiber cloth. Take the cloth and buff the shoes by doing It in a circular motion. Make sure you put direct pressure on the shoe. The reason is, it will help to make the surface look like new.

That's the reason you need to give the sperrys direct pressure. Moreover, you can also apply a few drops of water on the surface before buffing. That will give them an extra shine.

Step 8: Give complete protection

Cleaning the sperrys is important. But the most important thing is, clean it with care. It is because harsh cleaning can damage the entire surface. Besides, you need to take protective steps too. It is because it's important to protect your sperrys from further damages.

And that's why you have to be careful about all the things when you are cleaning. Also, you need to find out the prevention solution. It is because treating it in the right way, and protecting it is compulsory. You can do it in several ways.

The leather lotion is also a great solution to protect sperrys. Apply it onto the sperry surface to get an extra glow. Moreover, it will protect the surface from any kind of damage. It is because lotion has the power to give the sperrys surfaces extra moisture. And that can prevent the sperrys from scuffing and cracking.

That's why you need to give your sperrys total moisture so that they don't get dry. And that's how you will protect your pair of sperrys for a long time.

Tips to clean Sperry Topsiders

  1. Don't rush and don't put extra pressure on your sperrys. It might create breakage.
  2. After cleaning, allow them to dry it out properly.
  3. Use baking soda for the soles. It will make them fresh and remove odor.
  4. Don't scrub too hard with a toothbrush. Do it in a gentle way.
  5. Try to absorb excess moisture from the sperrys.

Wrap Up Sperry Topsiders

You can clean and make your old sperrys look like new. But that doesn't mean you cannot buy new pairs. But if you don't want to buy new ones right now, you can surely apply those methods to make your old and dull sperrys like a brand-new one.

But you need to be aware while applying these methods. It is because if you don't apply these in a correct way then it might make the sperrys worse than before.

That's why be careful when you are planning to do it. Be patient and try the method properly to get the perfect result.

Title: How to season cast iron grates on gas stove?
Content:
When you see, the cast iron grates are becoming rusty, what should you do then? Well, at that time, seasoning is the best option.

There are lots of techniques that you will find to clean iron grates of gas stove. But seasoning is something that works more effectively and effortlessly.

But how will it work? And how will you do that? That's the question you might be thinking about. Let's take a look at the entire process of cleaning the grates and compare them to know the best of all.

How to season cast iron grates on gas stove

For preventing rust, you can apply several types of methods. But above all the methods that are being used to clean cast iron, seasoning can be considered as the most useful one. Let's see what the seasoning process is, and also learn the other processes.

Method 1: Seasoning

You can consider seasoning as the most effective way of all. It can remove all the grease of the cast iron grates easily and make it clean. And for doing this process, you will need:

  • Any kind of fat (bacon grease, oil etc)
  • Water
  • A brush
  • An oven to heat the grates

Step 1

First, clean the entire area with a brush. You need to take water and spread it all over the area. Then take a stiff brush and clean the cast iron grates. You have to make sure that you cleaned the area properly. The reason is, it will be helpful to season the grates in an appropriate way.

Step 2

After that, take the fat that you choose to do the process and cover all the surface of the grate with it. Make sure you won't miss any place. And once you are done covering it with fat, then you need baking the grates. Bake the grate at 350°F for about 30-40 minutes.

Step 3

After baking it for once, now let it be there to cool down properly. After that, grease it again just like you did before. And then re-bake at 450°F for another 30-40 minutes. You need to repeat the process until the grates become non-sticky and new-looking.

There are other types of techniques that you can apply to clean the iron grates. These are also effective and effortless tasks that you can do quickly and easily. Take a look at the techniques and see how these work.

Method 2: Cleaning with Degreaser

Cleaning the iron grates with degreaser is also an effective way. There are some steps and all you need to do is to follow them correctly. Let's take a look at the steps to know the method more specifically.

Step 1

At the first step, you need to soak the grates. Take a proper amount of degreaser and cover the grates well. You need to soak the grates well with degreaser. That will help you to remove all the dirt easily.

Step 2

After covering the grates in a proper way, let it sit for 20-30 minutes. You need to soak it according to the situation of the grates. But you have to make sure that the grates won't get dry out. And if it does, then you need to apply more grease.

Step 3

After 30 minutes, take a scrubber, and gently rub the surface. Make sure you scrub all the dirt away from it. And for doing it in a proper way, you need to take a proper scrubbing tool. And to do that, you can use a non-abrasive sponge. It can take away all the grease, and dirt. Moreover, it won't leave any scratches like the hard brushes.

Method 3: Vinegar

You can also use a vinegar solution to clean the grates easily. And for doing the processes, you will need:

  • Water
  • Vinegar

Step 1

Take an equal amount of water and vinegar in a spray bottle and mix those two things nicely. Spray the mixture all over the area and let it soak. The natural elements will be much beneficial for removing the grease. So, if you think the iron grates are getting dirty and it leaves light stains, then apply vinegar just like this.

Step 2

After spraying the mixture all over the surface, then you have to let the areas sit for 15-20 minutes. Soaking is necessary because it will help to get rid of the stains and you don't have to give a lot of effort to clean it.

Step 3

After completing the soaking process, now you need to scrub it. And for doing it, you will need a good-quality sponge. It is because if you use a hard sponge or brush, then it can leave scratches on the grates. You can also use a toothbrush to do the scrubbing. Gently scrub it well, and you are done. You can also repeat the process if you feel like doing it.

Method 4: Using Baking Soda

We all know how baking soda works great for removing any kind of stain. And just like that, it's also effective for removing stain from the iron grates. And for doing it, you need to follow some methods and apply these in a correct way. Let's see all the methods, and how you should apply these in an accurate way possible.

And the ingredients you will need is:

  • Baking soda
  • And water

Step 1

First, you need to wash the grates nicely. Take warm water and gently wash the surface with it. Make sure you do it in the right way. It will help you to remove all the stains quickly. Further, warm water helps to remove the upper level stain, and sticky dirt.

Step 2

Now you have to make the solution. And for making it, you will need baking soda and water. Take these two ingredients and mix it well to make a thick paste. After that, apply this paste on the surface of grates to clean it properly. Then cover the entire area with the paste and let it stand for 20-30 minutes. Baking soda helps the iron grates to deeply clean and remove the stains.

Step 3

Now, take a non-abrasive sponge and scrub the area. You don't need to scrub it too hard but make sure your gentle hands remove all the grease and crusty effect of the grates. After scrubbing it for a while, you have to rinse it off well to clean it properly.

How will you keep it looking new?

To get rid of the excess trouble of cleaning the iron grates, you need to keep it clean. The reason is, if you don't keep cleaning the surface then it will become more damaged and crusty. And this type of grates will be tough to clean.

Moreover, if you keep it clean regularly then you don't have to take much pressure and you can do the cleaning without wasting much time. Further, if you keep it clean often then it will always look like new.

And to do that, the most effective way will be the seasoning process. Grease the grates well and bake at the right temperature. It will deeply clean the iron grates that no other method can do. So, take this method as the most effective one and try it.

How to season cast iron grates on gas stove Tips

  1. Make sure you won't heat the oven at the wrong temperature.
  2. Maintain the duration of seasoning.
  3. Seasoning might leave some smell. So, try to apply these methods outside the house.
  4. Don't rub too hard. It might leave scratches to the grates.
  5. Grease well before getting into any other steps.
  6. Do not use any soap to clean it.
  7. Rinse and dry well for a complete finish.

Final Verdict

To sum up, let me tell you that you can apply any method you want. But make sure, whatever method you apply is effective and useful as well.

And when we talk about seasoning or baking, you need to know that this will surely clean the grates easily. You don't have to get into any dilemma and think whether you should use it or not. Moreover, if you want a deep cleaning, then this method works perfectly.

So, get the cleaning done whenever you feel like cleaning the grates is necessary. But don't apply this process often. Only use it when the grates become dirty and sticky.

Title: How to Get Rid of Creeping Charlie with Borax?
Content:
Having creeping charlie in a lawn is problematic. You can understand if you have this type of area. That's the reason you need to focus on removing it.

If the garden area is full of creeping charlie, it will damage the roots, and that's why the area will look awful. But if you can control its growth, you can get rid of it in an easy way.

And removing creeping charlie with borax is an amazing idea. So, let's dive right into the section to see what the procedures are and how you will do these things easily.

What is creeping charlie?

Creeping Charlie or the Glechoma hederacea is a plant that is harmful and can damage the entire lawn. It's a kind of perennial and aromatic creeper. It's called an evergreen plant.

Generally, it's known as creeping charlie, ground-ivy, tunhoof, alehoof, catsfoot, and many more. Creeping charlie is a mint type of plant. As you know, plants from a mint family can be used for several purposes. It can be used as a fresh herb, and you can eat it in salads. But creeping charlie is not edible at all but still a member of a mint family.

But it's used for making beer. You can feel a slight amount of bitterness. But overall, it smells amazing. Creeping charlie is an aggressive plant that grows slowly. It usually lives in a big area. Generally you can find it on your lawn.

But is keeping it in your garden safe? Or is it appropriate for your lawn? That's the question that you might think about. As you know that creeping charlie is an aggressive creature, you should avoid keeping it. Besides, you might face some problems if you have creeping charlie in your lawn. So, it must be avoided and that's why you should try to get rid of it.

Can borax kill creeping charlie?

There might be a question if borax is suitable for killing creeping charlie or not. Well, you might face a dilemma whether you should use it or avoid it. And for getting into a conclusion, you need to know about the effectiveness of borax.

Borax is a kind of thing that is basically sodium tetraborate. It's used for reducing the creeping charlie. But the best part is, it won't harm the grass.

As creeping charlie is an invasive perennial leaf, borax can form a toxic spot to the area that you spread the entire borax mixture. And that's how it can kill the creeping charlie. So, yes, it's true that using borax is an excellent idea to reduce and totally kill the creeping charlie weed.

And for that, you need to apply borax mixture when the leaves are just starting to grow. But make sure you won't use it excessively. It is because if you use it frequently then it can damage the grass too. The proper amount of using it should be once or twice in a year.

How to Get Rid of Creeping Charlie with Borax

Removing creeping charlie is not a difficult task to do. It's even easier than removing the other kinds of plants. All you need to do is to take the right steps. Though borax has an absolute weed reducing formula, it also has some side effects. But using it appropriately can harm the grass less.

To make a perfect solution in an easy way, let's take a look at the ingredients, and the methods that we are going to describe.

For making the solution, you will need

  • 10 oz. Twenty Mule Team Borax
  • 4 oz. (1/2 cup) of hot water

Step 1: making the mixture

At first, you need to mix all the things to make a solution. You need to take warm water and borax. Mix all the ingredients together. After that, dilute in 2.5 gal. water. It will be easy to mix the ingredients.

But if you face any difficulty, then you can use a blender and blend it for 20-30 seconds. That's it. It will mix all ingredients together in an easy way.  But it will be better if you use an old blender and avoid the regular one. The reason is, the borax can mix with the food when you will use the blender later for food preparation.

Step 2: Pour it

Once you are done with all the mixing and making, then you need to take a nice spray bottle. You can have a regular one if you have one in your house or you can get it from a store. Then pour all the mixture in a spray bottle and start the spraying process.

Step 3: Spreading

Now you have to take the bottle and spray it all over the garden area. Spray the homemade borax weed killer evenly all over the lawn and let it sit properly. That's enough. After a couple of weeks, you will see how the weed gets dry. And slowly, it will be dead. And you will feel your beautiful lawn without any creeping charlie.

How to control creeping charlie?

If you think that removing creeping charlie is a troublesome task then you need to be aware of from the very beginning. And for that reason, you need to control the creeping charlie, so that it won't grow in your lawn.

To control the creeping charlie, or any other type of weed, you need to keep cutting them off regularly. You also should pull those little plants out from the ground. You can also use a stand-up weeder to do this process. That's why you don't need to bend down, and you can save your back.

When creeping charlie exists in a garden, it can damage the roots of the grass, and thus, damage the entire area. That's the reason you should keep it away from your garden.

And to keep creeping charlie in control, you have to clean the garden area and pull all the weeds out from there. That's how you can control the creeping charlie and keep your lawn clean.

What should you do if you have no borax?

Imagine there's no availability of borax, what would you do then? Then you need to start the procedures differently.

There are lots of methods to kill the creeping charlie. You can choose any of them if you don't have borax or you don't want to use it. Let's see what you can do and how you will do it in an effective way.

Trimming

Trimming the leaves is the easiest way to get rid of creeping charlie. You don't have to do a lot of things to get rid of that. You just need the proper equipment to do that.

And for doing it, you need a good-quality trimmer. Take the trimmer and gently cut all the leaves out from the ground. You don't need to be too harsh while doing this. Just slightly trim the creeping charlie and throw them in a trash can.

You have to make sure that you won't leave any of the weed on the ground. It is because if you do it, it will automatically grow and again create problems.

Use Herbicide

Herbicide is a wonderful technique to get rid of creeping charlie and the other kinds of weeds too. And for doing it, you will need protective gloves, eyewear, garden spray, long-sleeved shirt, and pants.

Spray the herbicide when the leaves are growing. But we recommend you to apply it in the fall. That will give you better results for sure.

But make sure you won't use too much herbicide on the ground. You need to use a need-able amount of it. So that you can get the appropriate result.

Wrap Up

As you can see, using borax is completely an effective thing, and you can use it without taking much time.

Moreover, you can choose other options as well. But if you have borax in your house, you must apply this method to get the best result.

So, apply it in a right way, take good care of your garden and enjoy the blissful sight of it.

Title: How to Clean Memory Foam Sandals?
Content:
Sandals or shoes are the essentials of our daily life. And we need to use these on a daily basis. That's why it gets dirty quickly.

And that's why it should be properly cleaned after some days. But what is the easiest and effective way to clean it? And how to clean memory foam sandals easily? You have to know about all these things.

To get the proper idea of it and get rid of the confusions, let's see what the actual and effective processes are and how they will work.

Methods of cleaning memory foam sandals

When you are wondering what would be the right way to make your dirty sandals look like new, first you need to know what the right methods are. Moreover, you need to know what would be the effective method that works quickly.

To let you know how the methods work, let's get into the descriptions.

# Method 1: Soap and water

One of the easiest ways to wash your memory foam sandals is the soap solution. You can do it with some simple steps.

And when it's about washing memory foam sandals effectively, you need to know the steps first. Let's see what they are.

Things you will need:

  • Dish-washing soap
  • Water
  • A toothbrush
  • And a bowl

Step 1: Cleaning the sandals first

First, you need to wash the sandals to clean the upper level dirt. It is because that's how you can do the entire deep cleaning process easily.

Step 2: Making the cleaning solution

The next step should be the making of the solution that you will use for cleaning. And for that, take a bowl and pour dish-washing soap into it. Add a little bit of water and mix them well. That's how the solution will be ready to use.

Step 3: Scrubbing

After that, spread the solution all over the area of the sandals. Let it be soaked for some time. Now, take a toothbrush or any kind of brush and start scrubbing the whole area. Scrub it well so that the dirt can come out.

Step 4: Wash and dry

The final step will be the washing. Once you are done with scrubbing the sandals well, then you need to wash it with plain water. After that, let them dry and it will be easy to use again.

# Method 2: Baking soda

Baking soda is an incredible element to get rid of dirt and stain. And when it's about cleaning memory foam sandals, it will work amazingly. Let's check out the steps to be clearer about it.

The ingredients are:

  • Baking soda
  • Water
  • A toothbrush

Step 1: Wash with plain water

The first thing you need to do is to wash the sandals with clear water to get rid of the dirt that is present on it. Doing it is also important because it will make the surface level clean from dust and thus it will be easier to execute the further processes.

Step 2: Sprinkle baking soda

Now, take a generous amount of baking soda and sprinkle it all over the memory foam sandal area. After that, spray another layer of water and let it be soaked for some time.

Step 3: Scrubbing

After being nicely soaked, take a toothbrush and scrub the sandal surface nicely. Make sure you scrub all over the area in the correct way. Make sure you maintain a circular motion to do it.

Step 4: Rinse off and dry

Once you are done with scrubbing and when you see the stains are gone, now clean it with regular water. After that, leave the sandals in a place to air dry.

# Method 3: Use washing machine

Well, there is a debate about whether memory foam sandals can be washed in a washing machine or not.

Well, if you have time then you can avoid cleaning memory foam sandals in a washing machine. But if you are in a hurry and want to get all the work done in a fast way then this method will be your saviour. So, without any further delay, let's get into it to know more.

Step 1: Prepare the machine

Before going into the further steps, at first, you need to prepare the machine for washing. And that's why check the machine and add laundry detergent to get it ready. Moreover, see if the water temperature is proper or not, and according to it, you need to set it. And being done with all the settings, now start the machine.

Step 2: Put the sandals into it

When the machine is perfectly prepared,, take the sandals and put it into the machine. Set a timer and leave it in the machine until the time is over.

Step 3: Take the sandals out

Once the washing process is done, now take the sandals out from the machine. You can now add another hack and that is scrubbing. Take a toothbrush and scrub it if you want a better result. After that, let the sandals rest for air dry. You can also use a dryer for doing it fast.

# Method 4: Vinegar

Vinegar is another cleaning agent that is not only popular for cleaning but also for removing stains. It can be used for different purposes. Besides, it will also be helpful for memory foam too. But how it works! Let's check it out.

Things you will need:

  • Vinegar
  • Water
  • A toothbrush
  • A dryer

Step 1: Wash with plain water

First of all, you have to wash the sandals before getting into further steps. And to do it, you need to take plain and clean water and wash both the sandals with it.

Step 2: Soaking

The main thing you should do with white vinegar is to soak the sandals with it. Pour vinegar all over the area and then let both the sandals there to soak properly.

Step 3: Scrubbing

After being done with soaking, now it's time to scrub all the areas properly. And for doing it, take a toothbrush or any kind of stiff brush of your choice and start scrubbing all over the area for some time. Make sure you scrub it well until the stains come out appropriately.

Step 4: Drying

One thing you need to be careful of is, you have to avoid using water when you are using vinegar. Just simply dry it after all the cleaning process. And for that, you can use a dryer if you are in need of quick drying. Otherwise, you can simply air dry it.

# Method 5: Use magic cleaning sponge

If you want an immediate result and want to remove the stains of sandals, then you can use a magic cleaning sponge or a stain eraser. You can find it in any general store or online too. It's more like an eraser and it works effectively to remove the stains quickly.

To know more about it and how it will work, have a look at the steps carefully.

Step 1: Wet the sponge

First, take the magic stain eraser sponge and soak it well with plain water to make it wet. It will help you more if the sponge is being wet nicely. The more wet the sponge is, the more effectively it will work. So, let the sponge be wet properly.

Step 2: Application

Take the memory foam sandals and wipe the stained area well. Apply a circular motion while wiping out. You can also use a stain eraser marker and start doing the same thing.

Step 3: Drying

After applying the sponge or the eraser, now it's time for drying. When you see the stains come out properly, then you can leave the sandals like that. But you can also wash it properly. That will clean the whole thing properly and you can use new-like sandals again. And for drying, use a dryer or air dry it.

# Method 6: Hydrogen Peroxide

Hydrogen Peroxide is a well-known element that can remove any kind of stain especially from cloth. And when it's about cleaning the memory foam sandals, it also will be much helpful. But how it should be done! Let's learn it.

Step 1: Soak it with plain water

First of all, the sandals should be soaked in clear water for some moments. Soaking like this is important because it will help to get the benefits of hydrogen peroxide.

Step 2: Apply hydrogen peroxide

Once you are done with soaking with regular water, now take that out from the water and get all the excess water out too. Now, take that pair of sandals and soak it with hydrogen peroxide. Leave it for some minutes.

Step 3: Washing and drying

After soaking for some time with hydrogen peroxide, you will see the changes. It almost takes all the stains away. Now, wash it as usual with detergent. And then, air dry it.

Pro Tips

  1. Make sure you dry the sandals well or else, it will get worse than before.
  2. Don't rub too hard with a toothbrush. You need to do it in a gentle way that can also remove the stains.
  3. Don't put them in the washing machine if there's no hurry.

Final Verdict

We shared some interesting ideas with you. We guess it might help you to get all the ideas and execute it. There are also a lot more methods that can be used for this purpose. But you need to know what the correct way is. You might have confusions about how to clean memory foam sandals.

To make you clearer about it, we described some useful methods with you. Try any of those and share your experience with us!

https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-Sandals

Title: How to get rid of bleach smell in the nose?
Content:
Bleach is an element that is frequently used for different purposes. People generally used it for household cleaning. But did you ever notice the difference in smell of it? Isn't it suffocating?

Well, if you face this kind of situation then you will know the difficulties. Besides, this kind of smell of bleach is harmful and if you inhale it by any chance, then it will be a danger issue for your health. That's the reason you need to know what will be the right thing to do for avoiding the smell in your nose. Let's dive right into the methods, and all the other details to get a clear note.

What problems will cause the bleach smell?

The reason why we recommend you to avoid it, and try to get rid of it is the physical discomfort that is caused by the smell of the bleach.

Let's take a look at the problems that can occur because of the smell of the bleach so that you will be safe from all these things.

Nasal polyps

Nasal polyps are the soft growth that grows inside the nasal cavity. The growth of this part creates a chronic inflammation that causes several types of trouble.

For this type of problems, people feel trouble breathing, suffering from asthma, sinus infection, allergies, and many other problems like this.

And this type of problem is created if you smell the bleach for a long time. It will decrease the ability of breathing, and thus you feel discomfort. Besides, you might also face a headache problem, runny nose, pain inside the nose or the face, snoring, pain in upper teeth, and also postnasal drip.

Damage your lungs

Smelling the bleach can also cause great damage to your lungs. The reason is, when you inhale the bleach, it will go through the nose and the lungs. And that is when you feel a discomfort of breathing.

The harmful bleach that you use for your household works can be a great problem if you won't be careful from the very beginning. It can cause other kinds of damages to your other parts of organs. And all the things make your breathing hard. That's why you need to be aware of it.

Coughing

As you knew, inhaling bleach can damage the lungs. For the same reason, it will also cause the coughing problem. The reason is simple.

When you are working with bleach, you need to be careful. And if you won't be aware of the things that can cause less damage, then you will suffer from different types of problems. And just like the other ones, coughing is also a problem that you might face if you smell the bleach.

You can also face a problem of asthma and allergy. And if you have these kinds of problems then you will face cough too as the symptoms are connected.

Skin Problems

While using bleach for different purposes, you have to be very careful. It can cause several physical damages as you knew earlier. And it can damage the skin too. Yes, you heard it right. If you touch, or get interacted with the bleach, then it can irritate the skin and can cause skin damage.

It can also do skin burning if you are not careful. That's why there might be some rashes, allergies, and even inflammation. That's the reason you need to know how you will prevent it to be safe and avoid all types of discomfort.

Things you can do to get rid of bleach smell

As you knew earlier that smelling the bleach can damage your body in several ways. That's why you need to be careful and ignore the wrong techniques of using bleach. To save you and your family's physical health, you need to know the things that you should do to avoid the smell of bleach. Let's see what the techniques are.

Baking Soda

Have several problems? Baking soda has everything to solve those. And when you are talking about removing the strong smell of bleach, baking soda helps you more.

And for doing the method in the right way, all you should do is take baking soda and sprinkle around the house. Or you can make a solution by mixing water and baking soda together and spray it all over the area with the help of a spraying bottle.

And if you want to remove the smell from your hand then you can use this method as well. Simply wet your hands and sprinkle a little amount of baking soda on all over your hands. After that, rub your hands with it for a while and rinse off well.

All these methods can eliminate the bad smell of bleach that bothers you. So, try this hack before it's being too late.

Use Vinegar

Using vinegar is a good way to remove the unpleasant and harsh odor of bleach. It's also a harmful element that can damage your inner physical parts too. That's why it's compulsory to remove the bad odor.

And vinegar works like magic for vanishing this kind of odor. And for doing it, you need to use vinegar. Take vinegar in a bowl, and place it around the room. Leave the bowls in those places for several hours.

This technique will easily remove the odor from the room or that place that is being used for using bleach. Overall, you can say, it's an easy process to remove the stinky smell, and make it a fresh one.

Use Room Ventilation

The easiest and oldest technique is to use ventilation. And when you do that, you will find the easy solution that will help you to get rid of the smell of bleach.

Though bleach has a strong odor, this type of smell comes because of the chemical reaction. Many people think that bleach creates that strong odor because it has chlorine in it. But it's totally a wrong thing. Bleach creates this kind of smell because when you use it, it starts a chemical reaction that breaks down protein.

And that's why when you use it, the smell of it becomes stronger. The more you will use it for different purposes, the more the smell becomes stronger. That's the nature of bleach.

But if you use ventilation then the air can be passed through the room and the smells of bleach will go away. That's the reason you should use the ventilation system if you are facing lots of problems.

Deodorization

After opening all the ventilation, now you need to deodorize it. The reason is, you cannot fully get rid of the smell of the bleach if you won't deodorize the places. As you know that the smell of the bleach is strong enough, that's why proper deodorization is important.

But what should you do to deodorize it properly? Well, for doing it right, you can apply any kind of odor eliminating spray if you want. Besides, you can find several types of alternatives. You can use odor eliminating candles. It will also help to remove the strong smell.

So, that's how you can totally remove the harsh smell of the bleach that occurs when you are using it for any kind of task. All you need to do is to follow the rules carefully.

Tips to get rid of bleach smell in the nose

  1. Don't touch any places where the bleach is present. That might cause serious issues to your body.
  2. Use white vinegar if the baking soda won't be able to remove the smell from your hands.
  3. Do not use ammonia with bleach. It can create a toxic chloramine vapor that will be harmful to your health.
  4. Don't mix bleach with any kind of household cleaning solution.
  5. Open the window to get the odor out of your house easily.

Wrap Up

We described some useful methods with you so that you will get the complete benefit of it. We hope that you can understand and execute the hacks to get rid of the unpleasant smell of bleach.

Moreover, you have to try to remove the smell because it might be harmful to your body. You might face difficulty breathing and to avoid it, you need to get rid of the smell whenever you use bleach.

So, get the hacks and understand it well. Hope you can reduce the smell and save your physical health.

Reference:

https://www.healthtap.com/q/getting-a-bleach-smell-in-your-nose/

Title: How to get Clorox stain out of clothes?
Content:
Clorox is generally used for removing stains. But using it in the wrong way can make the clothes disaster than before. Even, it can leave a stain on the cloth.

In that case, what will you do? You cannot do whatever you like. Clorox is harmful just like bleach. That's why you have to use it by maintaining much safety. There are more than a single method that can be used for removing Clorox stains. But they should be used according to the situation of the stain.

Well, to get a clear vision of all the methods of cleaning, let's take a look at the hacks and then decide what will be the suitable one for you.

Is it possible to get rid of Clorox stains on clothes?

When you are using any kind of bleach like Clorox, then you should know whether it's safe or not. And you should also know when the cloth is being stained by any chance, then it can be removed or not.

Well, generally, people make a small mistake, and that is to use Clorox directly on the cloth to remove the stain. Many people do that but trust me it's not the right way to do it. It can even make the stain more strong and visible.

But yes, if you use the proper ways to remove the bad effects of bleach on your clothes, then you can remove it completely. It's possible by doing some proper and easy steps. But for that, you need to know what the appropriate steps are and how you should maintain it.

Methods of getting rid of Clorox stains out of clothes

There's not just one kind of a method that will be suitable. You can find several options to get rid of the Clorox stains on clothes. Let's see some of the techniques that will be effective and easy.

Method 1: Baking soda

Using baking soda is the easiest and effective way to get rid of the stains. And when it's about Clorox stain on the clothes, applying a baking soda solution will help you more. Let's see the hack in a detailed way.

Step 1: Rinsing off

To start the process, first, you need to rinse off the places of cloth where the stain is visible. You can also soak it for getting better results. Doing it is important to get the excess bleach out from the cloth.

Step 2: Making a solution

After soaking it for some time, now you need to do the main thing. And that is to make a perfect baking soda solution. And to make it properly, take baking soda and water and mix it well to make a thick paste. Make sure you take a proper amount of water that can make a thick paste easily.

Step 3: Applying the solution

Once you are done with making the solution, now it's time to apply it. Take the paste and spread it evenly all over the area. Make sure the paste can cover the stains. After that, let it be there for soaking.

Step 4: Rubbing

After some time, you need to scrub the area with a brush. You have to be aware of the thing and make sure you won't rub it too hard. It can damage the texture of the cloth. Gently rub it until the stains are coming out.

Step 5: Final process

In the final step, you have to let the cloth dry so that it can absorb all the elements of baking soda and thus, remove the stains. And once it's dry, then brush the places off and wash it with plain water.

Method 2: White vinegar remedy

White vinegar is a natural ingredient and removing any kind of stain is absolutely easy. You can use this ingredient as a cleaning solution. It works great, and you will realize it when you use it. Have a look at the steps to get things clearer. 

Step 1: Making the solution

First, you should make the solution for easy-using. And for making it, you will need 1 tablespoon of white vinegar and 2 cups of cold water. You can also use warm water if you have time. Mix both the ingredients together and pour it in a spray bottle.

Step 2: Soaking

You have to make sure that the area is fully cleaned before you are going to apply the white vinegar solution. Once you are done with cleaning, then take the solution and spray it all over the area that is stained. Then let it soak properly.

Step 3: Rubbing

After soaking it for a few minutes, now it's time to rub it well to get rid of the stains properly. Take a brush, and gently rub the cloth. After some moments, you will see the stains are coming out. And at that point, you should stop the rubbing process.

Step 4: Rinsing off

After completing the rubbing, and successfully getting rid of the stains, now you need to wash the cloth properly. Wash it with plain water with regular detergent. Wash it well and let it be there for air dry.

Method 3: Rubbing alcohol

Rubbing alcohol or any kind of alcohol can remove the bleach stains effectively. You will see the effectiveness if you apply this method at least once. Take a look at the procedures to know what exactly you have to do with alcohol to get rid of the bleach stains.

Step 1: Select the authentic rubbing alcohol

Before getting into any application, first, you have to be sure about your selection. You need to choose the proper rubbing alcohol. You can find it in any pharmacy. And if you want then, you can use other types of alcohol like Vodka. No matter what alcohol you use, you must use the authentic one.

Step 2: Application

Gently apply the need-able amount of alcohol on the surface of the stained cloth. You can use a cotton wool ball for easy application.

Step 3: Rubbing

Now, it's time to rub the area in a proper way. You can use a brush, or you can also use cotton wool balls for rubbing. Rub the places from the outside of the stained area towards the center part of the area.

Step 4: Rinsing off

After completing the rubbing process, now it's time to wash it with plain water. You can also soak the stained area of the cloth for a few minutes to get better results.

Method 4: Use Diluted Sodium Thiosulfate

If you can find the Diluted Sodium Thiosulfate near you, then you can use it for removing Clorox stains. Let's check out what the method is and how it will work.

Step 1: Get the authentic sodium thiosulfate

Purchasing the real sodium thiosulfate is important if you want the preferable results. It's also known as a photograph fixer. It works effectively as an immediate solution. So, choosing the best and authentic sodium thiosulfate is necessary. And that's why you have to purchase the authentic one if you want to use it.

Step 2: Making the solution

For making a proper sodium thiosulfate solution, take a bowl and pour about 14.3g of sodium thiosulfate and 1 cup of warm water. Mix the ingredients in a proper way. Make sure you stir the mixture well so that the sodium thiosulfate can dissolve.

Step 3: Application and rinsing

Now, take a thin cotton cloth to do the cleaning. You can also use an old cloth or cotton balls. Then blot the stain with the cloth but make sure you won't rub it. It can damage the cloth's texture. When you see the stains are gone, then you have to wash it as usual and dry it out.

Tips to Get Clorox stain out of clothes

  1. Don't rush. You might do the procedures in the wrong way if you make a hurry.
  2. Try to use old, soft cloth for rubbing.
  3. Soaking is important. That's why you need to take the proper time for doing it.
  4. Don't use a harsh brush on clothes.

Final Verdict

We have tried to inform you about the easy ways to get rid of the Clorox stains. It might be helpful for you to do the procedures in a quick way. All the methods are effective and easy to execute. That's why you can do it in a fast way. Just make sure you are doing it safely. Though bleach is a harmful element, it should be used properly.

So, do any of these procedures by maintaining much safety and get rid of the unpleasant stains.

Title: How to Clean Hair Brushes in Salon
Content:
Do you want to know the professional way of cleaning the brushes? Then, this article is the right thing for you.

There are lots of techniques that you can do, but if you want to know the exact way of cleaning  the brushes and how the salon professionals do it then keep reading the further descriptions.

First, have a look at the methods to know the details of it.

Method of cleaning hair brushes

If we talk about cleaning the hair brushes and combs in a professional style, then we must say, there's a big difference between cleaning in a professional way and cleaning by applying some homemade DIY.

But that doesn't mean salon brushes cannot be cleaned by using DIY solutions. Of course, you can do it. But if you want to know the details of cleaning brushes just like the professionals do, then keep your eye on the further reading.

Well, for doing it, the things you will need are:

  • Dirty brushes and combs
  • Scissors
  • Gloves
  • Some large boxes
  • Measurement cups
  • Pedicure brush
  • Dish soap
  • Clean towels
  • Brush Cleaner (use another comb instead)
  • Cleaning solution

Step 1: Take all the hair out from the brush

The first step should be the cleaning of all the hair out from the brushes. The reason is that it will make the entire process easier. You cannot clean the brushes properly if the hair is stuck into the bristles of the brushes.

Moreover, old hair that is stuck into the brushes can spread infections. Though in a salon, a brush is used for different purposes and interacts with different hair of different people, that's why cleaning every hair from all the brushes is important.

And to clean the brushes and the combs, take the brushes and untie all the hair. You can use a brush cleaner that can be found online. Or else, you can take another comb to remove the hair easily.

And if you find the hair being much stubborn and it's being hard to take them off, then you can use scissors. Cut the hair off with the scissors and take all the hair away and throw it in the bin.

Step 2: scrubbing

The next step is scrubbing. After getting rid of all the hair from the brushes, now it's time to scrub them well. You can use any kind of ready-made scrubber to clean them nicely. The reason for scrubbing is, it will dust off almost all dirt that is present in the corners of the bristles.

Besides, cleaning it in that way will make the entire process easy for you. To clean the hair brushes professionally, this step is necessary for deep cleaning.

If you want a deeper cleaning finish, you can use a toothbrush. Yes, it's a DIY solution that we are suggesting but it's totally up to you whether you want to apply the technique or not. Otherwise, you can take any kind of scrubber or stiff brush in order to do the same thing.

Further, make sure you won't push the scrubber too hard on the brushes. It might damage or break the bristles of it. Be gentle and allow the scrubber to clean the area properly.

Step 3: Pre-wash

Now, it's time to pre-wash it. Pre-washing means you need to get all the brushes together and make these ready for cleaning.

And for cleaning it, you need to take a bucket or a large box so that the bushes can be soaked well. Put all the brushes into the box and add water.

Make sure you pour a lot of water that it can totally cover the brushes. The box should be full with water. After that, add any kind of liquid cleanser into it. You can also use dish washing liquid soap. The results will be the same. And then, let the brushes into the mixture for about 7-10 minutes. That will be enough for getting done with the pre-wash.

The other thing that you should be careful of is the timing. You need to be particular about it. 10 minutes for soaking is enough. And if you will keep it longer, then it might bring different results. And if you soak it for a shorter time then it will be tough to clean easily and quickly. So, you need to follow all the steps in the same way we are describing.

Step 4: soaking for disinfecting and clean

The previous step informs you about the preparation of cleaning. Now, it's time to do the actual cleaning. After soaking into a dish soap solution, now, take all the brushes out from the submerged water and put those into another box.

Make sure you rinse it a little bit with plain water and then put those brushes and combs into another box.

Now, we are going to start the disinfection process. Pour lots of cleaning and disinfecting solutions that you can find easily at the shop. After that, submerge the entire brushes well. There is a product that people generally call QUARTS.

While you are using this, one thing that you must be careful about is the formula of it. This is a poison and that's why you have to keep it away from children.

Well, after submerging the brushes for another 10 minutes, now you can consider the brushes as the sanitized ones. Follow these steps and sanitize them while cleaning.

Step 5: Drying process

Once you are done with the cleaning, then you need to dry all the brushes and combs well. Drying is as important as cleaning.
