To know more, let's get right into it.

How To Remove Bed Bug Stains from Walls, Wood and Sheets

There could be a lot of methods that you can find. And you can use any of those methods. But the most important thing is, you need to know its effectiveness. 

As you are supposed to work with the wall of your house, you need to go with the processes accordingly. 

And that's why your first step should be learning about what the effective techniques are, and how these will work. 

So, without wasting any time, let's get in! 

Method 1: Baking Soda Solution

Baking soda is a great solution to remove spots. Even the spots of the wall can be removed by using baking soda. All you need to do is to apply the technique in a proper way. 

Well, let's see step by step for a better understanding. 

Step 1:

At first, take a spraying bottle, and pour water into it. Now, spray that water on the stained surface. Make sure you cover all the spots with water well. 

Soaking will be enough to clean the stains properly. And for the soaking, the whole process will be easier to handle.      

Also, it will help you more to remove the bed bugs spots on the wall. So, make sure you spray to those areas in a proper way. 

Step 2:

Now, make a solution of baking soda. And to do that, you will need a bowl. 

Take baking soda and water in that bowl. Add a generous amount of water to make a thick mixture. The consistency of the solution should be paste-like. 

And by keeping that in mind, you will need to make the paste. Take a spoon and mix both of the ingredients in a nice way.    

Step 3:

Apply the mixture onto the surface well. Make sure you cover all the stains with this paste completely. 

You can use a dab motion while applying the paste. In that way, the paste will go into the wall and soak the stains easily. 

Step 4:

Now, let the solution be on the wall for a few minutes. It will help to soak properly. 

Soaking is important because when the wall will be soaked completely, chances of getting rid most of the stains will be increased. 

That's why take some time for applying and soaking the entire mixture well. 

Step 5:

Now, take a paper towel or a clean cloth and remove the excess solution by using a dabbing motion once again. 

One thing you need to be aware of and that is, you should not soak for a long time. 10-15 minutes will be enough. 

You can also spray water at this point, if you think wiping is not enough. But after spraying water, again wipe out the excess and have a clean wall. 

Step 6:

Now that you are done with all your cleaning the spot and removing the stains, you should now keep the wall dried. Many people use dryer but when it’s about wall, you don't need to use that. 

The reason is, your wall can be dried automatically. So, leave it there and you will see, it will get dry after a few hours.  

Method 2: Use Oxalic Acid

Oxalic acid is also a great ingredient to remove any kind of stain. And as it's about the bed bugs stains on the walls of your house, this acid works amazingly.  

All you need to know the technique of using this acid. And if you can do it then it will be much easier to execute everything. 

That's why check the steps of using it on walls and know its effectiveness. After that, decide what you are going to do. 

Step 1:

At first, soak the soak by spraying water just like the previous method. And to do that, fill the spray bottle with water. And then, spray it all over the area.       

Make sure you cover all the stained area with water. And then, let it be there for a few minutes to soak properly. 

Step 2:

Now, you have to make a solution of this acid. The solution is simple. Take oxalic acid, and mix it with water.    

And then it's time to apply it. But before doing that, you need to examine first. As you are working with acid, you need to do it in a proper way. Otherwise, it can do the opposite of your desire. 

Moreover, it can also change the color of the wall. That's why what you should do is to spray the mixture onto the slightest part of the wall. 

And if you see there is no harm, then you can use it as a solution.  

Step 3:

Apply the mixture all over the area to cover the stain. After that, leave the acid on the wall to dry. The acid will help to remove the entire stain and make the wall clean as before. 

On the other hand, if your wall is made of wood then, you should be more careful about it. And if you are facing bed bug stains problem on your wooden wall, then at this point, you have to use sandpaper to sand those areas first. 

And after doing this, then you can get into the oxalic acid thing.     

Step 4:

Now, it's almost done. You need to check if the stains are gone or not. Also, the color of the wall should match with the other parts of the wall. 

Make sure there will be no discoloration. And that's how you should do all the procedures to remove bed bugs stains. 

Method 3: Stain Remover 

Using stain remover for this purpose is a basic thing to do. There are a variety of ranges of stain remover. All you have do is, choose the correct one for your wall. 

Well, stain remover is useful for removing stains from the wall. And it can remove bed bugs stains too. So, you can totally rely on their outcomes if you choose the best one of all. 

Check the details of using the stain remover for a clear vision. 

Step 1:

Spray water on the surface to soak the wall properly. Make sure you do this well as we have described before. 

Step 2:

Now, take the stain remover and apply on the affected areas. You need to be careful if it doesn’t discolor the wall. 

Step 3:

You can also use hydrogen peroxide if you don't have stain remover. This will work in a exact way. You just need spray it all over the area like the stain remover. 

Step 4:

Now, leave the wall just like that to be soaked and dried. You can also spray water after a while if you see any discoloration happening. Otherwise, let the wall be there for drying. And that will get all the stains out of the wall.  

Pro Tips 

  1. Make sure you use hand gloves while using oxalic acid 
  2. Don't use sandpaper unless the wall is wooden 
  3. There might be a doubt of having a discoloration when you are using any kind of acid or hydrogen peroxide so, make sure you test into a small place of the wall first  
  4. The ultimate solution will be the restriction of bed bugs and you can do it if you use bed bug stainless paint on your wall 
  5. Repeat the process and do it again after a few days to completely remove the stains   

Wrap Up 

We have described some of the interesting and effective methods to remove bed bugs stains from the wall. You will have a better outcome if you follow the rules step by step. 

We know that your home is so important to you. So, to have a clean house, your walls should be clean and beautiful. And it will be possible if you can remove the bugs stains. 

And for that, you need to know about how to remove bed bugs stains from walls.     

So, be aware and get the techniques to do your purpose.

Title: How To Remove Urine Stains From Underwear?
Content:
Maintaining hygiene is important. And when you are facing urine or discharge problem, you need to be careful about cleaning it. That's why you have to know how to remove urine stains from underwear to make things easier.

Many people have this kind of problem of not having a control on peeing. It is embarrassing but all that matters is the hygiene and proper cleaning of it.

That's why you need to know about the cleaning process and that keep it hygiene. So, check the procedures and then decide what you would prefer to do.

How to Remove urine Stains from Underwear and other fabrics

You can find several kinds of method of this process. All you need to know about how to remove urine stains from underwear.

And if you get a proper idea of it, then you will surely apply any of these techniques easily.

So at first, let's learn about the useful techniques of removing urine stain, and then decide which one you want to apply.

Remove Urine Stains Using Cold Water

The basic technique is to use cold water to remove any kind of removing. And you have to make sure that you only use cold water for this purpose. No hot water is allowed for this purpose. And that will help to remove stain in an easy way. 

So, that's why you can use this method for cleaning and removing urine stain. Let's see the steps to be clearer. 

Step 1:

First of all, you need to check the label of the underwear. The reason is, that's how you can know what process will be better for it. 

You can also know if this cold water method will be suitable for it or not. So, must check the label and see what kind of material it is made from. 

Step 2:

Now, take a bucket and fill it with cold water. After that, take that cloth and dip it into the bucket. After that, leave it to soak in it completely. You need to soak it for at least half an hour for getting better results. 

Step 3:

Now, you need to rub it well. Make sure the cloth is properly soaked. If you don't do it then you might face difficulty while rubbing it. 

Also, you can see the stains coming out of it easily if it is well-soaked in cold water. So, soak it well and rub it to remove all the dirt and stain out of it. 

Step 4:

After getting the rubbing done, now you need to wash it completely. And to do it, take lukewarm water and rinse the cloth in a proper way. 

At that point, lukewarm water helps more to remove the stains. If there is any stain remaining, you can rinse it off with lukewarm water to remove all the remaining stains easily. 

Step 5:

Repeat the process if you see any stain remaining. Just take cold water and soak it for another half an hour. 

And then, rinse it off well as before. You can also add some bleach at the end of washing to get the cleaning properly. 

Remove urine Stains Using Baking Soda

When it’s about baking soda, we all know that it works real hard to remove any kinds of stains, especially tough stains. So, it will also bring some good things to you. 

And when it's time to remove urine stains, you need to follow every instruction of using baking soda in a proper way. Let's see what the instructions are.

Step 1:

First of all, examine the material of that underwear. Though you are going to use baking soda on it, you need to learn first if you can use this hack on that material or not. 

That's why examine it first before removing any stain. 

Step 2:

After that, you need to rinse that area first. And to do it, you will need regular water. You can use gloves for better using. 

So, rinse it off first if you need a proper cleaning and stain removing. 

Step 3:

Now, take some baking soda and sprinkle it all over the area. Baking soda has a magical formula that eliminates any kind of stain and odor instantly. 

And that's why you can also use it for removing and cleaning urine stain. Just make sure the cloth soak it well after adding baking soda on it. 

Step 4:

After soaking for a few minutes, now take a scrubber and scrub the area in a nice way. 

You can also use a brush or even an old toothbrush to do the scrubbing. All you need to do is, scrubbing the entire area well. Also, make sure the underwear is perfectly cleaned. 

Step 5:

Once you are done with your scrubbing, now you need to wash it off completely. And to do that, rinse it off well with plain water. And then, let it be there for air drying.

Remove Urine Stains Using Vinegar Solution:

If you don't have baking soda, then you can use vinegar instead of it. It also has some incredible properties to remove any kind of stain instantly.

That's why you can also use vinegar for this purpose. It will help to remove urine stain too. So, let's check how it works.

Step 1:

Take the cloth and soak it in regular water. You need to soak it for a few minutes. And then it will be easier to do the further processes easily. So, try to rinse it off with water and then let it be soaked. 

Step 2:

Now add a cup of vinegar in a bucket, and again soak the cloth with it. The vinegar and water solution will help more to remove the stain easily. And then, let it be soaked properly.

Step 3:

After that, take all the excess out from the cloth. And then, rinse it off again to have a good cleaning. To do the washing, simply hold the cloth and run the water under to rinse well. That will definitely make the underwear completely clean. 

Step 4:

Repeat the processes if you think the stain isn't removed yet. And to do that, you need to simply rinse it off and soak with vinegar. 

At this time, you can avoid using vinegar to re-soak. You can just simply soak with water and then rub. That will help to clean the dirt, and the stain completely. 

Remove Urine Stains Using Enzyme Washing Detergent

If you don't have much time, but still you need to wash it, then you can simply use detergent that has enzymes. 

It will help to take out all the stain and keep the underwear clean. So, rinse it off well, and soak the cloth with detergent. 

After several minutes, now you have to rub it off. And lastly, wash as usual to get it properly cleaned.

Pro Tips For Removing Urine Stains

  1. Avoid using bleach if you have other options
  2. Do not use hot water at all because it can fix the stain into place instead of removing it 
  3. Try to soak it properly and not to rub it too harshly 
  4. After washing, keep that in a place for air drying, and try to dry it under the sun if possible 

Final Words

We have explained some of the best methods of all that will surely remove stains easily. All you need to do is to apply it appropriately. 

But the most important thing is to know all about how to remove urine stains from underwear. First, know about it and then apply according to it. Make sure you maintain proper hygiene because it is that matters!

Title: How To Remove Yellow Bleach Stains From White Shoes?
Content:
White shoes are itself delicate, and it’s got dirty easily. Also, when you wash the shoes with bleach in a regular basis, you will notice a yellowish tone on your white shoes. And that definitely doesn't look good at all.

And removing it will be difficult only if you won't get the idea of doing it in a proper way. So, that's why you need to know how to remove yellow bleach stains from white shoes.

Let's check all the details to get clearer about it.

How To Remove Yellow Bleach Stains From White Shoes? - Details Guide

When it’s about removing yellow bleach stains from shoes, especially from white shoes, you can find different types of methods to do it. It’s easy nowadays as you can find anything kind of information online.

But the most important thing is to choose the right method of all. And to do that, you must know about how to remove yellow bleach stains from white shoes.

As it is about removing stains from white shoes, things will be difficult. That's why you need to know what the perfect remedy will be. So, without wasting more time, let's get right into the methods to know what these are and how it works.

Method 1: Removing Yellow Bleach Stains Using Vinegar and detergent

Check For Quick Review:

You might see the previous articles and if you did that, you know how vinegar works on stained clothes. Well, it’s also effective for shoes too.

And that's why using this ingredient will be much effective to remove yellowish bleach stains from white shoes. Check the steps to be clearer!

Step 1:

First of all, remove all the laces from the shoes. That will make washing thing easier than before. It will also be important to do that when you are planning to wash in your washing machine. So, remove these laces and make it tangle-free.

And then you need to go through the next processes.

Step 2:

After that, turn both the cold and hot water thing of the machine. But if you are not using a machine then you can just do another way.

Take lukewarm water in a bucket, and dip both the shoes into it. Rinse the shoes well to get rid of all the upper level dirt from it. And it will also help to get rid of the stains a bit.

Step 3:

In this point, you need to wash it with detergent. And to do that, you need to take it in a place first. 

To do it, simply take a bowl and put 1/2 tablespoon of detergent into it. Now add some lukewarm water and mix it well. Make sure the detergent is mixed well in the water.

Step 4:

After that, take a toothbrush or any kind of brush and dip it into the detergent mixture. One thing you need to be sure, and that is, when you are going to do this process, make sure the shoes are wet and soaked properly with water.

And now, scrub the surfaces and the stained area well with that brush. The detergent will help to remove the stains quickly.

Step 5:

Now, it's time to wash the shoes off nicely. If you are using washing machine, then you need to set the machine on a hot water option and put the shoes into it.

And if you are not using a machine, then just wash it by adding warm water into a bucket. And after washing, you will see the stains are starting to fade away.

Step 6:

Now, you need to do the second part. Take a bowl and add 1/2 cup if regular white vinegar. If you are using machine for this purpose then put the vinegar into the machine after a few minutes of washing.

And if you are doing hand washing, then take vinegar and soak the shoes into it. After soaking for some time, then you need that brush for scrubbing for some time.

Step 7:

After that, take the shoes out of the machine, and then leave it in a place to air dry.

Or, if you are not using machine, then take the shoes and rinse them off again with plain water. And after that, leave that in a place to air dry.

Method 2: Removing Yellow Bleach Stains with Salt

Salt is also another amazing ingredient to remove bleach from white shoes. It is a great element that eliminates stains properly.

So, you can definitely use this as a remedy. Let's see how you should do that.

Step 1:

At first, take off the laces of the shoes as we have mentioned in the previous method. It’s important because that's how you can do the cleaning process in an easy way.

Step 2:

Now, take a bowl and pour warm water in it. Make sure the bowl is heat-resistant because the water you are pouring into is have to be very hot but not like boiling hot.

And then, add about 1 tablespoon of salt and mix it well.  Make sure the salt is being dissolved well into the hot water.

Step 3:

Now, take a toothbrush and start scrubbing the stained area well. Make sure you won't be too harsh on it but you should scrub properly.

Dip the toothbrush into the salt solution properly and then do scrubbing. In that way, you notice that the stains are coming out. At that time, you need to stop doing this.

Step 4:

Now, leave the shoes in a proper place where it can dry faster. Leaving them for about 20 minutes will be enough. And after 20 minutes, you need to scrub it again to get rid of the stains properly. In that way, you need to do all these things.

Step 5:

Stop doing the scrubbing when you see the stains are fading away. The stains might not fade away completely but it will be gone slowly.

Leave the shoes ti dry properly and then you can again wear it.

Method 3: Removing Yellow Bleach Stains Using Cream of Tartar

Cream of tartar is also a great ingredient to remove bleach stains from shoes easily. It is effective, but you need execute the process in a proper way. And to do that, let's check out the steps.

Step 1:

Take a heat-resistant bowl to do the next procedures. Make sure it is large enough that both the solution and the shoes will fit into it.

Step 2:

Take about 4 cups of warm water into that bowl. After that, add 1/2 cup of cream of tartar into it and mix these two elements well by using a spoon.

Now, dip the shoes into the mixture and let them soak for some time. You need to submerge both the shoes well to get soaked in a proper way. Soaking it for half an hour is enough for new stains. But if the stains are old then take an hour and a half for soaking.

Step 3:

Once you are noticing that the stains are gradually fading away, at that time, you need to rinse the shoes with plain water. Make sure all the cream of tartar will be gone properly. And in that way, wash all over the shoes.  

Step 4:

After being done with washing, you can now towel dry it for overnight. And it will be properly air dry in that way. And once it’s properly done, you can wear it then.

Special Tips for Removing Yellow Bleach Stains

  1. If you are afraid of losing shoes laces while washing in a machine, you can use a zipper bag to store it safely. 
  2. Try to remove the stains as soon as possible so that, the stain cannot be able to fix in place and it will be easier to remove that Make sure you won't rinse out the detergent from the shoes before transferring them into the machine. 
  3. Do not use dryer to dry the shoes
  4. Make sure you don't rinse the shoes if before putting it into the machine

Conclusion

Several types of methods we have shared with you. You can apply any of them. All three are effective of removing stains. All you need to know about how to remove yellow bleach stains from shoes and do the steps according to that.

Learn all about the processes and then execute it on your shoes. You will definitely get better result.

Resources:

https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Yellow-Bleach-Stains-from-White-Shoes

Remove Yellow Bleach Stains from Shoes

Title: How To Remove Oil Stains from Granite?
Content:
Are you facing stain problems lately? And do you ever faced oil-stain problem on granite? If you faced it and want to know the hacks of getting rid of it, then you are into a right place.

You need to know how to remove oil stain from granite. It is because if the granite surface has any stain then it will look ugly and dirty. And when you are using it regularly, it's obvious to have these kinds of stains. 

So, to avoid it, you need to know about the oil stain removing techniques. Let's check what the techniques are, and how they work effectively.

How To Remove Oil Stains from Granite? - 10 Simple Easy Steps

A lof of methods you can find in this digital world. But we are trying to give you the best methods that will give you effective results in a quick way. 

And when it's about how to remove oil stains from granite, all you need to learn about the fast techniques, and the steps nicely. So, let's get in and know what the best methods are. 

1. Oil Stain Remover

The fastest remedy is oil stain remover. It is easy to use that can give you useful and fast result. So, if you are going to use this, you don't have to take any tension about its effectiveness. 

And to eliminate grease or oil from granite, you should use oil stain remover. Besides, the application of it is super easy. So, it will be another advantage of it. 

Moreover, Greased Lightning stain remover is also a good option for this purpose. And to use it, simply take the remover and apply it on the stain by using a cloth. 

Keep rubbing the stained area until you get your desired result. You can also use a plastic sheet to cover the area and the let it be soaked overnight. 

The another trick is to use acetone. It has those properties that can remove any kind of tough stains easily. So, you can also use it for this purpose. 

2. Baking Soda

Baking soda also has some good qualities that can take all the oil stain out from the granite. 

When oil is soaked well on the granite, it will leave a tough stain. And baking soda can help you out to remove this kind of tough stains. 

So, for using baking soda on that stain, take a generous amount of soda and cover the entire area with it. You can also add acetone for a better result. 

After that, wait for a few minutes, so that, the soda can absorb all the oil of it. Now, take a sponge and scrub the place nicely. Use some water for a better application.

Now, let it be dried and then take the excess out of it. You will see the difference at that time.    

3. Dishwashing Soap

Using dishwashing soap or liquid is another good method you can try. It will not only take the oil out from granite but also clean it well. 

So, that's why you can totally use dishwashing soap. And to do it, you will need three table spoons of Blue Dawn dishwashing soap and mix it with one cup of unbleached flour. You will also need to add water to make a thick paste. 

Now, apply it on the surface of granite and cover the stain well. Allow it to sit overnight. And then, clean it as usual. 

4. Bleach

If you want some bleaching solution to clean the oil stain from granite, you can do it. But you have to do it perfectly by maintaining the quantity of every ingredient. 

First of all, you need to add an equal amount of bleach and water with some poultice powder. Make sure you mix it well to make a thick paste of it. 

Now, apply this paste on the stain and cover it nicely. After that, take a plastic sheet and cover the paste area well. 

Then, let it be there for a day, and then pull the plastic off. And then, again let it be set for another day. That's how the stain will go away. 

5. OxiClean

You can also use OxiClean for doing the oil stain removing. It can easily remove strong stain from the surface of the granite. It also has a speciality to remove red wine stain quickly. 

So, you can apply this method for oil stain too. And to apply it, simply take OxiClean and mix a little amount of water.  

Now, you can simply spray it by pouring in a spray bottle. Or, you can use a brush or a toothbrush. 

Take a brush and dip it into the mixture. After that, brush the stain and leave it to dry for some hours. And after that, wipe out all the excess. 

6. Ammonia

Ammonia is also an ingredient that works magically to remove any kind of tough stain. So, you can also use this element to remove the oil stain from granite. 

And for doing it in a right way, take ammonia in a generous amount and mix any kind of powder like chalk or rice flour and mix it well to make a thick paste. 

After that, do the same thing as before. Cover the stained area with this paste and leave it to sit, and dry well for some hours. Then, clean the area and you can see the stain-free surface. 

7. Baking Powder

Make a paste of baking powder and water. You can also use acetone with it for having a better result. 

After making the paste, now you have to apply it in a nice way and cover all the area. Now, take a plastic sheet to cover the area and leave the paste inside it. 

Another thing you can do. And that is to use a hot towel and put it on the plastic sheet for some hours. And after that, remove the towel and the sheet. And clean the area well.  

8. Shout Gel

Shout gel can also be a good element to do the oil stain removing. And it is also easy to apply. 

All you need to do is, take the gel and apply on the granite. Make sure you cover all the stained area with it. 

Massage it for a while and then wipe it out with a wet cloth. You can also leave the gel on the granite surface for some time to soak. But you need to make sure if it doesn’t make any discoloration to the stone. 

9. Cornstarch

Just like, baking soda, baking powder, flour and other kind of powdery stuff, you can also use cornstarch for removing the oil stain. 

You can make a paste of it or you can also use just the way it is. 

Just sprinkle the powder on the area and allow it to sit for some hours. Make sure the cornstarch must soak the oil completely. And after that, clean all the residue.  

10. Baby powder

You can also use baby powder if you don't have any other powder near you. Just make sure you use it properly. 

The using process is almost the same. Take the baby powder or any kind of talcum powder and sprinkle all over the area. Now take a brush to rub it nicely. 

And then, take some time to soak all the oil from the granite. After that, take a cloth and remove all the residue and make it properly cleaned.    

Final Words 

As you can see, we describe some of the easy-to-do techniques with you. We hope that you can get all the steps properly.

The first thing will be the learning about how to remove oil stains from granite. And if you know the hacks and techniques well then you can surely execute it properly.

So, get the processes and apply any of the method to have a clean and stain-free granite surface easily.

Title: How to Remove Salt Stains From Clothes, Shoes and Carpet
Content:

And after knowing all the steps about removing, then you can do further processes properly. So, without wasting any time, let's get started! 

First of all, there are some ingredients that you will need. And those ingredients are: 

  • Water 
  • Distilled white vinegar 
  • Detergent  
  • Cotton pads 
  • And brush 

Step 1: Know the material

Step 2: Removing excess salt

Now, it's time to remove the upper level salt first. And if it is wet, then you need to take it the basin. 

Then Soak it for a few minutes. After that, gently rub the stained area to get the excess salt out of the cloth. 

And if the stain is getting dry, then soak it in water properly. You can use cold water for this purpose. After being soaked for a while, now you need to rub the stained area with a brush to take the upper level salt out from the cloth.  

And that's how you should remove the excess salt easily. And if you do it, then you can get the stain out of the cloth too. Then, it will be much easier than before. 

Step 3: Soaking 

Now, it's time for soaking. This part is important because if you soak the area nicely, then it will automatically let the stain come out from the cloth. 

So, that's why soaking is important. And for soaking, you should add detergent into it. Take water and detergent powder and make a nice and foam-like mixture. 

You should take detergent according to the amount of clothes you are washing. If you have a lot of clothes, then you will need a lot of detergent. On the other side, if you have less amount of cloth, then you will need less amount of detergent.    

So, make that mixture nicely. And after that, take the cloth and dip it into the mixture. Let it be soaked for a few minutes or about an hour.     

If you soak this way, chances of setting the stain on cloth will be decreased. That's why you need to remove the stain, but first, you need to soak for a generous amount of time. 

Step 4: Use vinegar 

At that point, you can add vinegar into it. Or, you can also make a solution of it. That will give you the better results for sure. 

We all know that vinegar has excellent elements to take the stain out. It will be easier to remove the stain if you soak it into a vinegar mixture. 

So, for making the solution, you need to take one part of vinegar and mix it with three parts of water. Now, take the cloth and dip it into the mixture. You can also use cotton pads to soak that particular area. You need to soak it for a few minutes. 

Soaking in the solution is necessary, but you need to follow the instructions while doing this. So, you have to be careful about this. And according to that, you have to soak it well in the vinegar solution to get rid of the salt stain completely. 

Step 5: Washing 

After getting done with soaking, now it's time to wash all the dirt and detergent residue out of it. So, you need to wash those clothes in a proper way.

Make sure you wash it in a gentle way. Do not use a brush at this point. The reason is, the stains will already gone at that time. And it won't be much dirty. So, just wash it in a humble way to get a detergent-free cloth.   

Step 6: Drying 

After washing the cloth perfectly, now you have to dry it out properly. It is because if you don't dry it properly and it will still be wet then it can have an odor. That will not be a good option to wear or use again. 

Also, it is about hygiene. So, if you dry the cloth well then it will be germ-free. And you can wear or use this as usual. So, after washing it in a nice way, you have to dry it properly. 

And to dry it, leave the cloth for air drying automatically. That will ensure total hygiene. And you can have a properly cleaned cloth in an easy way. 

Special Tips To Remove Salt Stains from Clothes

Wrap Up

Title: How To Remove Watermelon Stains From Clothes?
Content:
During this summer season, eating a lot of hydrating food and fruit is normal. When you are eating, having a stain on cloth of any kind of fruit is also a normal thing. 

And when it's about watermelon, you should know that it can leave a stain on cloth. That's why you have to know how to remove watermelon stains from clothes in an easy way.

So, get the ideas of removing watermelon stain first, and then decide what you want to do.

How To Remove Watermelon Stains From Clothes - Steps By Steps Guide

You can find several stain removing techniques if you search for it. But basic techniques are the best way to remove watermelon stain without giving the cloth any damage. 

So, you also should use the basic methods for this purpose. We are basically going to tell you about two kinds of elements that you can use for removing the stains.  

But, if the stain is severe, you can use both if you want. Let's see what the techniques are. 

To do the process, you will need: 

  • Enzym-based stain remover 
  • Detergent or dishwashing liquid  
  • Oxygen-based bleach 
  • Water 
  • Small bowl
  • Cloth 
  • Soft-bristle brush 
  • And paper towel  

Step 1: Remove the residue

First, you need to get all the residues out of the cloth. There might be the watermelon seeds, juice of it or even small pieces of the fruit that creates stain on the cloth easily. 

And to remove these, take the cloth, and gently clean the upper level stain and all the residue with the help of a clean cloth. 

There could be several things on the cloth. But one thing you have to make sure and that is to avoid rubbing the surface.    

And with a gentle motion, get the dirt out of the fabric. 

Step 2:  Basic Rinsing   

Now, you have to rinse the cloth using plain water. It will help to wash off the upper level dirt easily. Also, it will help to minimize the stain. 

That's why you should rinse the stained area as soon as possible. And doing it will be easier to get rid of the stain properly. 

You don't have to use any ingredient or do any scrubbing at this point. You just need to gently rinse it with water to get the excess fruit out of the cloth. 

You can use two kinds of methods for this. First, you can do blotting. You can blot the stained area with a paper towel after cleaning it with plain water. 

On the other side, you can clean it with water by holding the cloth as well as the opposite side of the cloth under a running water so that, the dirt and the juice of watermelon can come out from cloth easily.   

Another thing you need to be careful about is that the stain won't spread to the other parts of the cloth. So, be aware of the thing while rinsing. 

Step 3: Use Stain Remover

After rinsing off the cloth, now you have to do the main cleaning to remove stain completely. And to do it, use stain remover. 

But you have to take careful steps while using it. It is because it can work differently if you won't be careful about it. 

For using it properly, take the cloth and use enzyme-based stain remover on that area. Take a generous amount of that remover to use in a proper way. 

Now, take dishwashing liquid or normal detergent to apply on the surface. Make sure you use enzyme-based product because it is good to break down the stain in an easy way. 

Step 4: Soaking

Now, it’s time for soaking. This part is important because you can get the results according to the soaking process. 

After you are done with applying the detergent and stain remover, now you have to focus on the soaking. Take the cloth and leave it in a bowl to soak it nicely. You have to let it be soaked for about 10-15 minutes. 

And while soaking, you need to make sure of another thing. And that is to ensure that the stained area will be soaked properly with the detergent and the stain remover solution. That's how you have to do the soaking. 

Step 5: Washing

When you are done with soaking, now you need to do washing to completely clean it. And for doing that, you can use washing machine. 

But you have to check the details of the materials of that cloth first. The reason is, not all types of clothes have the quality to be washed in a machine. So, must see the labels, and then wash it in a machine if it is washable. 

But if it is not washable, then you can wash it in a basic way. Hand washing will also work well. So, take the cloth and rinse it once to get all the excess out of it. 

After that, rinse and wash again to get the perfect cleaning.     

Step 6: Add Bleach

If you apply the previous method, you can hope to get rid of the watermelon stains. But if the stain is still not gone yet, then you can apply another technique to the cloth. 

And for that, you will need to make a solution. Take oxygen-based bleach, and mix it with warm water. 

Now, take the cloth and dip it into the mixture. One thing you have to careful while using bleach, and that is the measurements and quantity.  

When you are going to use bleach, you need to be very careful. Take a generous amount of bleach, and add hot water to minimize the side effects of it. 

And after being sure about all these things, now you can allow the cloth to submerge into it.   

Step 7: Soaking 

And after apply the mixture, you have to let the cloth to soak. And you will need much time for doing this. 

Generally, you should soak the cloth into the bleach mixture for about 3-4 hours. It will be better if you do the process at night, and let it be soaked overnight. 

Step 8: Washing

Once you are done with soaking, now you can see the stains come out easily. At that time, your application is almost done. 

Now, you need to wash it well to get the entire bleach out of the fabric. And to do the washing, simply take the cloth, and rinse it with water for once. 

After that, you need to wash it again. That will ensure the perfect washing of the cloth. And you will be sure that no residue of the solution will be present in it. So, wash it well with room temperature water. 

Step 9: Drying

Not just washing is enough. You have to dry the cloth well after washing. It is necessary because if you won't do it then the cloth might leave a bad smell. Also, it might create germs that hampers your hygiene.    

So, drying is also important. And to dry the cloth well, you can use a dryer. But not all kinds of material of cloth can take the electric drying process. And it might harm the cloth texture. 

That's the reason, you need to be sure before doing it. But you can also use another natural technique that will cause zero harm to the fabric. And that is to air dry it. 

You can also dry the cloth for a short time under the sun. That will make the cloth germ-free and hygiene. 

Step 10: Repeat

These steps are enough to remove the watermelon stains from cloth. But last thing you need to know that you should repeat the methods if needed. 

Repeating those processes is important only if you find that the stains are not gone yet. And at that time, you have to repeat the procedure until the stains are completely gone.  

Pro Tips For Removing Watermelon Stains From Clothes

  1. Avoid wetting the cloth for a long time 
  2. Do not use too much hot water because it can damage the cloth 
  3. Apply a gentle way while rubbing 
  4. Do not let the cloth under the sun for too long 

Final Verdict 

The techniques are easy. And we are trying to describe how to remove watermelon stains from clothes to you in a simple way possible. We hope that you can get the steps well, and then apply it in a proper way.

All you have to maintain is the proper hygiene of the cloth. So that, you can get the stain-free cloth without any germ.

Overall, get everything clearly, and then execute it according to that. You will surely get the proper result.

Title: How To Get Fruit Juice out of Clothes
Content:
When you are on drinking fruits and its juices, it will be an obvious thing to have a fruit juice stain on your cloth. But removing it will be a problematic thing. All you need to know about how to get fruit juice out of clothes. 

And if you get the idea properly, then you can also execute it perfectly and have a perfect result out of it. 

So, without wasting any time, let's get into the process! 

How To Get Fruit Juice out of Clothes

Several methods are available. You can find these online and can use any of them according to it. But the most important thing is to apply the effective method of all. 

And to do that, at first, you have to know which process is the most effective one, and how you can do it. To know more about it, let's check the proper descriptions first!  

1. Dried Stains

The first method that you should know is the method that can get the dried juice stain out of the cloth. It is a difficult task because when the fruit juice dries out on the cloth, it will get fixed. And at that time, removing the stain of it will be difficult. 

That's why you need to know the exact and effective process of doing the removing. Let's check the method to have a clear vision about it. 

Step1: Scrape off 

When the fruit juice is dried out on cloth, it will be difficult to remove. At that time, not only soaking work but also you have to scrape the dried juice first. 

And to do it, you will need a knife. A butter knife or a spoon will be better for this purpose. Take the knife or the spoon and slightly take the dried pulp out of the cloth. 

You need to be very careful while doing it. The reason is, the knife can cut the cloth easily. So, you need to take careful steps if you use a general knife. 

That's why we recommend you to use butter knife, a scraper or a spoon to do this process.       

Step 2: Flush with Water 

After finishing the scrapping, you will need water to flush out all the excess pulp out of the cloth. And to do that, you can do two kinds of things. You can take water in a bowl, and rinse the cloth with it. 

Or, you can take the cloth under a running water. That's how all the residue will be gone with the flow of the water. 

We will recommended you to use the flush motion of water to get rid of the pulp. Make sure you use cold water to do the process. That will help to get the fruit pulp out in an easy way. 

Step 3: Soaking in Warm Water 

Now, it’s time for soaking. And to soak it, you will need warm water. At this time, you need to use warm water because it will help to get the dried stain out of the cloth. And the removing process will be much easier. 

So, to do the soaking, at first, you need to know if the cloth is able to take the procedures or not. 

There are a lot of clothes in different varieties. And not all types of fabrics can take the risk. So, that's the reason you need to check the labels before doing the soaking and the cleaning. 

For doing the soaking, you will need a bowl to add hot water in it. Then, take the cloth and submerge into it in a nice way. 

Allow it to soak for a couple of hours.  

Step 4: Soaking in Detergent Solution 

If you see the stains are not coming out properly after soaking into the hot water, then you can apply a different technique. And the technique is to make a solution of detergent and water. 

When the stain is severe, using detergent will be an useful solution. And that's why you need to make it in a proper way. 

To make the mixture, take a bowl and pour some water in it. After that, add detergent and mix it well. You can see the bubbly texture of it. And that means the solution is ready. 

Step 5:   Washing 

Now, you need to wash the cloth by soaking it in the detergent mixture. It will be better if you soak it in the mixture overnight. That will take all the stains out of the cloth easily. 

You can also use warm water at this time. Just make sure the stains are gone. And if you follow the techniques properly then you can remove the stains in an easy way. 

So, make sure the cloth is nicely soaked and then you can do the next steps. 

Step 6: Drying 

After being done with washing the cloth properly, now you need to dry it well. It is because if the cloth is not dry enough, it won't keep the hygiene. And to make it germ-free, you need to dry it well. 

And to dry it, you can hang the cloth in the sun ray to become totally germ-free. Also, you can air dry it. That will be also an effective way to dry. 

2. Fresh Juice Stains

When the juice stain is completely fresh, then it will be easier to remove it than before. You just need to follow some basic rules properly and you will be all set to do the stain removing. 

So, to do the removing, let's check the method and see the steps well. That might give you a clear note about it. 

Step 1:  Flush with Cold Water

At first, you need to take the upper level stain out of the cloth. And to do it, you just need to use water. 

Take the cloth and dip it into the cold water. Then rinse well to get rid of the stains. You can also rub it a little to take the stain out. 

Another thing you can do. And that is to take the cloth under a running water. And the upper level stains will be gone in an easy way. 

Step 2: Make A Solution 

Now, make a solution for removing stains. And to make it, you will need dishwashing liquid or any kind of liquid soap and vinegar.    

Take a bowl and mix these two things together. Make a watery solution of it. So that, it will be easier to soak. 

Step 3: Soaking 

Now, it’s the time to soak the cloth into the mixture. That's why take the cloth and dip it into the bowl of that solution. 

Soak it for a couple of hours and check if the stains are gone or not. If you see the stains are not coming out, then you need to soak it for a longer time. But if you see no stains on the cloth, then get into the next steps. 

Step 4: Lemon Juice Application 

If the previous solution won't work, you can use another technique. And that is to use lemon juice on the stain. 

Lime juice has some good enzymes that can remove spots and stains. So, using it will surely bring some good results for sure. 

And after using the juice and soak it for a few minutes, you need to take the cloth and leave it in the sun to get rid of the stains. 

But one thing you need to consider and that is the fabric. Not all types of fabric can take the lime juice process. So, you have to know about this before doing this step.     

Step 5: Washing 

After applying all the techniques on the stains, now you have to wash all the solutions. And to do it, you will need plain water. 

Just take the cloth and rinse well with the normal water. Make sure no detergent or any other kinds of ingredient will exist on the cloth. So, be careful while doing this. All you need to do is to wash the cloth properly. 

Step 6: Drying 

After finishing washing, now it’s time to dry it properly. The reason is, if the cloth is not dry properly, then it will be unhygienic. Also. It might leave a slight odor. 

That's why you have to dry it well. Air drying will be perfect for this purpose. So, leave the cloth for air drying. You can also dry it in the sun for better hygiene. And that's how the cloth will be properly cleaned and germ-free.   

Pro Tips for Removing Juice out of Clothes

  1. Avoid using a dryer to dry the cloth
  2. Make sure the warm water is not too hot that the cloth cannot take 
  3. Do not use laundry soap on the stains directly 

Final Words 

We have shown some of the useful ways of getting rid of the fruit juice and its stains on the cloth. All you have to know is to how to get fruit juice out of clothes in an easy way.     

So, get the ideas properly and apply it as described. You can surely get the better results of it. Let the summer be as cheerful as before!

Title: How To Remove Juice Stains From Carpet?
Content:
During this summer, everybody love to eat summer fruits and juices. And throughout the entire day, it will be natural to have a dirty rug.

But what if your favorite carpet got fruit stains? You must be worried if the stain will go or not. Well, you don't need to be worried. We have all solutions of your problems.

All you need to do is to learn about how to remove juice stains from carpet. And if you can learn and execute it properly then all your problems will be solved.

And to do in a proper way, you have to know all about it in details. So, check all about the methods, and their steps as well.

Methods of Removing Juice Stains from Carpet

Removing juice stains from carpet is a tricky task to do. When you are working on carpet, you cannot simply wash it out completely. 

There would be a method or some methods to remove any kind of stain in a proper way. Yes, it can be possible to remove stains from carpet in an easy way.   

All you need to know all about how to remove juice stains from carpet. And if you get the methods properly then it will be easier to execute it on carpet and remove the stains. So, check the processes first!      

And to execute these methods, you will need: 

  • Detergent 
  • Vinegar 
  • Mild shampoo
  • Baking soda
  • Lemon juice  
  • Hydrogen peroxide and ammonia (for cranberry juice stain) 
  • Cold and warm water 
  • Spray bottle
  • A clean cloth 
  • And a spoon 

Method 1: Basic Technique 

You can easily remove basic juice stains by using a basic method. And what the method will be and how it works, let's check! 

Step 1

First step will be blotting. You need to start with blotting the stain by using a clean cloth. And then, try to absorb as much juice as possible. 

Blotting is important because you can get all the juice out of the carpet and protect the stain from spreading. 

The other thing that you should be aware of and that is, you must not scrub the stained area. This might damage the fabric. Just try to lift the stain with the help of a clean cloth.  

Step 2

You can use any kind of cleaning solution. Just spread it all over the stained area to soak. Make sure you choose a good quality stain remover. 

Also, you can take lime juice as a solution. Take a spoon and spread the juice to the areas well. And make sure you cover all the areas well. 

You have to make sure that the stained fabric is  absorbed with the solution you are using. 

Step 3

Now, you need to let the carpet be soaked properly. You all know that, soaking is important. The reason is, it can take the stain out of the fabric. 

The more you soak, the easier the removing process will be. So, make sure you take a plenty of time while doing the entire procedure. 

And in that way, soak the carpet well to make sure you won't need to do more to remove the stain.    

Step 4

Now, you can gently rub it to get the stain out properly. But make sure you won't rub it too harsh or do any scrubbing process. 

And to do that, you can use a spoon. Just a spoon can remove the excess solution and stains too. So, instead of a scrubber, you should use a spoon. 

Moreover, it won't damage the fabric of the carpet. And you can rub the stained area in a gentle way. So, rub it in this way. 

Step 5 

One thing you need to know is, you can also use ammonia or hydrogen peroxide if you think the stain tough to remove with natural home ingredients. 

These two elements work in their best way possible to remove any kind of stains and spots. Especially, if the juice is of cranberry, then the stain will be tough. And, at this point, you can use any of these Ingredients. 

But make sure you won't use these elements on wool kind of fabric. Otherwise, you can use it by maintaining some techniques of it.

Step 6

Now, it's time to wash the area. And to do it, you cannot pour water on it. So, what should you do?

At that time, you will need a spray bottle. Take cold water in that bottle spray all over it to remove the excess.

After that, take another clean cloth and blot with it. This will help to remove all the solution, and the water that are inside the fabric.

And after that, leave the carpet there for air drying.

Method 2: Clean with Detergent and Vinegar 

We all know that, vinegar works great for removing any kinds of spots and stains. And detergent is useful for cleaning any kind of fabric in an easy way.

So, you can guess by it that both ingredients are special ones that can remove juice stains and make it a cleaned one in a proper way. 

You just have to know the procedures and how all the ingredients should be used. That will be enough that you should do at first. So, let's get started! 

Step 1

First of all, you will need a cloth to blot the juice and take out of the carpet. You can also use a paper towel to do this process. 

So, to do it in a proper way, take a paper towel or a clean cloth and blot up as much juice as possible. Make sure, you won't apply any kind of scrubbing motion while doing it. 

Just take the cloth and start blotting in a gentle way. You have to make sure that you will take away as much juice as possible. 

The reason is, it will be much easier to remove all the stains if there will be less juice to make more stain. So, blot up the juice in this way. 

Step 2

Now it's time to make a solution for the removing. The first solution will be made of detergent and warm water. 

Take a generous amount of dishwasher detergent and add a cup of warm water into it. If you can use non-bleach detergent if you have. It will be better for the fabric than the regular one. 

And after making the solution, now apply it onto the stained area. Let it be there for a few minutes, and then again blot it up with another clean cloth. 

Step 3

After doing it, now you need to make another solution of vinegar. It will be better for the stains. And to make it, you will need about half cup of vinegar and 2-3 cups of water. Make sure you use regular white vinegar for better outcome. 

After that, mix it well to make a solution. Take a spray bottle and pour all the mixture into it. Now, apply this mixture onto those affected areas well. 

And after that you need to let it be soaked for a while. Then, take a cloth and again blot up to absorb all the excess solution from the carpet. 

Step 4

Once you are done with the solutions, now you need to wash all the areas well. You can use a spray bottle and spray all over the area with water. 

After that, clean all the water with a cloth. And if the stains are still visible then repeat the steps once again. And for the finishing, leave the carpet to dry in the air well. 

Method 3: Use Baking Soda and Shampoo 

If you don't have vinegar or you don't want to use that, then baking soda can be an alternative of this. 

It is also a great element to get rid of any kind of stains and spots. So, in this case, you can also use baking soda to remove juice stains from carpet. 

And to do it perfectly, let's see what you need to do and how you can do it easily. 

Step 1 

When it’s about removing juice stains from carpet, things will be much different than removing from a regular cloth. That's why you have to be careful when you are planning to do this. 

Firstly, you need to sure if there is not extra juice on the carpet. You must take that out as soon as possible. And you also should do the removing technique fast. So that, the stains won't set in, and it will easier to remove. 

That's why you need to remove it first. And for that, you will need a clean cloth or a paper towel. Start blotting with the cloth and take as much liquid as possible.  

Step 2

Now, take a spray bottle to spray lukewarm water on that stain. After doing that, you should blot up the liquid again. You need to use a clean cloth or a cloth just like before. 

And you should use a slight pressure to the carpet to while blotting. That will help you to take the juice out quickly. 

Step 3

After that, take a bowl and make a mixture of shampoo and lukewarm water. After that, you need to apply the solution directly to the stained area. Make sure the area is soaked in that solution perfectly. 

Now, take a paper towel and blot the area again. You have to soak the excess water well. And in that way, you can take the solution out of the carpet and you will see, the stains are coming out slowly. 

Step 4

Now, it's time for the second solution. And for making that, you will need baking soda. Take baking soda and mix it with water. Make a watery solution of it. 

And then, pour it in a spray bottle and spray all over the area. Wait for a few minutes to soak properly. After that, blot up again. 

Take a clean cloth, and blot as usual. You will see the stains are coming out perfectly and that's what you want. 

Step 5

But if you cannot see any changes then you should repeat the methods again. If you think the area needs to wash again to remove the juice stain completely, then you can surely repeat the processes. 

Step 6

When you are done with all your procedures and there's no stain remaining, then you should go for the final step. 

And that is to dry it well. You can use a dryer but it can damage the fabric. So, you can get the drying done in the sun, or you can simply air dry it. Make sure the carpet should maintain hygiene.          

Pro Tips For Removing Juice Stains From Carpet

  1. Make sure you do not use ammonia or hydrogen peroxide type of chemical on delicate fabrics like wool 
  2. You should use cold water instead of hot water because hot water helps to set the stain in place quickly 
  3. You can use lemon juice as it has good properties of removing stains 
  4. Try not to use regular laundry detergent or dishwashing soap is possible 
  5. Avoid using carpet spot cleaners on oriental rugs   
  6. Must avoid using bleach 
  7. Soak for a while to get the stains out easily    

Final Verdict 

To conclude it, you need to know that all you should do is to follow the procedures as exact as possible. That's how you can get the stains out without damaging the carpet fabric. 

You can find a lot of procedures if you search for it. But you have to know what the exact and effective process is. You basically need to know about how to remove juice stains from carpet.       

And if you do so, then you will surely get the best results of all. Also, your carpet lasts longer. So, must know the processes and execute according to it.

Title: How To Remove Starch Stains From Clothes?
Content:
When it’s about starch stains on clothes, you need to remember that, the older the stain, the harder to remove. That's why you need to remove it as soon as possible.

And to do that, first, you have to know how to remove starch stains from clothes. Besides, you also should know if the fabric is washable garment or not.

Then you should start the next procedures. To know more about it, check the details first.

How To Remove Starch Stains From Clothes

Several methods of several problems are present in this modern life. You can search for the answers of your quarries and you will get it easily.

But you have to decide what procedure will be the best one for your situation. And according to that, you will need to select one method and execute according to the rules of it.

So, for getting a better idea, let's get right into the deeper section and see how the methods work.

Method 1: Basic Method

The first method that we are going to describe you is the basic technique that is easy to apply and effective too. 

To know more, let's get the steps begin! 

Step 1

For doing this, you don't need to take a lot of ingredients. You will just need about a couple of ingredients and you will be all done to get into the process.

And to do that, first, you will need to make a solution. And to do it, you will need dishwashing liquid, and cold water. Take a bowl and mix these two ingredients together. And after that, your solution will be ready. 

Step 2 

Now, take that solution and spread all over the stain. You can also use spray bottle to do this in an easy way. Spray the watery mixture on the cloth area that is stained. And then, leave it for a few minutes to soak it completely. 

Step 3 

After that, take a clean cloth and start blotting the area to absorb excess solution from the fabric. Keep doing it until the stains of starch is completely removed. 

In that way, you can get rid of the stains easily. 

Step 4

You can repeat this process if the stains ain't coming out. Do these procedures again as the exact way you did before. 

And that's how you will see the starch stains are not exist anymore. And at that time, you need to stop doing the application.  

Step 5

After getting rid of the stains, now you need to wash it completely. It is important because that's how all the stains will be gone completely. 

And to do it, take cold water in a bucket, and dip the cloth into it. Wash the cloth properly. Then, leave it to air dry. That's how you can get the stains out without any damaging.                      

Method 2: Baking Soda 

How can we leave the baking soda method? On almost all kinds of stains, this element works effectively. And also for the starch stains, it works well. 

Besides, not only for the tough starch stains but also for the small kinds of starch stains like spray starch stains, this ingredient helps you more.     

So, to let you know more about it, let the explanation of this method begin! 

Step 1

You can make a solution of baking soda like almost all people do. But, you can also use it directly to the surface. 

And for doing it, start by using any kind of cleaning solution. Take the solution and spread it all over the stained area. You have do it properly. 

And make sure you won’t apply it all over the area of the cloth. You just need to use it on the stains.               

Step 2

Now, take baking soda and sprinkle all over the stains well. You don't need to add a lot of amounts of it. Just take a generous amount and spread it nicely. 

Step 3

After that, it’s time for scrubbing. And to do that, you can take a scrubber or a toothbrush to do this technique. 

Keep scrubbing it until the stains are completely gone. But make sure you won't do the scrubbing too harsh. That will damage the entire fabric. 

So, be gentle and keep scrubbing in this way to get the better results.  

Step 4

Now, you need to wash it off completely. And to do it, take cold water in a bucket, and rinse the cloth off well with this water. 

And after that, you need to leave the cloth in a certain place to air dry it completely. You can also dry it in the sun for a while to get the cloth dried in a proper way. That will ensure the compete hygiene of it. 

Method 3: Ammonia Solution 

If you have tough stains, you can also use ammonia as a great solution. Especially when you have a lot of stains that are not coming out easily, you should go for this technique. 

But there is a certain procedure of applying it. And you must know all about it before getting into any procedure. So, let's check the details, and execute according to it. 

Step 1

At first, you need to get the upper level stains out of the cloth. And to do that, you can take a spoon or a knife. Gently scrape the dried stains out, but make sure you won’t be too harsh on it. 

Besides, if the stains are wet then you can do blotting. And to do this process, take a paper towel or a clean cloth to blot up the stains well. And that's how you need to keep doing it before getting into any other procedure to get a better result. 

Step 2

Now, it’s time to use ammonia. And to use it in a proper way, you need to make a solution of it first. So that, you can get better results for sure. 

And for making a solution, take a bowl for mixing all the ingredients together. So, take 1 tablespoon of ammonia into it and add 1/2 cup of water. 

Now, mix these two elements together to make the solution done. 

Step 3

After that, apply the mixture on the stained area to get rid of the stains. Make sure you apply it in a proper way, so that it can sit well. 

But do not use it all over the area of the cloth. It might damage the texture of the fabric. So, apply only the surfaces those are affected and stained.    

Step 4

Now, leave the cloth like this to soak the solution properly. And once you are seeing no such stains, it means the stains are no longer there. 

And at that time, you need to blot it again. Take another paper towel or a clean cloth to remove all the excess moisture, and the solution out of it. That will get all the wetness out of the cloth. 

Step 5

Now, you can wash it off. And you can do this with plain and cool water. Just take a generous amount of water in a bucket, and wash the cloth in it. 

That will take all the ammonia out of the cloth, and you can get a stain-free cloth that you want. 

Step 6

The final step will be drying. You should dry it in the air. No need to use any dryer for this. It is because it can damage the cloth. 

So, take it in the sun or just leave it where it can dry out by air easily.  

Pro Tips To Remove Starch Stains From Clothes

  1. When you are doing scrubbing, always remember that you need to do it in a gentle way, not a harsh way 
  2. Soaking is important that's why you need to do that to get rid of the stains quickly 
  3. Never forget to wear hand gloves when you are working with bleach, ammonia or any other kinds of chemicals 
  4. You can spray water first that will help not to sit the stains on cloth  

Final Thoughts

There are a lot of methods you can apply. But all that matters is the proper outcome that you want. The reason is, it will be a useless method if you cannot get the desired result. 

Basically, your purpose of doing all of these things should be fulfilled. And to achieve that, you need to know all about how to remove starch stains from clothes. And when you will know it, then you should start applying.        

So, get all the things done and then do the procedures. You will surely get your desired result.

Title: How To Remove Stains From Leather Car Seats?
Content:
If you are using your car for a long time, you will notice that the inner parts of it are getting faded. Well, that's not fade. These are just getting stained for regular using. 

It happens more on the car seats. And if the seats are of leathers, then you have to know how to remove stains from leather car seats in a right way. 

There are various kinds of methods that we are going to share. And to know more about this stuff, let's keep reading.

How To Remove Stains ( Dye/Water) From Leather Car Seats?

When it’s about removing car seats that is made of leather, you need to follow some proper steps to have a better outcome. 

And for that reason, at first, know all about how to remove stains from leather car seats, also the effective methods of it. 

And according to your situation, you can decide what method you should pick. So, to know more information about it, let's check the details. 

Method 1: Remove Stain Using Stain Remover

The first method you can use is simple. You just need to use a stain remover on the seats, and see the magic. 

But for using it, you need to know the proper using process of it. That's how you will know the correct process. So that, you will get the perfect outcome. Check the process to know more. 

Step 1:

The first thing that you should know is to take a sponge, and soak it in water. The water should be clean, and the room-temperature one. 

Step 2:

Now, take the sponge, and spray some stain remover on it. That's how you need to soak the sponge with the remover in a proper way. 

Step 3:

After that, take the sponge, and rub all over the leather areas. You will see how magically it removes the stains in seconds. 

Step 4:

Keep doing the same thing until you see the changes to all over the areas. And when you see the seats are all done, and it looks like new, then you need to stop the process. 

Step 5:

For the finishing, you can wipe all the places out with the with a clean cloth. Or, you can skip it too. The reason is, it can dry quickly. And that will be enough to get the perfect, and clean seats ever. 

Method 2: Remove Stain Using Baking Soda

The other amazing ingredient is baking soda. We all know how incredibly this works on several kinds of stains. 

Also, it improves the shine of the surface too. You can also use it on leather car seats. But as leather is a delicate material, you must take proper steps to remove stains of it. 

That's the reason, you have to know the steps of using baking soda in a nice way. So, get the method step by step to know more about it. 

Step 1:

The first thing you need to do is to take baking soda, and sprinkle it on all over the seat area. Make you take the proper amount of the soda to cover all the area. 

Step 2:

Now, take a damp sponge, or a cloth, and rub the places with it. Make surr you don't rub it too harsh. But just do the way you can get rid of the stains. 

Step 3:

After finishing the rubbing on all the areas, now, leave the place for a few hours. You can soak it overnight. That will be much better than ever. 

Step 4:

When you are done with the soaking, you need to do wipe all the soda out of the seat by using a soft cloth. 

All the greasy stains will be absorbed by the baking soda. So, it will be easier to wipe out the dried soda with a cloth. 

Step 5:

After finishing the wiping, again wipe out with a dry towel to get it all clear. Now, use a leather conditioner to protect the seat from further damages. 

Method 3: Remove Stain Using Cream of Tartar and Lime Juice

Cream of tartar is a great ingredient to get rid of any kinds of stains. And lime juice helps to keep the shine on the surface by removing stains as well. 

So, both the ingredients are good to remove the stains. It can also be used on the leather seats. It has the ability to remove all the stains without damaging the material of it. 

That's the reason you can use these two ingredients together. Let's see the methods of using it to get the proper process of it. 

Step 1:

Though it has a mild bleaching process, you need to apply it with much care. At first, you need to make a paste of qual amounts of cream of tartar, and lemon juice. 

Mix these things well to get a perfect paste. And that makes the process easier to apply. 

Step 2:

Now, take the paste, and apply on the leather seats well. Make sure you cover all the areas well that are stained. Otherwise, the stains are not going to remove nicely. 

Step 3:

After applying the mixture, now, let the stains sit for at least half an hour. This will take all the stains away from the leather surface in quickly.  

Step 4:

When you are done with the soaking, now, take a clean cloth, or a sponge, amd damp it in water. Now, wipe all the solution with it. 

After that, take another cloth, and wipe out again to get it properly cleaned. And you will see how it changes the whole look of the car seats. 

Method 4: Remove Stain Using Toothpaste

Using toothpaste is another way to get rid of the stains, even it's on leather surfaces. And if you don't have other ingredients around you at that time, then you can easily use toothpaste. 

It is because it is available in every house. So, use it if you want. But first, know the process of it. That's why take the whole method step by step. 

Step 1:

First of all, take the basic kind of toothpaste for doing this method. The reason is, gel kind of toothpaste doesn’t bring the effective results. 

So, choose the correct toothpaste before starting any kind of process. 

Step 2:

Now, simply apply the paste all over the areas well just like we described in the previous methods. Cover all the areas in an proper way to get the perfect result. 

Step 3:

After that, use any kind of soft bristle scrubber, or a toothbrush to scrub alk the places out. Make sure you don't harsh on them as leather is a delicate fabric. 

Step 4:

After finishing the scrubbing, now, take a damp cloth to wipe all the paste out of the seats. After that, take another dry cloth to wipe out again. That makes the seats clean properly. 

Step 5:

You can apply leather conditioner if you want. It creates a protection on the leather, and saves it from further damage or fading. That's how you need to do all the method with the help of a toothpaste. 

Method 5: Remove Stain Using Rubbing Alcohol and Nail Polish Remover 

Both nail polish remover, and rubbing alcohol helps to reduce stains from various kinds of surfaces. And it also works well on the leather stains too. 

That's why you need to know all about these two elements to do the method in a proper way. So, see the method in details to get the exact idea of it. 

Step 1:

Take a cotton ball and soak it into the nail polish remover, or the rubbing alcohol. And then, take wipe the stains with it. It's almost the same process as the stain remover one. 

Step 2:

Keep doing it on all the areas until you see the changes. And after that, leave it for some time to bring some more changes to it. 

Step 3:

Now, make a mixture of liquid detergent, and water. Now, dip another cloth into the mixture, and start wipe the places with it to make it completely clean. 

Step 4:

Now, leave the seats to air dry naturally. You can use leather conditioner on the materials. And that will be enough for removing the stains. 

Pro Tips for Removing Stains From Leather Car Seats

  • Avoid using brushes, especially stiff brushes if not compulsory 
  • Use gloves before working with any solutions 
  • Do not soak leather with any kind of watery solution for so long 
  • Try to use leather conditioner if you want to make the leather last longer 
  • Avoid leave the leather in the sun because it might fade away the color 

Conclusion

By reading all the different, and effective methods, you already know that how to remove stains from leather car seats simply. 

One more thing, no matter what method you choose, it should provide you the proper outcome that you expected. Also, it should be safe for the leathers too. 

So, giving all these things much priority, you should choose the proper one for removing the stains, and have a new looking seats again.
