Title: How to remove adhesive from hardwood floors
Content:
Hardwood floor makes the house beautiful, and most of the house owners try to install this expensive floor. But some homeowners use carpet to cover up the floor. When we try to rip up the carpet or cover, we will face sticky adhesive all over the floor. Now how to remove adhesive from hardwood floors? You will get a solution from this article. So stay till the end.

How to remove adhesive from hardwood floors

What you will need

For many reasons, people may use covers like linoleum or carpet to cover the hardwood floor. After removing the cover, you may get anxious about removing the glues from the floor. Don’t get stressed; just follow the steps given below to remove the glues from the floor.

The things you’ll need:

  • Towels
  • Heat gun
  • Commercial adhesive removal
  • Peanut butter
  • Dry ice
  • Clean cotton cloth

Step 1

Before removing the adhesive from the floor, you have to clean the floor with water and soap by scrubbing. By this, you can remove a good amount of dirt, oil, adhesive from the floor.

Step 2

To remove the glue substance from the floor, you can try to use peanut butter, especially the organic one. Use your finger to apply the peanut butter on the area in a circular motion. The glue will come up in the form of tiny balls. After finishing applying the peanut butter, you can wipe the butter with soapy water and old cloth. It works.

Step 3

Take a pot with water and boil it on the stove. You can use an electric kettle also to boil the water. Use old towels to soak in hot water. Then use the damp, wet cloth on the adhesive area. Let the warm cloth heat up the adhesive. By this, it will loosen up the stickiness. Leave it for 3 to 5 minutes. Then wipe the area with the towel; you will see the melted adhesive is coming out. Use the scraper to scrub out the remaining adhesive. Make sure to scrub the floor gently.

Step 4

Use a heat gun to remove the glue from the floor. The heat of the heat gun heat ups the glue; by this, it gets easy to remove. You have to use an extension cord to plug the heat gun and use it on the area. While giving heat, you have to give heat closely. Apply heat until you see the glue is melting. Use an old cotton towel to wipe the melted glue. You can re-heat the glue and wipe with the cloth again. After finishing wiping, use the scraper to lift the leftover glue from the floor.

Step 5

If your floor has tough carpet glue, then you can use commercial glue remover. They are available in the market. Before applying the glue remover product, you have to wear masks, eyewear, and gloves to stay safe. Before applying the glue remover, you have to test whether it works or not in a small area. If it works, then proceed. Pour the product on a sponge then apply it on the wood per the packet instruction. Then leave the floor with the adhesive remover to loosen up the glue. Then use the scraper gently to take off the glue from the floor.

Step 6

Using dry ice is a popular method. You have to use gloves and eyewear before using the ice. You will get dry ice in grocery and hardware stores. Take a metal tray and place ½ dry ice on it. Then place the tray with the ice on the glue area and leave it for 1 minute. The ice will first dry up the glue then crack it later. Then use the scraper and remove the cracked glue from the floor.

Final thoughts

A floor with glue substance makes you upset with the look. Do ring the fresh look back of the beautiful hardwood floor; you have to know how to remove adhesive from hardwood floors. These methods help to get rid of the adhesive from the floor once and for all. So don’t feel distressed when you see the floor of your home with all this stickiness. Just use any cleaning steps, and you will have a beautiful house in no time.

Title: How to Remove Cat Urine from Hardwood Floors Ehow
Content:
Having a pet in the house is fun and irritating both. We all love cats, and they are adorable. But you have to train them well, especially the potty training. If you don’t do that, the cat will pee in the house, and your hardwood floor will get stained and damage gradually. It is common to have cat urine on the floor once or twice a day.

The reason you are here is to know how to remove cat urine from hardwood floors Ehow; I hope this article will help you take different steps to remove the stain and use a different cleaning solution.

How to Remove Cat Urine from Hardwood Floors Ehow

Cat urine has a strong odor as it contains ammonia. If the urine is left uncleaned, the cat will get the smell and find the place to do pee again. So it is necessary to clean the cat urine as soon as you can.

If you see a fresh urine puddle, wipe it quickly with a cotton cloth and dry up the area. While soaking up the wetness, use pressure and you can take more cloth if you need them. You can use a paper towel instead of a cloth. Your mission is to keep the area dry whatever you use. Use rags until your cat learns to use the litter box.

You will find a different chemical cleaner to use, pick the right one. Because you have to use the chemical that is friendly to your floor. Before cleaning, test the chemical in a small area or on a small stain area. If the wood doesn’t react, then the cleaner is ok to use. Some products in the market only work with pet urine.

Using hydrogen peroxide is a popular one. Take a paper towel or rag and wet with hydrogen peroxide. Keep the wet towel on the stained area for some hour or overnight. This makes the peroxide sit on the stain. While using the paper towel, make sure it stays wet. Check the towel often while it is on the stain and add peroxide if needed. You can use plastic to cover the stain as a seal. After removing the towel or rag, remove the excess fluid with baking soda. When you feel the stain and odor are absorbed, remove the baking soda and dry it up. For small stain. Pour the peroxide on the stain and check the result in ten minutes.

If the stain is strong and old, you can use two-part peroxide wood bleach that comes with sodium hydroxide and hydrogen peroxide. This bleach is strong, and it requires careful use. You can use rubber gloves while using bleach.

You can use 25-30% vinegar and warm water solution to remove the cat urine stain from the floor completely. Vinegar reduces the effect of ammonia of the urine, so you will not get any odor after using it.

You have to do the process again and again. When you are getting urine smell but not finding the source, use a black light. Use odor remover to remove the odor. If the floor absorbs the urine deep, then you may need to replace the floor.

After finishing the old and new urine stain using the cleaning solution, the wood may get weak or damaged. If the urine gets absorbed, the wood also faces a problem. So you have to reseal the floor by sanding down. You can use sandpaper to sand the floor and stain the floor. You can take advice from experts while picking up the right sandpaper for your floor. Use the floor stain that matches your floor grain. You can get a touch-up pen from the company you have taken the floor.

How to avoid the cat urine stain on the floor

Cats usually pee on the floor to mark the territory and clear waste. So you have to keep a different space in the house. Make the cat feel secure; this cat will not mark the territory by urinating. Pick the right litter box for your cat because the cat loves to stay clean and fussy. Keep the litter box comfortable and clean. The cat will not pee here and there if they like the litter box. Avoid using a covered litter box because the cat likes to stay free, and the covered box will create an odor in the box that will irritate the cat. Make sure the litter box wall is not high for the cat. Keep the litter box in a comfortable place so that your cat will adjust the staying. Keep the litter box clean twice in the day and wash the box once in a month. By this, your cat will stay clean and healthy. If you can maintain these, your cat will stop urinating on the floor, and it will learn to use the litter box.

Faq

Will hydrogen peroxide damage hardwood floors?

you can use hydrogen peroxide without any problem is safe pets and humans as it works as a powerful cleaning solution.  It helps to give the floor a new look.

How do you neutralize the smell of cat urine?

Use uric acid as an enzyme cleaner, and it helps to neutralize the cat urine odor.

Is vinegar safe on hardwood floors?

The water and vinegar mixture is a totally safe cleaning solution for hardwood floors. The vinegar has acid that breaks the floor finish sometime and makes the floor dull. Then you may have to reseal the floor.

Final thought

All love cats, and it is a great animal as a pet. But you have to train the cat to use the litter box to urinate. Until then, you have to face a urine puddle on your floor. As urine is strong in odor and comes with a chemical substance, it creates a stain on the floor. If you don’t take proper step to clean the urine fast, your floor will get stained and gets damaged. So train your cat and learn how to Remove Cat Urine from Hardwood Floors Ehow from this article.

Title: How to Remove Dog Urine from Hardwood Floors
Content:
When you have dogs in your home, you have to stay ready for any situation, be it good or bad. The most common issue we face while taking care of a pet is the urine. When you are training your puppy, getting a urine stain is normal. If you don't clean the urine properly, then the stain and odor will gradually damage your floor or carpet. You have to know how to remove dog urine from hardwood floors properly to avoid unwanted damages. In this article, the urine stain and odor removing process are given in detail. Stay till the end.

How to protect wood floors from dog urine

Why is it essential to remove urine stains and odor from the hardwood floors? The urine contains uric acid and ammonia that damage the hardwood's protective layer entirely, and it is hard and expensive to fix the hardwood floor.

If the urine gets soaked on the hardwood floor, the area creates a dark spot and a bad smell. If the area is damp, then the wood gets to swell up, and gradually the wood gets rotten.

The steps to follow to eliminate odor and stain:

When you are ready to clean the hardwood floor, you have to follow the steps given below-

To clean the urine from the floor, at first, you have to dry up the floor with rags or cotton towel. You can also use paper instead of a towel. You have to soak up the urine before the floor soaks it up. Dry up the floor as soon as you can. After drying up, use water and wipe the floor until the urine is cleared up.

To deep clean the area, you have to use water and vinegar mixture. Mix 50% water and 50% vinegar and spray the solution in the area. Wait for 15 minutes and wipe. You have to use dry cotton made towel to wipe. You can use this solution several times as it is a natural deodorizer. 

If your floor has an old urine stain, then you have to work harder because it is not easy to get rid of them. The floor may get this stain from the old owner of your home, or while changing furniture, you may notice the stain. It is hard but not impossible to clean the stain. To remove the stain, you have to:

Cleaning with vinegar and baking soda mixture is fruitful. After wiping the floor with water and vinegar mixture, spray the baking soda on the area. Cover the area with mat or cloth and leave it overnight. In the day, use a vacuum to clean the soda from the floor. Depending on the stain, you may need to repeat the cleaning process.

You can use hydrogen peroxide to remove the old stain. Wet the area by pouring the hydrogen peroxide. You will see foam is creating in the area. Wait for five minutes and then use a cotton towel to wipe the chemical. You have to use it a few times to remove the stain completely.

Some use hair developer solutions as a stain cleaner. This solution works like a bleaching agent. Apply the solution in the area and wait for 15 minutes. Then wipe the area and dry the floor with ventilation. This solution works well to remove odor and stain from the floor. You can use a sander and apply the solution. After 20 minutes, scrub the area to wash the stain. If still the stain remains on the floor, use stronger bleach like chlorine. It will work for sure.

If any of the solutions mentioned above don't work, then you have to use commercial products. Sometimes the wood soaks the urine and smells bad, and the natural remedy doesn't work. It is the time when you have to use a commercial stain remover. Before using the solution, you have to clean the area then apply the solution. With a clean towel, blot and wipe the area. To remove the stink, you will get some products. Just spray and dry the area. Then wipe the area clean.

Some may use a steam mop to wipe the urine area. But the vapor and pressure don't work well for the wood.

After cleaning the urine stain from the hardwood floor, you can reseal it to protect the top layer. Use sandpaper and spirits with colorant that helps to apply the good wood finish. If your floor needs more care, then you can take help from professionals to fix it.

How to prevent the urine stains on the hardwood floor

To avoid the pet's urine stains on the hardwood floor, you have to train your dog to use a litter box. It will take time and test your patience, but it is worth it in the long run. Keep some rags until the pet learns to use the litter box. Clean the urine fast to stop the stain and odor from spreading. Follow some intervals in giving food and water to your dog. After feeding, take the pet to the litter box and wait. Usually, the pet takes 5-30 minutes to urinate.  The adult pets give signs like walking or whining when they need to do pee. When the pets follow your obey, praise them, and when they do not, scold them gently. You can use a plastic tube as a pet litter box. Whatever the box is made of, just train your pet well to save your floor getting stained and smelly.

Final thought

If you have a pet in the home, you have to face a urine stain on your floor. The maximum time it happens accidently, and you have to clean it. You have to stay alert that your pet is doing a pee in the litter box. When you find the urine on the floor, clean it fast, don't let the floor soak the urine. If you do not clean the urine properly, your pet will come back and so pee in the same place again. So clean it properly with a proper cleaning solution. To help you, if you have a new pet in the house, this article about how to remove dog urine from hardwood floors is enough. If you are not able to clean the stains properly, take professional help.

Title: How to Wash A Jansport Backpack
Content:
Do you like to travel? If you like traveling then you must have taken backpack during the traveling days. And if that is so then it's natural to get the backpack dirty easily. That's why you need to clean it often. And for that reason you need to know how to wash a jansport backpack.

Well, there are several methods of cleaning that you can find. But you have to apply the best method of all. That's why you have to know what the best method above all the regular methods.

Let's get right into the description to know what the best technique is and how you should apply it.

Methods of washing a Jansport Backpack  

When It's about washing a jansport backpack, then things need to be handled carefully. And to do that, you have to know how to wash a jansport backpack in a proper way.

And also, you have to execute it properly. It is because without doing it, you won't be able to have a properly cleaned backpack.

So, if you want your backpack to be cleaned properly, then know the methods and execute it as described. So, let's get right into it.

Method 1: Hand Washing  

The easiest cleaning above all is the basic one. The materials of different backpacks are different. And according to that, you need to decide what procedure you should follow.

But the basic cleaning is suitable for almost all kinds of materials. Let's check the method and see how it works.

Step 1: Unloading

The first thing you have to do is the unloading or the emptying of the backpack. The reason is, if you unload it then it will much easier to hold the backpack while washing.

But the most important thing is the stuff that you have stored inside the backpack. There could be a lot of things inside your backpack. And those things might be important for you. So, these things have to be removed before washing.

That's why take the backpack and take everything out of the backpack and also of the each and every pocket of it. You can also shake it over and move it upside down for getting all the dirt and garbage out of it properly. 

Step 2: Cleaning

After emptying the entire backpack, now it's time to clean it. And while cleaning, you need to be careful. You have to make sure that all the dirt will be gone from the backpack and also from the pockets.

Also, you have to make sure that the outside part of the backpack as well as the inside should be cleaned properly. No dust should be present in it. Besides, you can simply use water to clean it. Just take a cloth and soak it with water. Then take the damp cloth and wipe the area with it.

Step 3: Pockets cleaning

Cleaning the pockets and all the inner areas is as much important as cleaning the outside of the backpack. It's important because almost all the garbage belong to that area. So, cleaning it completely is compulsory.

And to do that, at first, you have to take all the dust and garbage out of every pockets of it. You have to be careful if there is any dirt remaining or not. You have to clean the inner area in an appropriate way.

You can also use a sponge to clean the mesh. The sponge is able to clean all the dirt quickly. As you know that mesh pockets are delicate so that, these pockets have a chance to be destroyed easily. That's why to clean it safely, you can use sponge to do the job.

Step 4: Disinfecting

In this time of Covid, maintaining hygiene is compulsory. Though backpacks are used for traveling outside, It's important to disinfect it. And in recent times, only cleaning is not enough. You have to disinfect the entire body of it after cleaning.

And when you are done with cleaning, now you have to disinfect it with any kind of disinfectant product. The reason is, hygiene is important.

So, take all the things out and make it completely cleaned. Now, take a disinfectant product like Pine-Sol or Lysol and mix it with lukewarm water. After that, take a sponge and soak it in that solution. Take the sponge and wipe the entire backpack with it.

Step 5: Drying

After getting done with all the cleaning steps, now it's time for drying. Though you are using water for cleaning the entire backpack, you have to dry it well before thinking of using it again.

That's why leave the backpack in an area and allow it to dry in the air. You can use a hanger to hang it, and to get it completely cleaned. And that's how, you can use it again.

Step 6: Ongoing maintenance

For keeping it clean, you have to do a good maintenance. As it is used when you Are going outside for adventure, it's natural to be dirty. That's why keeping it in a maintenance is necessary.

And to do that, you can do regular cleaning. Such as, you can take a sponge or a cloth and wipe the areas out nicely. You can also use a brush to dust off the dirt. So, if you can take proper care of it, you can hope to have your loveable backpack for a lifetime.

Method 2: Washing Machine Cleaning 

If you want to know about an easy and quick way to clean a backpack, then cleaning in a washing machine should be mentioned.

When you are in a hurry, and you have no such time for cleanin, then this process will help you more. But one thing that you have to know in this case and that is, you cannot wash those backpacks in a washing machine that are made of leather. Otherwise, you can totally use it if it’s made of other materials.   

So, let's check the descriptions without any further delay.

Step 1: Store the backpack in a laundry bag

First of all, store the backpack in a laundry bag. It is because if you do that then all the processes will be much easier to do. Also, the dirt of it won't make other things dirty if you keep it aside in a laundry bag. So, make sure you will do it. 

Step 2: Add detergent in the machine

Now, pour some detergent into the machine and turn the switch on. Make sure you don’t use a lot of detergent for this purpose. You need to use a small amount of it.

Step 3: Washing

Now, its time for washing. And for that, you have to take the backpack and put it inside the machine. You need to add some cold or lukewarm water for getting better results.

During the washing process, if you feel that the machine couldn't take the load then pause the process, and adjust the backpack. And then, run the machine to get a cleaned backpack in an easy way.

Step 4: Drying

When you are done with your cleaning, now you have to dry all over the backpack. And for doing the drying, at first, remove the backpack from the pillowcase. Now take a dry towel and wipe it down well. Make sure all the moisture will be soaked. And it will be done for reusing. 

Pro Tips to Wash A Jansport Backpack

  1. Never use bleach or harmful chemical to clean the backpack.
  2. Avoid using suede or any kind of leather trim.
  3. Don't use a brush and rub it harshly. It will be harmful for the texture of the leather.
  4. No leather bag can be washed in a washing machine. So, make sure of that.   

Conclusion

There are different types of methods. But we have described some of the best of all. That's why you have to think before getting into any conclusion.

At first, you need to know what kind of backpack is this and how much stains are present. And according to that, you have to decide what process you want to apply.

But the most important thing is to know all about how to wash a jansport backpack. And if you can know every advantages and disadvantages of these methods then YOU can surely get the perfect result of cleaning.

So, make sure you do these steps properly and have a cleaned backpack to get into the adventurous life again!

Title: How Does Steam Cleaning Work on Carpets?
Content:
Cleaning rugs are tough. And when It's about steam cleaning, things can be complicated if you don't execute it properly. That's why you need to know about how does steam cleaning work on carpets.          

Well, steam cleaning needs a little bit of preparation and proper execution. And for that, you have to know the process quiet well.

To know more about it, let's get into the deeper description!

Method of steam cleaning on carpets

There is a certain process of steam cleaning. You need to know this for doing a better job. There might be some more techniques of steam cleaning of carpets. But we are going to share one of the best of all.

So, let's check how does steam cleaning work on carpets, and how you are going to execute it. 

Step 1: clean the room

First thing you need to do is to clean the room. It's important because if you clean the room and all the things of it will be organized, then it will be much easier to do the steaming.

The other thing is, if you take the carpet out and clean it outside of the room then it will be another easy way to do steam cleaning. So, take the carpet out of the room if possible. And if it isn't possible, then you can also clean it in your room. But all you need to do is to clean the entire room first.

And for doing it, at first, remove all the equipment, furniture, toys, and other stuff out from the carpet. And if there is any furniture that is heavy and cannot be removed easily, then you can wrap the legs of it before cleaning. So that, it won't be dirty.

Step 2: Use vacuum cleaner

Before getting into the steaming process, you need to clean the surface of the carpet in a proper way. And for cleaning it properly, you have to vacuum the areas of the carpet.

We don’t suggest you to use any other alternative because the vacuum cleaner will be perfect for cleaning the carpet with less effort and trouble.

And to do the process, you need to vacuum the areas twice. It is because it will get hair, dust and all the loose dirt out of carpet.

And for doing it, run the vacuum in one direction at the first time. And at the second time, you need to run the vacuum in opposite direction. In that way, you can get all the dirt removed easily.

Step 3: Take care of spots

You need to do another thing before steam cleaning. And that is to take the spots out of the carpet if there is any. It's important to do that because it can make the carpet completely cleaned.

There might be several regular spots like food stain, lipstick stain, any kind of color, and also wine spills. All these stains make the carpet look dirty.

So, that's why you have to be careful about these things and clean it with the carpet stain remover and a piece of cloth. 

Step 4: Prepare the steam cleaner

Now, you should start the steam cleaning. And for doing it, you have to do the preparation first. The reason is, preparation will make things much easier and you can do the cleaning fast.

And for doing it, you need to take that steam cleaner and fill the tank with water. And if it is detachable then filling will be easy. Fill the tank with distilled water by the help of a measuring cup. 

After that, attach the plug and allow it to heat.

Step 5: Cleaning

Now, you should start cleaning. Run the steam cleaner on your carpet. Make sure you start doing it from one corner to another.

We would suggest you to start the cleaning from the corner of the door to the opposite corner of the carpet. Run the cleaner over the carpet twice. And that's how you can get the perfect cleaning of your carpet in an easy way.

Step 6: Drying

After getting done with all the cleaning, now it's time to get the carpet properly dried.

Although you know that this steam cleaning process does not leave a lot of water in the carpet, still you need to dry the carpet well after being done with the steaming process.

And though you are using hot water, it will take at least 12 hours to completely dry it. That's why allow your carpet for drying well for some hours.

Also, for that, you can use fan. You can also keep the window open for fast drying. And all the processes make the cleaning quick and trouble-free. 

Pro Tips of Steam Cleaner Work

  1. For quick cleaning, you can use any kind of solution like vinegar or baking soda solution for easy cleaning. Hydrogen peroxide or rubbing alcohol will also be the suitable one for this purpose.
  2. Try to use stain resistant carpets if you can.
  3. If your carpet has fleas then try to get rid of it as soon as possible.
  4. Also, make sure the carpet has no odor. You can use any kind of essential oil in this case.

Wrap Up

We have tried to share some interesting facts about steam cleaning the carpet. You have to know about how does steam cleaning work on carpets. And you can know it by reading this article.      

There can be some other methods too. But we are trying to give you the best and quick idea above all.

Try to learn the hacks properly, and execute it appropriately. So that, you will get the best benefits for sure.

Title: How To Remove Oil Stains From Teak Wood?
Content:
Teak wood is that kind of a material that we use for many purposes. But if there will be an oil stain on it, then it will be a bit difficult to remove that.

But you can do it if you have some good knowledge about it. And to get the proper knowledge, you have to know how to remove oil stains from teak wood.

Well, we are going to describe some useful ideas of removing this kind of stains. And to know more about it, check the methods in details.

4 Easy Methods of Removing Oil Stains from Teak Wood

Removing oil stains from teak wood might be a tricky task as a teak wood absorbs oil quickly. And that's why you need to be sure what procedure will work on the stains.

And to know the effective methods and the procedures of it, let's get right into the detailed descriptions of every method.

Method 1: Detergent Solution

Detergent is a cleaning solution that works on almost all types of materials. Whether it's fabric, steel or wood, you can use detergent to clean that place out.

And in the case of teak wood, you can also use this ingredient. So, let's see what the actual procedure is.

Step 1

At first, you need to blot the stained area. And for doing that, you need to use paper towel or a clean cloth. You can use newspaper too. 

Use a pressing motion to do the blotting. Keep pressing on that stained area until the oil will be soaked completely.

Step 2

After that, you need to make the solution. And to prepare it, you will need warm water. Take a bowl and add the water in it.

And then add some mild detergent into it. Stir the mixture well to dissolve the detergent and the solution will be ready.

Step 3

Now, take a cloth and dip it into the mixture to get soaked. And then, clean the stained area with it. Rub the area properly to get stains away. It can easily take away the stains. 

But if the stains are tough then you can use a soft brush to rub the place with it. 

Step 4

After finishing cleaning, take another clean cloth and clean the area properly. You can also rinse that place for a better cleaning. Or wipe it out with a wet cloth. 

And that will help to clean all the leftover of the oil. And also, it will remove the stains too. 

Step 5

And these steps are enough to remove oil stains. But you also need to be sure whether the area is being dried after the cleaning or not. 

And to do that, you need to do nothing. You just leave the wood in that same place so that, it can dry in the air properly. And that will take the stains away completely.

Method 2: Use Ammonia

Using ammonia is another effective way to get rid of any kind of stain. But to do that, you need to be sure about the applying procedure of it. 

And for that, you must follow the rules of using it. To know all the rules and regulations, let's see the technique in detail first.

Step 1

Make the mixture first. And to do it, take a bowl and pour 4 parts of hot water into it. And then, take 1 part of ammonia and mix these two elements well. 

You have to be sure of the temperature of water. It has to be hot but not boiling hot. So that, it will not make any cremations with ammonia.

Step 2

After that, take a cloth and soak it by dipping it into the solution. The cloth should be soaked properly. So that, you can apply the mixture well. Also, wring out the excess water to easily wipe out.    

After that, clean the stained area with the cloth. Slightly rub that place to remove stain. You can use a soft brush to do it properly until the stains are gone.         

Step 3

Repeat the process until the stains are completely gone. And if you do it in a proper way, then the stains will definitely gone. So, make sure you follow the rules. 

Step 4

Now, take a clean cloth and wipe out the excess. Also, you can use a wet cloth or go for rinsing. That will clean the wood completely and you can use it again.

Step 5

Last but not the least, dry the wood after finishing the washing of it. So that, the material of it will be fine. And no damages will be occured. So, make sure you do that thing properly.

Method 3: Linseed and Gum Turpentine

When it’s about removing the oil stains from teak wood, you can take another method and that is to use a solution of linseed and gum turpentine. 

It can do a great job if you use it properly. Let's see the procedure first. 

Step 1

At first, make the solution in a proper way. And to make it, take a bowl and take 4 tablespoons of linseed oil and 2 tablespoons of gum turpentine. Mix three ingredients well. 

Make sure you use boiled linseed oil to make the solution. Now, mix the ingredients properly to make the appropriately.             

Step 2

After that, soak a cloth in this mixture to wipe out the area. Make sure you soak properly and then squeeze out the excess. That will help to wipe out the stained area in a proper way. 

Now, wipe out the area that has stains. Use a brush if the stains are tough to remove. But do not rub it too hard. And you will see the stains will start fading away. 

Step 3

Repeat the wiping procedure if you think the stains are not gone yet. Keep doing it until the stains are gone. And when the stains are gone, now you can stop the wiping procedure. 

Step 4

After finishing the removing the stains, now take another clean cloth and clean the excess solution out of it. And if the wiping cannot dry the surface then keep it like that for some time to air dry. And then, you can use it again. 

Method 4: Mineral Spirits 

Mineral spirits will also be a good solution to do the removing process. In the case of teak wood, it will be helpful to remove any kind of stain including oil stain. 

But there is a using process that you need to know. And what are they? Let's find out! 

Step 1

Starting with selecting the proper mineral spirit, you can use any of them. You can use paint thinner, or any other kinds of oil as well. It will help to take any kind of grease or oil away from the wood. 

Step 2

So, to use it, take a soft cloth and soak it with spirit. Squeeze the cloth to remove excess solution. After that, wipe out the areas well. That will remove the stains.

Step 3

Repeat the processes until the stains are fading away. And after the stains are gone, you can now let the wood be in place for some time to dry. So that, you can use it again like before.

Pro Tips of Removing Oil Stains from Teak Wood

  1. When you are working with chemical or something like that, make sure you must wear gloves 
  2. Do not use too much hot water 
  3. Make sure the brush you are using for rubbing is not hard, otherwise it can make scratches 
  4. While using ammonia, take a test on a small part of the wood because it might cause discoloration sometimes 

Final Words 

There are also other kinds of methods that are effective. We are just sharing some of them. And we must say, these techniques are also incredible to remove oil stains. 

No matter what procedure you use, it should work properly and fulfil your purpose. And if you want to know about this, then you need to know how to remove oil stains from teak wood properly.      

And after learning all about it, now you can start the process and remove the stains and get rid of the trouble. Hope you find better results and don’t forget to share your experience of using the methods!

Title: How To Remove Glue Stains From Shoes?
Content:
Almost any kind of glue is used for fixing different types of things. And when you are using it, it won't be an unusual thing to get any stain in your clothes or shoes.

At that time, what are you going to do? All you will need to know about how to remove glue stains from shoes.

And if you get these things then you can do the removing process in a quick way. So, let's learn the techniques without wasting any time.

How To Remove Glue Stains From Shoes - 3 Effective Methods

There are several kinds of methods available in this case. Glue stains are sticky and might be tough to remove if no proper step will be taken. 

However, it can be easier if you apply the perfect method for removing it. But what will be the perfect method or methods? Well, there are many of it. 

All you can do is to know how to remove glue stains from shoes well. And then decide what procedure you want to take to remove the stains perfectly. 

So, without wasting much time, let's see the descriptions below.          

Method 1: scraping Off

The simplest and basic method is to scrape off the glue from the surface of the shoe.  And that will take the dried glue away from the shoe in an easy way. To know more, see the steps. 

Step 1 

Take a spoon or a butter knife and scrape off as much glue as possible. That way, the dried glue will be take out from the shoe surface in an easy way. 

Step 2

Now, take a cloth and clean the excess glue nicely. You need to do this by using a light hand. Also, do the same way while scraping off. That will help not to tear the fabric or damage it. 

Step 3

Now, you need to clean it up. To do the best cleaning, first soak it well. And for soaking, use cold water. Take a large bowl or a bucket and take water into it. 

After that, soak the shoe by submerging it in a proper way. You need to soak it overnight. So that, it will let go the glue quickly.    

Step 4

Then, take the shoes out of the bucket and rinse it with cold water. And that will clean the shoe properly. 

Step 5

After finishing the cleaning, now you have to take it to a place to air dry in a proper way. So that, it will be dried and you can wear it again. 

Method 2: Use Enzyme Cleaner

The other way you can apply, and that is enzyme cleaner. It will help to get all the dirt, and the glue in an easy way. But you have to use it properly. 

So, to know the process perfectly, let's check the detailed description. 

Step 1

At first, you can scrape it off just like the previous method. Or, you can just apply any kind of the enzyme cleaner to remove the glue completely. 

And to do that, take a bowl and mix the enzyme clean with water. And thus make the mixture by stirring it nicely. 

Step 2

Now, apply the mixture on the stains and let it be there to soak in a proper way. You need to wait for a few hours. 

Step 3

Now, take a toothbrush and scrub all over the area well. You need to do it in a light hand. Otherwise, the fabric might get damaged. 

Step 4

Once you are seeing the glue comes out and the stains start fading, you need to stop the scrubbing at that time. 

Step 5

After that, rinse the whole shoe with plain water. And then, let the shoe be in a place to air dry quickly. And that will be enough.           

Step 6

You can also.use acetone in case you don't have enzyme cleaner. The entire soaking procedure is easy to apply and you need to do it in the same way. And for the finishing, rinse off and air dry. That will be enough.                  

Method 3: Heating 

The heating procedure is also a great thing you can do with the unwanted glue stains. The entire process is simple. You just need to follow the direction in a right way. 

And that will take the glue away from the shoe surface. Know the process in details first. 

Step 1

Take any kind of heating equipment. You can use hair dryer machine as it will be available in almost every house. Moreover, it is handy. So, you can take this for doing the process. 

Step 2

First thing you need to do is, take the shoe and hold the hair dryer on the stained area. Make sure you hold the dryer close to the stains but not too close to burn it. You just need to melt the glue to remove it. So, be careful of that thing. 

Step 3

Now, do the meting process for a few minutes. Make sure the glue is properly melted. Otherwise, it will be hard to clean. 

Step 4

Once the glue is properly melted, you need to use a clean cloth to remove the glue properly from the shoe surface. Make sure you won't rub it too harsh but just clean it in a gentle way. 

Step 5

After that, you need to wash the shoe with plain water to get rid of all the glue appropriately. So, do it into a bucket and wash all the things off. 

Step 6

Now, it's time to dry it out. And to do that, simply leave the shoe in a place to dry in the air. And that will be enough for getting a cleaned shoe ever.   

Method 4: Vinegar 

Vinegar can also be used for removing the glue stains from shoes. And to do that, you need to be careful about all the steps and rules of it. So, for that, you must learn the steps properly and then start applying this. 

To learn the exact process, let's get right into the deeper description below. 

Step 1

First of all, take the shoe and remove the laces of it. The reason is, it will be easier to work with if there is no lace included. 

Step 2

After that, take a cotton cloth and soak it well with vinegar. Make sure you soak the cloth well so that, removing the stains will be much easier. 

Step 3

Now, take the cloth and rub the stained surface with it. Make sure you won't rub it to harsh. Rub it in a gentle way so that the fabric won't get damaged and the stains will be gone too. 

Step 4

After that, leave the place that is rubbed with vinegar and let it dry. After a few minutes, take a spoon or a butter knife and scrape the excess glue away from the surface.   

Step 5

You can now wash the entire shoe to clean it out properly. Or, you can just let it be there just like that. And it will be enough. You can wear it now.  

Method 5: Mild Soap 

Using a mild soap will be another effective technique to remove glue from the shoes. This process will completely wash out all the stains of glue in an easy way. 

So, for understanding the whole process, learn the steps well. 

Step 1

Take a bucket and pour some warm water in it. Now, add mild soap and mix these two things well. You can also add some salt and laundry detergent in it. And then you need to make the mixture in this way. 

Step 2:

Now, take the shoes and put them in the bucket for soaking. You need to soak it for a few minutes to loosen up the glue. 

Step 3:

After that, take the take a toothbrush and gently rub the surface to get the glue out of the shoe. Make sure the fabric won't be damaged anyhow. 

Step 4:

After that, rinse the shoes well with water. And That's how all the glue residues and stains will be removed easily.

Step 5:

Take the shoes to place in an opened place so that the shoe can be dried well. And once it is dried, then you can use the shoes again.        

Pro Tips of Remove Glue Stains From Shoes

  1. Don't scrub too hard, it might damage the fabric of the shoe 
  2. Must wear gloves when you are applying any kind of chemical 
  3. Do not let the shoes wet for long time 
  4. Dry it well in the air but make sure you won't use any dryer 

Final Words  

You have seen some of the effective techniques that we shared to remove the glue stains from the shoe. Learn the techniques well to know how to remove glue stains from shoes. 

Try the techniques out and don't forget to share your experience with us!

Title: How To Remove Red Clay Stains From Concrete?
Content:
Anything from the concrete will be tough to remove. The reason is the material of it. The red clay shows when there happens heavy rainfall.

Concrete absorbs the red clay and it goes into the pores easily at that time. And if it stays for a long time then it will create stains. So, at that time, you need to remove it as soon as possible.

And for removing, you need to know about how to remove red clay stains from concrete. And to know the application of it, let's check the method in detail.

How To Remove Red Clay Stains From Concrete

Several methods can be found but you have to apply that one that is effective. And generally using a red clay stains remover is effective.

Different people use it in a different way. It is an acidic cleanser and it can be used for this purpose.

Also, it is a chemical cleaner with a hint of mechanical combination. And that is powerful to wash out all the red clay and its stains.

So, it can remove red clay stains easily. But one thing that you should be careful of and that is to know the process of using it. The reason is, not all acid cleaners are the same.

That's why you have to know how to remove red clay stains from concrete in an easy way. Check the details and the method step by step for more information.

Step 1

For doing this process, you need to use hand pump sprayer. The reason is, it will make bubbles and that will help to throw the clay out of the concrete quickly. 

So, make sure you have a hand pump while doing it. 

Step 2

Also, you need to wear safety goggles, hand gloves, safety shoes and all the other things that would protect you if you are going to use this acid. 

As you working with acidic solution, so that you have to wear these things unless you cannot execute this procedure.

Step 3

Now, start the process by applying red clay stains remover all over the concrete. You have to make sure if all the red clay stain area is covered with this solution. That will help to get rid if the stains in a proper way. 

Step 4

After finishing applying the remover, let the solution sit for at least 2-3 minutes. And once the time is over, then power washing the area. 

You must use it to wash off all the excess solution and also the red clay. So, do the power washing and move the red clay off the surface completely.  

But make sure you do this thing right after the sitting of the stain remover. And remove it from the area in a proper way. Otherwise, it can resettle in the other place and you need to do the same processes again. 

Step 5

Once you are done with all the removing process, now you can wipe the concrete floor with a clean cloth to make it dry. 

Otherwise, you can leave the floor just like that to dry in the air. And that will be enough to have a clean, clay-less concrete floor. 

Pro Tips of Remove Red Clay Stains From Concrete

  1. Do not apply this method without wearing safety equipment
  2. Must do it in a fast way after applying the solution on the concrete
  3. Use a clay stains remover that is of good quality
  4. Do not let the remover sit for a long time, otherwise it might damage Thematerial
  5. Avoid using any scrubbing process

What can you do to make the removing thing easier for future?

After finishing the cleaning, you can take a few steps to make this kind of cleaning and stain removing thing much easier. Also, it will make less stains if you take the necessary steps.

And what you can do is to consult a team that can remove this stain problem permanently. It will certainly penetrate the surface but not change the look of it at all.

Moreover, it creates a safety layer so that it won't damage the concrete in future. Also, the future cleanings will be much easier if you do this.

There is also a reason of it. And that is, if you will do the extra steps then it will be difficult for red clay to absorb into the pores of bricks and concrete. 

So, you should do it as it will clear all your problem make their solutions ever easier.

Can you use bleach directly instead of red clay stains remover?

If you want to know whether you can use bleach for cleaning ted clay and its stains or not, then the answer is yes. You can totally use bleach for this purpose.

Almost every stain and rust remover has oxalic acid. And that means bleach. So, apparently, bleach is used as a cleaning agent. And also for cleaning the red clay stains, you can use it too.

But when using it on concrete, make sure it is wet. Do not use bleach directly on the concrete floor.

On the other hand, you should see the labels of the bleach and if it will be suitable for red clay or not.

Otherwise, it might harm the concrete and damage it. And make sure you are careful while checking those labels. That element shouldn’t touch your skin.

Besides, you need to wear safety equipment to protect your body from its bad effect on skin. And after applying the bleach, you must wait for a while for getting a better result. Also, you might need to reapply it if needed.

So, the ultimate answer is yes, you can use bleach for cleaning red clay stains but you need to be careful about all these stuff. And that will be enough.

Wrap Up

To conclude it, you will see, there can be other procedures that could be effective. But this process would be the best.

All you need to do is to be careful while doing this method and know all about how to remove red clay stains from concrete first. So that, you can do all the things properly and surely get the better results out of it.

Do the things right and don't forget to share your feedback and experience about it!

Title: How To Clean Glass Top Stove Burnt On Plastic?
Content:
Do you need to cook often? And do you have a mess on your glass top stove because of this? Then you must know how to clean glass top stove burnt on plastic. 

Well, we know that cleaning those kinds of things won't be an easy task. And the plastic doesn't want to come out from the surface. 

But you need to do it anyhow. And to solve your problem, we are going to describe some of the effective and easy ways to get the things done. So, without wasting any time, let's dive in!

Cleaning Process of Glass Top Stove Burnt On Plastic 

Cleaning all the mess after being done with cooking is a tough part. And if you want to clean the stove and make it like a new one then you have to know about how to clean glass top stove burnt on plastic. So, get the steps well and then apply.   

And for doing this, things you will need are: 

  • Knife or a spoon 
  • Plastic scraper (use razor blade instead) 
  • WD-40 
  • Soap 
  • Baking soda
  • Acetone nail polish remover 
  • Soft cloth 
  • And water 

Step 1: Cooling Down The Stove First! 

First step will be the cooling down the stove. It is because the stove will get hot while cooking. And you cannot do any cleaning process on that hot stove. 

Also, it can be harmful if you try to do it with that stove. It can burn you anyway. 

So, try to leave it for some minutes or an hour until the stove cools down completely. 

Step 2: Peeling 

And when the burner is cooled down properly, now it's time to peel the plastic off from the stove. At that stage, you might not be able to peel off all the plastic. 

So, try to do this as much as you can. That will help to do the next steps easily.   

Step 3: Scrapping Away 

Now, take a knife for scrapping. A butter knife will be better for doing this. It can scrape the plastic away in a mild way. And that's why it won't damage the texture of the glass stove.   

Besides, you can also use a spoon if you have no butter knife around you. It works the same way. 

You just need to scrape it gently. And make sure you won't make any scratch on the glass of the stove. 

Step 4: Soaking 

After that, take WD-40 and spray it all over the area. Now, let it be there for some minutes. That will help to soak properly. 

But, if you don't have that, then you can also use olive oil instead of it. That will also be beneficial.  

Soak it in the same way. And leave the stove there. 

Step 5: Scrape Again 

It's time to rescrape it. At that time, take a razor blade and with the help of it, you can scrape easily. 

You have to make sure of your holding angle. You need to hold the razor in a straight way. So, take the blade and hold it as straight as possible. This will help to avoid scratching on the surface of the stove. 

So, maintain that and steadily scrape the plastic out of the stove. You will see, this helps to get the burnt plastic out without harming the texture of the glass. 

Step 6: Baking Soda Solution 

After being done with the scrapping, you can now use a solution for getting a better result. And to do that, take baking soda and sprinkle all over the surface that you want to clean.  

As you know, baking soda works magically, especially on the tough stains. And when it's about cleaning the burnt plastic on a glass stove and try to make it like a new one, you can use it for sure. 

So, spread baking soda all over the area and let it be soaked for a generous amount of time.   

Step 7: Scrub Off 

Again, you need to scrub those soaked areas after getting done with soaking. And for doing this, you will need a soft cloth. 

And with it, scrub those areas in a gentle way. The main purpose of it should be the cleaning of the plastic. So, make sure it won't do any kind of scratch on the surface. 

And by considering these things, scrub the places, and clean all over. 

Step 8: Repeat 

You can consider these steps as the proper cleaning process. You can repeat these steps if you see any stain or plastic that isn't scrubbed off yet. 

So, at that time, repeat as many times as you want. All you need to be satisfied with the results. That's why do the procedures again until all the plastics are removed well.  

Step 9: Nail Polish Remover for finishing 

You can stop at the previous step. But you can do one more additional thing. And that is to use nail polish remover. 

It will help to make the stove cleaner than before. All you need to do is soaking. 

At this stage of cleaning, the maximum part of the burnt plastic is removed. So, you don't need to give a lot of effort now. 

Just take the remover and apply it to soak. Take a cotton ball or a soft cloth or whatever soft textured thing you like, and then soak it with the liquid remover. 

Now, apply at the places where you want a specific cleanup.  

Well, if you use the acetone nail polish remover before, you must knew that it can evaporate quickly. That's why you must keep using it often to keep the moisture. So, keep reapplying it. 

Step 10: Scrub Again 

After soaking, you have to scrub it again. You can use a regular scrubber for that. And then, start scrubbing it all over the area in a gentle way. 

That will help to get the leftover plastic out from the stove in an easy way. And no scratches will be created because of this technique.   

Step 11: Cleaning 

At this point, you will find most of the places without any kind of plastic on it. So, it will easier to do this. Now, it's time to do ultimate cleaning. And for that, use a mild soap to clean it perfectly. 

And you will need warm water with it. Mix these things together, and clean all the areas of that stove. Make sure there is no oil, or any other residue exist. 

And in that way, you can get a properly cleaned surface. And after that, you can take another soft cloth, and clean it again by soaking it with water. 

Step 12: Drying 

Now, you can wipe it out to make it completely dry. Also, you can air dry it. Just leave it for some hours and it will be dry naturally.   

And that's all it is. You can apply these steps, and make the rusty, dirty glass stove a new one.

Pro Tips To Clean Glass Top Stove Burnt On Plastic?

  1. Avoid using a stiff brush on glass stove if you have other options.
  2. Be gentle and scrub the surface but make sure you don't make any scratches at all.
  3. Use olive oil or any kind of oil to keep the moisture of the stove.

Final Words

There are a lot of methods you can find online. But we are trying to give you some authentic and effective methods that will help you more. 

All you need to know about how to clean glass top stove burnt on plastic. And if you can get the proper idea of it, then you can execute the method well, and get the desired results as well. 

So, get these things well and do as described. You will surely get rid of the tough plastic, and make your glass top stove look like new and shiny!

Title: How To Get Rid of Bed Bugs Naturally?
Content:
Do you have bed bugs in your house? And does it irritate you a lot? Then you have come to the right place. You have to know about how to get rid of bed bugs naturally.

Basically, bed bugs are annoying and can make rashes on your skin. That's why you have to know the remedies first. And natural remedies will effect faster.

So, let's get into the description and be cleared about the techniques and all the hacks as well.

Techniques of Getting Rid of Bed Bugs Naturally

If you ever have bed bugs in your house, then you know how irritating these insects are. They attack you when you fall asleep, and bite you again and again. That will annoy you much and you will find much difficulty for this. 

That's the reason you need to remove all the bed bugs from your house. But how will you do that? And how to prevent bed bugs naturally? Well, let's check all the natural remedies of it to be clearer.  

1. Diatomaceous Earth

Using diatomaceous is a non-toxic formula to get rid of bed bugs easily. It is also called DE that works like miracle on bed bugs, insects and all kinds of fleas. Generally, it is used to do garden pests. 

Diatomaceous earth is made from natural sedimentary rock. The rock is being crumbled and it turns into fine powder. And you can use this powder to kill bed bugs too. 

And to use it, take the powder and sprinkle it all over the areas that you think the bed bugs are present. 

It will be effective if you leave the powder for at least three days before you vacuum those places. And after that, you can vacuum the areas nicely told get all the areas cleaned. 

2. Baking Soda

In this case, baking soda works good to kill bed bugs. Just like DE, you also need to apply baking soda in the same way. 

Using baking soda is effective because it can take all the moisture out of the bed bugs' body. And the bodies become dry. That's how it will no longer be able to live. 

And for using it, spread the soda whenever you think the bugs are exist. After that, leave it for some hours. And after some hours or some days, you need to vacuum the excess to get it completely cleaned.  

You have to make sure that you would repeat the process after some days. And that will help to keep the bed bugs away from your house in an easy way.  

3. Rubbing Alcohol

We all know that rubbing alcohol can be used for doing a lot of remedies. You can also use it for getting rid of bed bugs. All you have to know is the proper process of using it, and how it will work. 

To apply it, take a spray bottle and pour the rubbing alcohol into it. Now, take the bottle and spray on those bed bugs' affected areas. The alcohol will work effectively on it. And it can easily kill the bugs and make that place a clean and healthy one. 

4. Cayenne Pepper

Well, cayenne pepper might not be able to kill the bugs fully. But it is great for preventing them to spread. The bed bugs creates an irritation to bugs' body and thus kills them. 

And if you can mix it with oregano and ginger, it works magically to kill bugs. So, in that way, it is useful when you have a lot of bed bugs in your area. 

And to do it naturally, you need to take cayenne pepper, ginger, and oregano oil in the same quantity. Strain the ingredients nicely. Now, take a spray bottle and fill it with the mixture. Then add some water with it and mix it well. 

After that, spray this mixture all over the area. Leave it for some hours to kill all the bed bugs naturally. 

5. Thyme

Do you know thyme is burnt to kill bed bugs? Yes, thyme works effectively to get rid of the bed bugs. It’s a natural remedy to remove all the irritate bugs out of your house that bothers you. 

Well, basically, thyme cannot eliminate bed bugs that are already present. But it will help to keep them away from the house. It also helps to find out the hidden bugs easily. And once you can  find the places, now you can do the next procedures. 

And at that time, you need to take a thyme stick and wrap it with cotton cloth. Now, simply burn it completely. The burning fumes of the thyme stick can annoy the bed bugs and that's how it will be eliminated.  

6. Peppermint Leaves

We all know that peppermint is used for different reasons. It can be used for getting a better taste in food. It is also used for medications. But in this case, peppermint can make the bed bugs irritated and nauseous. 

So, you can use peppermint for getting rid of the bugs. So, you can get an extract of this, and use it by spraying. Make sure you leave the peppermint at those areas for some hours to get a proper result.  

You can also just spread the leaves to those areas. All you need to vacuum the places after getting done with your effort. 

7. Bean Leaves

Using bean leaves is also a great way to eliminate the bed bugs. If you want the best results in a natural way, then you must go for bean leaves. 

And to do the process, take the bean leaves and put these on the floor where the bugs exist. And leave those leaves to that places to get the process done properly. Don't forget to vacuum the area after finishing the process. 

8. Tea Tree Oil

Essential oils are effective for many reasons. And one of the best oils is tea tree oil. You can also use it to kill bed bugs as it has antibacterial and antimicrobial properties. 

And to use it, take a spray bottle and pour 50ml of water. Now, add two teaspoons of tea tree oil and make a mixture. Spray the mixture as usual.  

9. Silica Gel

Silica gel is basically those packets that are available in shoe boxes, or even food products. You can use it for this purpose. 

Take the seeds and grind it well. Then, sprinkle all over the affected areas. It can give you the better results instantly.  

10. Clove Oil

Another effective oil is the clove oil. It has a strong smell and that's why you can also use it for getting rid of bed bugs.

At the time of using, take a spray bottle and fill it with a cup of water. Then, add one teaspoon of clove oil and mix it well. Keep spraying told those areas that has bed bugs. And it will kill the bugs easily.

Pro Tips For Removing Bed Bugs Naturally

  1. Make sure you vacuum the areas in a proper way to get rid of all the excess product after you are done with killing bugs.
  2. You have to cover the areas with any kind of powdery portion fully to get better results.  
  3. Repeat the processes until you get your desired outcome.
  4. If you have children or pets in your house, avoid using silica gel.

Final Words

There are other options you can find. But we describe the most effective methods of all. You might have a question, how do bed bugs die naturally? Well, that's why we have explained all about the remedies so that, you can get the best results.

Try to execute them but first, learn everything about how to get rid of bed bugs naturally. It is because if you can learn about this in the first place, you won't face much problems while executing it.

So, try to maintain all these things and then apply any of these hacks to get a clean house without any bed bugs.

Method 1: Baking Soda Solution

Baking soda is a great solution to remove spots. Even the spots of the wall can be removed by using baking soda. All you need to do is to apply the technique in a proper way. 

Well, let's see step by step for a better understanding. 

Step 1:

At first, take a spraying bottle, and pour water into it. Now, spray that water on the stained surface. Make sure you cover all the spots with water well. 

Soaking will be enough to clean the stains properly. And for the soaking, the whole process will be easier to handle.      

Also, it will help you more to remove the bed bugs spots on the wall. So, make sure you spray to those areas in a proper way. 

Step 2:

Now, make a solution of baking soda. And to do that, you will need a bowl. 

Take baking soda and water in that bowl. Add a generous amount of water to make a thick mixture. The consistency of the solution should be paste-like. 

And by keeping that in mind, you will need to make the paste. Take a spoon and mix both of the ingredients in a nice way.    

Step 3:

Apply the mixture onto the surface well. Make sure you cover all the stains with this paste completely. 

You can use a dab motion while applying the paste. In that way, the paste will go into the wall and soak the stains easily. 

Step 4:

Now, let the solution be on the wall for a few minutes. It will help to soak properly. 

Soaking is important because when the wall will be soaked completely, chances of getting rid most of the stains will be increased. 

That's why take some time for applying and soaking the entire mixture well. 

Step 5:

Now, take a paper towel or a clean cloth and remove the excess solution by using a dabbing motion once again. 

One thing you need to be aware of and that is, you should not soak for a long time. 10-15 minutes will be enough. 

You can also spray water at this point, if you think wiping is not enough. But after spraying water, again wipe out the excess and have a clean wall. 

Step 6:

Now that you are done with all your cleaning the spot and removing the stains, you should now keep the wall dried. Many people use dryer but when it’s about wall, you don't need to use that. 

The reason is, your wall can be dried automatically. So, leave it there and you will see, it will get dry after a few hours.  

Method 2: Use Oxalic Acid

Oxalic acid is also a great ingredient to remove any kind of stain. And as it's about the bed bugs stains on the walls of your house, this acid works amazingly.  

All you need to know the technique of using this acid. And if you can do it then it will be much easier to execute everything.

Step 1:

Make sure you cover all the stained area with water. And then, let it be there for a few minutes to soak properly. 

Step 2:

Now, you have to make a solution of this acid. The solution is simple. Take oxalic acid, and mix it with water.    

And then it's time to apply it. But before doing that, you need to examine first. As you are working with acid, you need to do it in a proper way. Otherwise, it can do the opposite of your desire. 

Moreover, it can also change the color of the wall. That's why what you should do is to spray the mixture onto the slightest part of the wall. 

And if you see there is no harm, then you can use it as a solution.  

Step 3:

Apply the mixture all over the area to cover the stain. After that, leave the acid on the wall to dry. The acid will help to remove the entire stain and make the wall clean as before. 

On the other hand, if your wall is made of wood then, you should be more careful about it. And if you are facing bed bug stains problem on your wooden wall, then at this point, you have to use sandpaper to sand those areas first. 

And after doing this, then you can get into the oxalic acid thing.     

Step 4:

Now, it's almost done. You need to check if the stains are gone or not. Also, the color of the wall should match with the other parts of the wall. 

Make sure there will be no discoloration. And that's how you should do all the procedures to remove bed bugs stains. 

Method 3: Stain Remover 

Using stain remover for this purpose is a basic thing to do. There are a variety of ranges of stain remover. All you have do is, choose the correct one for your wall. 

Well, stain remover is useful for removing stains from the wall. And it can remove bed bugs stains too. So, you can totally rely on their outcomes if you choose the best one of all. 

Check the details of using the stain remover for a clear vision. 

Step 1:

Spray water on the surface to soak the wall properly. Make sure you do this well as we have described before. 

Step 2:

Now, take the stain remover and apply on the affected areas. You need to be careful if it doesn’t discolor the wall. 

Step 3:

You can also use hydrogen peroxide if you don't have stain remover. This will work in a exact way. You just need spray it all over the area like the stain remover. 

Step 4:

Now, leave the wall just like that to be soaked and dried. You can also spray water after a while if you see any discoloration happening. Otherwise, let the wall be there for drying. And that will get all the stains out of the wall.  

Pro Tips

  3. There might be a doubt of having a discoloration when you are using any kind of acid or hydrogen peroxide so, make sure you test into a small place of the wall first  
  4. The ultimate solution will be the restriction of bed bugs and you can do it if you use bed bug stainless paint on your wall

Wrap Up
