Title: How To Get Rid of Dust Mites - 10 Effective Ways
Content:
Dust mites have been living with a human for a long time. It now becomes a common thing in human life. But preventing it is also important as it causes allergic reactions and lots more health difficulty.

That's the reason you should know how to get rid of dust mites easily. Removing dust mites completely is not possible. But you can keep it in control by following the things of prevention.

So, without any further delay, check every detail to get rid of it and be safe.

What are dust mites?

Dust mites are like small particles that are called microscopic arachnids. These are like insects that help to produce allergens. That's how you get allergies from dust.

These mites are generally found in bed, especially bed sheets, carpets, clothes, furniture, and many more.

Dust mites produce dropping protein which means allergy. Each mite produces 20 droppings every day. And these cause allergy continuously. An interesting fact is, dead human skin cells are primary food in the dust mites.

Asthma, Eczema, and many other health problems are caused because of mites. However, having proper precautions can reduce the percentage of symptoms. So, taking action is better than spending a lot of money in a hospital.

Things you will need to Get Rid of Dust Mites

Using proper products as well as tools is important if you want a proper outcome. So, that's why you should know what the products are to get rid of dust mites easily.

1. Allergy-proof mattresses and bed sheets: If your bed sheets and mattresses are allergy-proof, then it helps to make a barrier between dust mites and you. Also, it helps to prevent creating dust mites that a normal mattress cannot do.

2. Laundry detergent: Washing all the bedsheets, curtains, clothes, mattresses, soft toys, and carpets is necessary. And laundry detergent helps to wash out properly and easily remove all the dust mites.

3. Vacuum cleaner and steamer: Vacuum cleaner is for soaking out all the dust mites, and the steamer is also for removing dust from soft surfaces like upholstery and making sure the places are hygienic.

4. Dehumidifier: works well for balancing the environment in your house by extracting water. It improves the quality of the air and for that reason, dust mites cannot live in this kind of environment.

5. Dust-mite spray: Dust mite sprays are available in any shop that helps to eliminate the mites and make the places hygienic. But make sure you avoid spray it on soft toys or any places where children are playing.

How To Get Rid of Dust Mites - 10 Proven ways of removing dust mites

Removing dust mites is important as well as simple to do. You just need to check some things and do some steps to have a mites-free environment.

First of all, select the places where you spend most of the time. And according to it, you should make those places more hygienic than before. Know more about it in depth.

1. Use allergy-proof bed sheets

To protect yourself from dust mites allergy, one thing you can do is to change your bedsheets and mattresses into an allergy-proof one.

There are several benefits of switching it from a normal one. First of all, it makes a barrier between dust mites and you and prevents generating more mites there.

Also, it helps to set fewer dead skin cells on the sheets. For that reason, dust mites cannot get enough food and die. Not only that, it is breathable too. So, for all the reasons, try to use allergy-proof covers if possible.

2. Wash all bedding at 60°C

Washing all bedding helps to kill all the mites. Blankets, bed sheets, curtains, pillowcases, and all the things that you think you are using the most, need to be washed regularly.

Despite using any chemicals, you can kill them at home. For washing it, you will need hot water. Make sure it is about 60°C.

Use allergen-reducing laundry detergent to wash them properly. Wash it in hot water and dry it out in the sun for better results.

For non-washable things like mattresses, you can do steam washing. It helps to kill all the mites.

3. Avoid using a bottom bunk bed

You sometimes use bottom bunk, especially for your children. But if you want to get rid of dust mites and the allergy, you should avoid sleeping in a bottom bunk bed.

The reason is, dust mites not only exist in bed, but also on the floor. So, the chances of having dust mites allergy are increased.  So, it better is, avoid it.

4. Don't use carpet if possible

The carpet looks amazing in your room or living room. But it also helps to collect dust mites more than before. Also, dust mites live longer in that kind of place. So, if you want to prevent dust mites, avoid using carpet in your house.

5. Use vacuum or steam cleaner for better cleanup

The vacuum cleaner can take all the dust from any corner of the house. Even smaller insects cannot escape from it. So, use a vacuum cleaner to clean out all the dust from your home.

Another gadget is the steamer. It hydrates the places so that no dust mites can be alive. Use a vacuum cleaner filter for better service. You can also use the steamer for your furniture, floor, carpets, and the places you want to kill the mites.

6. Dust-mite spray for instant remedy

There is some dust mite spray you can find in any general store. These are like the insect sprays that people use to kill them.

Just like that, dust mites spray works to kill the mites. You can use it any time you want. It's good for getting an instant outcome. If you are not up for washing all the cloth and cleaning all the places, then this spray will help you.

But don't use it on carpet or other places if you have children. Also, don't spray it on toys and other things that the babies use later. 

7. Dust with a damp cloth

Dusting regularly is necessary to remove all the dirt and dust mites as you already know. And dusting with a damp cloth makes it much more effective.

Use a damp cloth and dust all over the areas of your house regularly. Rinse the cloth while doing it so that it cannot spread dust from one to other areas. Dust off all the areas including furniture, shelves, and other things of your house to create a lacking food environment for mites.

8. Wash toys

You cannot wash toys, even if it's a soft toy. It is because it cannot be washed at 60°C. Also, you cannot use dust mites spray on it. It will be harmful to children. So, what should you do? You have to remove dust mites in other ways.

The most simple way to kill the dust mites is freezing. Put all the toys in a plastic bag and freeze it for at least 24 hours. It helps to kill all the mites properly. So, for this kind of thing that cannot be washed, can be frozen to get mite-free toys.

9. Trickle vents and windows

For reducing humidity, you need to increase ventilation. Use trickle vents or open windows to keep your house dehumidified.

Also, keep the windows open in bedrooms and kitchens to bring fresh air into the house. And that automatically reduces humidity. So, make sure you reduce the humidity to remove dust mites as soon as possible.

10. Use a dehumidifier

To keep the indoor humidity under 50% but over 30%, you need a dehumidifier in your house. Use it in your house if possible. It will help to reduce the humidity in your house. And that's how dust mites cannot get increased in this environment.

Natural ways to prevent dust mites

Several natural ways are also available if you are looking for it. If you want to avoid using chemicals, then use any of the natural ones.

Having plants can be a good remedy for it. The reason is, plants with large leaves help to fight against dust insects like dust mites. There are plants like bamboo palm, peace lily, Boston ferns, spider plant, and more like these that help to decrease the chances of living.

Besides, you can use eucalyptus that is excellent at killing dust mites. Pour some drops of eucalyptus into the washing machine while washing all the clothes, and sheets.

You can add water to a damp cloth to dust off. Or, mix with water to spray it all over the areas. There's much more you can do if you want to prevent dust mites naturally.

How dust mites affect your health?

You might not realize but almost all houses are affected by dust mites. They have been living in every corner of your house since first. They can live in humid and dusty places. So, when houses become dusty, they grow and live thereby having human dead skin cells.

And that's how they got into our bodies and created an allergy. That's how we get dust allergies if we don't clean the places and live with mites.

Dust mites allergy symptoms

A lot of symptoms that we can share with you. And you might relate to it too. The basic symptoms are:

  • Stuffy nose
  • Itchy skin and nose
  • Sneezing
  • Postnasal drip
  • Watery eyes
  • Cough
  • Difficulty breathing
  • Chest pain (if you have asthma)

Dust mites allergy treatments

When there are problems, there are solutions. And to get rid of the allergy problem, you can have different simple treatments that we are going to share with you. See if those work for you.

Allergy Balm

Several balms are available to prevent dust mites allergy. You can get one to try it out. It helps to prevent the reactions. And it can be a great remedy for allergy.

Nasal spray

If you don't like to use balm, you can use nasal spray. These are also available in any kind of store. If you are suffering much from dust mites allergy, then it would be a good option to stop that.

Keep the window open

If the environment inside the house is suffocating, dust mites can easily live in that environment to make your health more suffocating than before.

And to avoid the mites as well as mites allergy, you need fresh air. And that can happen if you make your house less humid. We have talked about it earlier and we know having fresh air can continuously prevent having dust mites allergy.

So, for that, keep your windows open in your house or anywhere you are working. The more the ventilation is, the fewer dust mites can live.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

1. Does sunlight kill dust mites?

Yes, direct sunlight can kill dust mites. So, if you want to kill them, you should hang bedding or any other thing in the sun.

2. What is the difference between dust mites and bed bugs?

The most noticeable fact is, bed bugs are larger than dust mites. You can see bed bugs in your bare eyes. But dust mites are so tiny that you cannot see them. They also create allergic reactions by living in beds, soft furniture, and carpets like dust mites. They eat human blood whereas dust mites eat only human dead skin cells.

3. How do I get rid of dust mites in my mattress?

If you want to get rid of dust mites in your mattress, baking soda is a good option. Just sprinkle some baking soda and let it sit for 15-20 minutes. After that, vacuum the soda by using a vacuum cleaner and that's it.

4. Is it bad to have dust mites?

Dust mites are microscopic bugs that live on dead human skin cells. These are not harmful. But it creates allergic reactions to humans and difficulty breathing for asthma patients.

Conclusion

To conclude, all we want is to give you some valuable information about dust mites that you must know as you are living with it no matter what.

We cannot eliminate them, but we can stop them from increasing by knowing all about how to get rid of dust mites.

So, follow the information about cleaning that we have shared with you before and have a safe life!

Title: How to Remove Tape Residue - 6 Simple Solutions
Content:
Do you have a problem of getting rid of tape residue? Isn't it too problematic? Well, it is. But it is also an easy thing to remove. Don't you believe it?

For believing it, you have to know how to remove tape residue with some easy steps. But first of all, you need to know the steps, and all the details.

That's why, check the entire details that we are going to show you. Let's get into the deeper description and see what the procedures are.

How to Remove Tape Residue

Well, removing tape residue might be a tricky task. We know that tape residue contains a sticky texture that is a bit tough to remove it.

But if you take some right steps, and apply it in a right way then you can easily remove it. There are several types of materials. And according to that, the method will be different from each other.

That's why you need to know what the techniques are and how to remove tape residue by executing it properly. Let's jump into the section to clear this out.

Basic Method

The ultimate method is to completely wash with dish-washing soap and rubbing alcohol. Let's see the method step by step. 

And to do it, you will need: 

  • Rubbing alcohol
  • A pen knife
  • Dish-washing soap
  • Warm water 
  • And a soft cloth 

Step 1: Scrape the Residue

First of all, take a pen knife or you can also use butter knife or any kind of blade-like thing instead of it. Then hold the blade on the sticky surface and slide the knife over it. That will help to scrape off the residue quickly. 

But make sure you won't do the scraping in a fast way. That might damage the material. And don't scratch the surface too. Scraping is the best option in this case. 

Step 2: Soaking

Now, take a soft cloth and dip it into rubbing alcohol. After that, rub it on the sticky surface, so that the area will be soaked nicely. You can also use nail polish remover or acetone if you have no rubbing alcohol around you. 

Step 3: Scrubbing

Take a bowl and add about one tablespoon of liquid dish-washing soap and two cups of warm water. Mix it well to get a proper liquid solution. Now, take another soft cloth and dip it into the solution. 

Keep rubbing the place with the cloth. After some time, you can see the stickiness coming out of the surface, and it will feel slippery. At that time, you need to stop the rubbing procedure. 

Step 4: Wiping out

After the stickiness comes out, now take another clean cloth and wiping the surface out nicely. Make sure the cloth should properly absorb the remaining liquid on the surface. And that will be enough for cleaning the tape residue.

Remove with Oil

Oil is the another effective ingredient for removing tape residue and any kind of stickiness. It can remove the glue out of the surface in an easy way. 

And for that, the ingredients you need are: 

  • A paper towel
  • Any kind of oil like cooking oil, baby oil, peanut butter or even mayonnaise
  • Baking soda
  • A brush 
  • And a cloth

Step 1: Apply oil 

At first, take the oil and soak a paper towel in it. Now, rub the surface with the towel in a proper way for a few minutes. And when you are done with rubbing, now leave the place like that way to get properly soaked.

Step 2: Make a solution

Now, take a bowl and make a mixture by mixing an equal amount of baking soda and oil. Mix it together. Make sure it will be mixed well and leave no lumps. 

You can also use vinegar if you have no oil. Also, you can add warm water if you want. That's how it will create a thick paste that will be effective for removing residue. 

Step 3: Applying

Now, take the paste and apply onto the surface. You can use a brush or a soft cloth to apply it. Now, leave it like that for about 30 minutes to get totally soaked. You can also scrub it with that brush in a gentle way if you want. 

Step 4: Wiping out

The final step will be the wiping out process. After being done with all the scrubbing and soaking with the paste for about 30 minutes, now it's time to wipe it out. 

And for doing that, take a clean cloth and gently wiping the areas out with it. Make sure the entire area is properly cleaned and dry. 

Remove Tape Residue from Metal

Removing adhesive residue might be a tricky task to do. But if you follow the correct process, and apply it properly then, it will be easier and effective for you. And that's why you need to know how to remove tap residue from metal. Let's see the entire method to be clearer. 

Step 1: Scraping

To do the removing process in an easy way, at first, you need to scrape the excessive residue. And for that, you need a knife. Take any kind of knife and try to scrape it as much as possible. But make sure you won't scratch it. 

Step 2: Soaking

After that, take rubbing alcohol to soak it properly. You need to take a generous amount of alcohol on a soft cloth and gently apply onto the sticky surface. Leave it for a few minutes to be properly soaked. 

Step 3: Scrubbing

Well, this is an optional step. You can skip it. But if you feel the residue doesn't come out and it will need an extra push then scrubbing is necessary. And for doing it, take a brush to scrub it in a steady way. Don't push it too hard but just gently scrub it.

Step 4: Wiping Out

The last step will be wiping out. And for doing it, take a clean and soft cloth and wipe out all the moisture from it. That will be enough to get a non-sticky, and clean surface. 

Remove Tape Residue from Glass

Removing tape residue from glass is an easy task. Lubricant will be enough for doing it. All you need to know is how to remove tape residue from glass in an easy way. Keep reading to know more about it. 

Step 1: Applying the solution

The best solution is to lubricate the surface. And for that, you can use any kind of lubricant or oil. Oily element helps to break down the adhesive quickly. And that's why you can easily remove the residue.

So, you need to apply that oil on the surface first. You can also use acetone or nail polish remover. And after applying it, let it be soaked for some time. 

Step 2: Gentle scrub

Though the glass is a sensitive thing, and it catches any kind of scratches easily, you need to be careful about this thing. Do not use a brush. Take a soft cloth and gently rub it to get the perfect shine. And at that time, you will see the adhesive starts coming out. 

Step 3: Wiping Out

When all the residues are gone, now take another cloth and wiping the surface out so that the entire product comes out properly. And the glass surface can also be dried out properly. 

Remove Tape Residue from Skin

Removing tape residue from skin might be a sensitive task to do. It is because skin itself is a sensitive part. That's why it is compulsory to know how to remove tape residue from skin. 

And for doing it, you need to be aware of everything of it. So, let's see the details first to get cleared about all these things.

Step 1: Loosen the tape

First of all, you need to loosen the tape from the skin carefully. Make sure you do it in a proper way. Otherwise, it might hurt the skin, and make infection. 

Step 2: Remove the old dressing

After that, take the old dressing out to remove it completely. Make sure you put on hand-gloves for better safety.

Step 3: Cleaning

After taking out the old dressing, now you need to clean the area properly. And for that, you can use rubbing alcohol to make the place completely germ-free.

It will be an important part if you want to know how to remove tap residue from skin after surgery. You can also use olive oil or petroleum jelly onto the skin for better moisture. And that will be enough to remove tape adhesive from skin appropriately.

Remove Tape Residue from Cloth

It's also an important thing to remove tape residue from cloth. It's a problem that we need to face in our day-to-day life. That's why you need to know the best way to get the better results. And for that, let's get into it. 

Step 1: Make solution

At first, you need to make a solution. And for that, take a bowl and add one tablespoon of laundry detergent and two cups of hot water. Mix these two things together. Another solution will be the mixture of one tablespoon of ammonia and two cups of warm water. 

Step 2: Applying

Now, apply the solutions onto the cloth surface. If first solution won't work then apply the second one and soak it for about an hour. 

Step 3: Washing

When you are done with soaking, now take the cloth and wash it with plain water. After that, let it be for some hours to completely air dry it.  

Final Verdict

We shared some interesting stuff with you so that you can learn some tricks to remove tape residue perfectly. You must know how to remove tape residue in an easy way. And when you are clear about it then it will be much easier to do the entire process.

So, know the tricks, execute it, and get rid of the residue quickly.

Title: How to Sharpen Eyeliner Pencil?
Content:
Who doesn't want to have a perfect winged line on her eyes? I guess every makeup lover does. But for having a good winged line on your eye, you need to know how to sharpen eyeliner pencils properly. 

Well, it's a bit tricky to do that. First of all, you need good skills. Second of all, you need a good liner. And when you are using a pencil liner, you need to sharpen it quite often to have a perfect sharp tip. 

If you have less skill of doing winged line then it won't be an issue. You just have to have a sharp tip line. That's why you need to know what will be the easy and effective way to get the perfect trip. Let's get right into the details to get the idea and some interesting hacks too. 

Method of sharpening eyeliner pencil

Sharpening any kind of pencil is simple. So does eyeliner pencil. But there are some tricks that we are doing to share with you so that you will get much benefit than before. 

So, without any further delay, let's get in. 

Step 1: Freeze first

The first step will be freezing the pencil. Yes, it needs to be done properly. It's a great trick because it will make the pencil harder than before and you will sharpen it without any breakage. 

So, for doing it, but that pencil in the freezer for 5-7 minutes. But if you have an eyeliner pencil that is thicker in size then you need to freeze it for a longer time. 

Doing it is important because it will help to do the upcoming procedures smoothly. Also, if the pencil is hard then there will be no chance of breaking while sharpening. So, freeze it well before getting into the other part. 

Step 2: Use rubbing alcohol

Another trick to get a perfect sharpening is using rubbing alcohol. Yes, you heard it right. It has a great benefit as it has a disinfecting quality. 

Not for the sharpening, but for sanitizing, this will be an effective one. But what would you sanitize? You need to use the rubbing alcohol to sanitize the sharpener. 

Though you are going to sharpen an eyeliner pencil, you need to be very careful about hygiene. And though it's about your eyes and you are going to use this liner for defining your eyes, you need to ensure the hygiene and safety of your sensitive eye. 

And to do it properly, all you need is a cotton bud. Take a cotton bud and dip it into the rubbing alcohol. And then, it's ready to use. 

Step 3: Clean the sharpener

The cotton bud that you have soaked into the disinfecting rubbing alcohol, now you need to use it in this purpose. 

Before getting into any sharpening process, you need to clean the sharpener first. And that's why you need to apply this technique too. 

Take the soaked cotton bud and start cleaning the sharpener properly. There could be some pencil residue that must be cleaned. Also, rubbing alcohol helps to disinfect the entire sharpener. 

So, do the cleaning by gently swabbing. If the first bud will get dirty, then you can take the other one. Use buds by soaking properly according to your need. That's how clean both inside and outside areas of the sharpener. 

Step 4: Take the eyeliner out of the free freezer

After 5 minutes of freezing, now take the pencil out from the freezer. You will feel the hardness of it when you are touching the frozen eyeliner. 

But if you feel it's not that much hard and it's almost the same as the non-frozen one, that's mean it's not done yet. At that time, you need to freeze it again. Put it in the freezer and again after 5 minutes, check if it's done or not. 

It actually depends on the hardness of the pencil. Freeze it until you feel the hardness. Remember, the eyeliner pencil should be harder than before. 

Step 5: Insert the pencil 

After being done with cleaning the sharpener, now it's time to do the sharpening. And to do that, you can use any kind of sharpener like a regular pencil sharpener. It will do the sharpening in an easy way. 

And for that, just simply insert the pencil into the hole of the sharpener. Make sure you clean it properly. It is because if the sharpener is cleaned properly then it will be easier to do the next step. Otherwise, the pencil won't be fit into the hole if there is any dirt inside it. 

Take the pencil, and simply insert it. Don't force the pencil because it might break if you do that. Just press the pencil, and it will easily slide into that hole. 

Step 6: Start the sharpening

Now it's time to sharpen the pencil with a sharpener. After inserting it, all you need to do is to rotate the pencil. Keep rotating it in a circular motion for at least a couple of times. Or, you can do it until you see the tip of the pencil is sharp enough. 

On the other hand, you can rotate a full circle, and then check. And if the tip of the pencil isn't sharp yet then do another rotation, and then check again. Repeat this process until you get a perfect sharp tip. 

Also, after a full rotation, take out the shavings. That's how it will be easier to see inside it. 

Step 7: Pull out 

when you are satisfied with the outcome, now you can stop doing the rotating. Make sure the tip is well-sharped. 

And after completing the sharpening, simply take the pencil out from the sharpener. Don't rush and steadily pull the pencil out of that sharpener. 

Make sure you are fully satisfied with the result. But if you don't, then insert it and repeat the same procedure. 

You need to know that eyeliner pencils should not be excessively sharp. It is because it might hurt your eyes. That's why sharping it by keeping this fact in mind is necessary.  

Step 8: Shaping

After sharpening by using a sharpener, you can give it an extra finish if you want. And you can do it by using a knife or a regular blade. 

Well, you can also use this method if you have no sharpener around you. All you need is a pen knife or an X-acto knife. 

And for doing it, simply take the knife and hold it on the tip of the pencil. Make sure you hold the knife in your dominant hand and the pencil in your non-dominant hand. You have to hold the pencil downward and sharpen it with the knife in a steady motion. 

Don't rush. Doing it in a fast way might do injury. Keep calm and sharpen it according to your choice. 

Step 9: Repeat if necessary

We have told earlier that if you think you need another rotation to sharpen the pencil again, do it. Don't do several rotations at a time. It might extremely sharpen the tip and thus, break easily. 

Instead of doing it, sharpen with a single rotation and pull the pencil out to check if it's done or not. Again press the pencil into the hole and sharpen by rotating if it's not done. Repeat this process until you get your desired sharpness. 

Step 10: Testing 

When you are done with your sharpening, now you have to test it on your hand first. Always remember, don't use the pencil directly on your eyes after sharpening it. The reason is, the sharp tip might hurt your eyes. 

Also, it would the best if you test it first so that you will see the pigmentation and can use it according to it. Also, you can see if the sharp tip works appropriately or not. 

So, for doing the test, draw a line on your back of your hand. See if you are satisfied with it or not. And if you aren't then repeat the process again. Moreover, see the thickness is perfect or not. Overall, see everything and manage the texture according to it. 

Step 11: Final cleaning

After finishing all the things of sharpening, now you have to clean the sharpener again. It's necessary because the sharpener should be germ-free. Also, if you keep it clean then it will be easier when you use it next time. 

So, for cleaning, take another cotton bud and throw all the shavings away in a garbage bin. Also, clean the blades, and knives too. You can also use rubbing alcohol to clean it in a proper way. After properly clean the sharpener, take and store it in a certain place. 

Pro Tips

  1. Try to purchase that eyeliner that has a sharpener with it. 
  2. Sharpen the pencil at least once in a week to get the defined line every time you use it. 
  3. You can keep an emery board to sharpen anytime you need it. 
  4. Try to do the sharpening over a bin or any kind of trash can so that the shavings will fall directly into it. 

Final Verdict

We hope that you will learn something from this method. This is not an extraordinary method, but we tried to give you some hacks, so that, you can get better outcomes. 

Also, though eyes are the most sensitive part of our body, you need to be very careful while doing these methods. Maintain hygiene and then sharpen. 

Overall, it's not tough to sharpen eyeliner pencils but make sure you follow the tricks. So, you can get the desirable wings, and look pretty as well.

Title: How to Clean GermGuardian Filter for a Fresh and Healthy Home
Content:
Do you feel that a strange odor is filling up your house and you can’t find out where it’s coming from? It’s probably coming from your air filter.

And in order to help you get rid of that terrible odor, we have prepared our guide about how to clean GermGuardian filter. If your air filter is dirty, then it could cause serious health issues for the children and elderly living in your house.

If you use your air purifier continuously, then it’s bound to become dirty. That’s why you have to clean it regularly.

How to clean GermGuardian filter

GermGuardian can be difficult to clean, but the following procedures will help make cleaning easier. The easiest way to clean the filter is by washing it with water. It's as simple as that.

The filter is easy to take apart and wash with a little warm water. But the procedure has to be done with care. Here are the steps for cleaning a GermGuardianair filter:

  • First, you have to take the air purifier to a particular area away from your living space for cleaning. You should know that if you dismantle the filter in your living room or laundry room, it will contaminate the air with dust and debris.
  • Now, bring your user's manual and follow the whole dismantling process written on the manual to the letter. This will make sure that you don't cause any damage to the air filter during the dismantling process.
  • Once you take it apart, use a brush to clean the inner surface of the filter. Make sure you dust off every nook and cranny of the filter.
  • Now take the filter outside into your garden/lawn and turn on the garden hose or hosepipe. Use the hose to clean the dirt and debris away from the air filter. You should keep the water pressure at a medium as highly pressurized water could damage the device.
  • Take the hose to the other side of the air filter and repeat step 4 again. Keep rinsing the filter until you see the water looks clear to you. That would indicate the filter has been all cleaned up.
  • Put the filter in a dry location and leave it to dry for a few hours. It could take a long time, but still, you shouldn't try to artificially dry the filter as that could cause damage to it.
  • When the air filter is completely dry, follow the installation procedure described in the manual to reinstall it. Switch the device on to check if it's working properly.

Your air filter should hold up for a couple of months before it requires cleaning or replacement. And if you think the condition of the air filter is beyond repair, then you should buy a replacement filter.

Don't just buy any old replacement filter. You absolutely must purchase the original GermGardian replacement air filter.

How to clean a non-washable GermGuardian HEPA filter

The question is, what if your air filter is non-washable? Does that mean, you cannot clean it?

Well, you can definitely clean your air filter even if it's non-washable. Just follow the steps given below:

  • Unplug the air purifier, take it to the designated place and dismantle it just like before.
  • Take the HEPA filter out of the purifier.
  • Then take each of the filters out.
  • The HEPA filter has some permanent filters that have to be cleaned using cold water.
  • Take your vacuum cleaner and vacuum the air filter. Keep the vacuum cleaner at a lower setting as cleaning an air filter doesn't require that much power.
  • Once you're done vacuuming it, take a brush to take out any excess dust that may still be on the filter.
  • Finally, you should reinstall the filter on the air purifier and check how it performs.

Frequently Asked Questions

1. Can HEPA filter be washed and reused?

Yes, if the filter is marketed as being washable/permanent that means it’s possible to wash and then reuse it.

2. How long do GermGuardian filters last?

Typically, a GermGuardian lasts for roughly 8 months. But if you vacuum it regularly, then you can extend its lifespan.

3. What happens if you don’t replace HEPA filter?

The HEPA filter removes dust, pollen, and dander from the atmosphere. If you don’t replace it, the purifier won’t be able to purify the air around you.

4. How do you reset the HEPA filter on the GermGuardian?

Just press the filter change button, and it will let you toggle between the carbon filter and carbon filter.

Final Thoughts 

Your air purifier’s performance completely depends on the quality of its air filter. And your air filter will only work efficiently if you clean and maintain it on a regular basis.

Just use our guide regarding how to clean GermGuardian filter to clean that filter once every couple of months for it to function properly. And that’s all for today. Happy cleaning!

Title: How to Clean Dr.Brown Bottle Warmer
Content:
Thinking about cleaning your Dr. Brown bottle warmer? But the question is, how to clean dr.brown bottle warmer? Where do you even start?

It might seem difficult but bear with us here. We will explain how you can get that job done without going through any hassle. Remember your Dr.Brown bottle warmer has a detachable reservoir and warming basket. Moreover, it's dishwasher safe.

So, cleaning the bottle warmer shouldn’t be that tough, right? And cleaning the bottle warmer regularly will make sure that it's working properly every single time you use it.

Without any further ado, let’s get started.

How to Clean Dr.Brown Bottle Warmer

Down below you’ll find the steps that you need to follow in order to get your Dr.Brown bottle warmer cleaned:

  • Unplug it and let it cool before you get started

This might sound like a no-brainer. You should never try to clean the bottle warmer while it’s plugged into a power source. And if you have recently used this appliance, then you have to let it cool down for at least half an hour before cleaning it.

As you’re probably aware, a bottle warmer utilizes heated steam to warm the water bottle. So, the inside will be extremely hot after you’ve used it.

And it goes without saying, you should take all the necessary safety precautions before starting.

  • Take out the water reservoir

There is a transparent water reservoir located on the right side of the bottle warmer. You have to remove it by pulling it in the upward direction. Then pour the water out of it.

After that fill it up with soapy, warm water and leave it be for a few minutes. Make sure you don’t use any harsh soap while cleaning it, as that could cause damage to the reservoir.   

  • Remove the water from the heating compartment

Take the bottle warmer and hold it over the sink and remove the cover. Then tilt it over in order to empty its heating chamber. Ensure that no water remains inside the bottle warmer.

  • Wash the basket inside the dishwasher

Put the basket (a plastic container that holds the bottle) of the bottle warmer on the rack of your dishwasher. And clean it while washing your dishes.

In case, you don’t want to wash it using the dishwasher, you always have the option of cleaning it by hand.

After you’re done cleaning it, let it dry for some time.

  • Wash the Bottle Warmer

Now it's time to wipe the bottle warmer using a sponge or rag that has been dipped into soapy water. Mix just a little bit of detergent or a few drops of dish soap with some warm water. Then mix it and dip the sponge into it.

After that, gently wipe down both the inside and outside parts of the bottle warmer.

  • Put some rice and water into the reservoir

After you’ve soaked the reservoir into soapy water for a few minutes, remove the soapy water out of it. Then pour one tablespoon of rice and one tablespoon of water into it. Use a funnel if you have to.

  • Vigorously Shake the Reservoir

Place your index finger on the mouth of the reservoir and then shake it back and forth. Do it at a fast pace so that the rice gets to hit each and every part of the surface inside the reservoir.

This is done in order to remove the soapy residue from the reservoir.

  • Rinse the bottle warmer’s reservoir

First, you have to pour the rice and water out of the reservoir. After that, rinse that container multiple times using cold water. Partially fill the reservoir with water and then shake it to clean it properly.

If you still see suds inside the reservoir, then repeat steps 6-8 one more time.

  • Air Dry Everything

Now that you’re done cleaning the components of your Dr.Brown bottle warmer place them on top of a towel and let them dry for 1-2 hours.

Actually you can use the reservoir even before it's completely dry, as you're going to put water into it again anyway. But the outside components have to be totally dried before use.

Place the reservoir back into its position and reattach it to the right side of the bottle warmer. Then place the basket into its chamber.

You should clean your Dr.Brown bottle warmer at least once a week. That will prevent it from releasing any bad odor.

Descale the Bottle Warmer

If you want the optimum performance from your bottle warmer, you have to descale it. If you don't descale it regularly, then it could cause residual to build upon the bottle warmer's heating element.

The steps for descaling the Dr.Brown bottle warmer is given below:

  • If your bottle warmer’s not working, that would mean that limescale has built-up inside the appliance. You have to run vinegar through it in order to break that buildup down.
  • Just like before, you have to unplug the device and let it cool for half an hour.
  • Take the water out of the reservoir as well as the heating chamber by tilting them on top of your sink.
  • Then pour 50ml white vinegar and 100ml water into the reservoir. Don't worry; vinegar is a safe and natural substance. It won't cause any harm to the appliance.
  • Do the same for the reservoir as well. And leave them like this for a few minutes.
  • Then pour the vinegar solution out of the reservoir and the warmer.
  • Plug it back in and test it out.

Final Thoughts

So, did you find our guide about how to clean dr.brown bottle warmer interesting? If you’re confused about anything, you can always refer back to the instruction manual of your bottle warmer.

Remember to clean your bottle warmer once every four weeks. And don’t forget to rescale the bottle warmer after cleaning it.

Title: How to Clean a Window Air Conditioner Without Removing it
Content:
Are you wondering about how to clean a window air conditioner without removing it? Well, you're in luck. Today we are going to explain the whole process of cleaning a window AC in great detail.

Does it feel like your window AC isn't blowing enough cold air, even though you regularly clean your AC's air filters and you have the right freon level without any leaks?

The reason for that is that your AC unit has clogged airflow. It reduces the efficiency of your air conditioning unit by 30% and it also increases your electricity bill exponentially.

And so, you must clean the air filters, the evaporator coils, blowers, as well as the condensers every 3 months.

Without any further ado, let's dive right in!

How to Clean a Window Air Conditioner Without Removing it

Cleaning the window air conditioner might seem like too much work. And some might get discouraged and end up not cleaning the AC altogether. But we are here to tell you that the process is not as tough as it may seem at first glance.

By following some simple steps, you can easily accomplish that task.

What you'll need

Before you starting cleaning the air conditioner, you must first have all the necessary tools at your disposal. That includesthe following things:

  1. A vacuum cleaner (That has a smaller nozzle)
  2. Screwdriver
  3. Old rag
  4. Some old newspapers (to protect the flooring/carpets)
  5. The user manual of your air conditioner
  6. A bucket of water
  7. Soap
  8. A spray bottle
  9. Gloves and goggles

How to Clean a Window AC Unit

Now, let's get down and dirty and start cleaning the window air conditioning unit. The best part about this process is that you won't even have to remove the unit while cleaning it. And you can do so, just by using the tools and cleaning products that are lying around in your house.

Here are the steps that you need to follow:

1. Switch off the air conditioning unit

You need to first turn the AC unit off and then disconnect the unit from the electrical power source. This is necessary because if you don't do this, you might be at risk of being electrocuted in the process.

2. Remove the grill on the front

Next, you have to carefully remove the grill from the front of the AC. This will provide you access to the coils and filters. If the grill is not screwed-in, then you can remove it just by pulling it downwards.

On the other hand, if it is screwed-in, then you have to use the screwdriver.

3. Remove the filter of the AC unit

The next step is to take the filter and carefully remove it from the air conditioner. Make sure that the air filter doesn't have any dents or leaks in it.

If your air conditioner has a disposable air filter and it's showing signs of build-up and molds, then you should just replace the filter.

In contrast, if your filter is reusable, you can simply clean the filter and make it as good as new again. You can use a sponge and dishwasher soap while cleaning the air filter. If you find it hard to get the stubborn molds out of the air filter, then we suggest you leave the filter submerged in warm water for 30 minutes before cleaning.

4. Use the vacuum cleaner

This is pretty straight-forward, you simply use thevacuum cleanerto clean the dust and debrisfrom the inside of the air conditioner. You have to do it as thoroughly as possible.

5. Wipe the AC down

Take a pinch of bleach and mix it with some warm water. Then take a rag and dip it into the solution. After that, wipe down the mold and dirt from inside the AC. The bleach also makes sure that the mold does grow back in the future.

6. Dry it out

Once you're done cleaning the inside part of the AC, it's time to wipe it with a towel to make it dry. And if you've also cleaned the filter, you have to make sure that the filter is dry as well before you put it back on the AC.

7. Put it all back together

Now it's time to put the filter back inside the air conditioner and screw the front grill back onto the AC. Once you've done all of this, you have to put the plug back into the outlet. And then turn the AC on to check how it performs.

Tips About Cleaning Window Air Conditioners

If you've followed our guide to the letter, then you should have a squeaky-clean air-conditioning unit on your hands. And that's all you have to do, right? Well, we have some tips for you about cleaning window AC:

(1) First of all, you have to completely disconnect the air conditioner from any kind of power source.

(2) You should also remove the filter before you start the cleaning process and clean the filter separately.

(3) Take the front grille out of the AC before cleaning. This will make your job much easier.

(4) Try to keep the AC on as much as possible, as that will prevent it from getting filthy.

(5) Keep the AC in the shade as the sunlight could damage it.

(6) When not in use, store the window AC in a cool, dry place.

Frequently Asked Questions

Take a plastic bucket and pour a few cups of water into it. Then mix half a tablespoon of bleach into it and use the solution to clean the mold out.

Is it ok to spray water on your air conditioner?

It’s okay. You can safely spray water on your air conditioner while cleaning. That won’t cause any damage to your air conditioning unit.

What is the black stuff coming out of my window air conditioning vents?

The black stuff that's coming out of your AC vents is probably soot, dust, or mold spores. If you notice that stuff, you should immediately start cleaning the AC.

Does vinegar kill mold in the air conditioner?

The answer is yes. And you can use vinegar to clean mold out of your air conditioner instead of bleach.

Final Thoughts

If you want your window air conditioning unit to be working effectively, cleaning the air conditioner on a regular basis is a must. Otherwise, your AC won't be of any use when you need it the most.

And trust us; the process isn't that challenging. With just a bit of patience, you'll be able to do it. Hopefully, our guide about how to clean a window air conditioner without removing it was helpful. Until next time, goodbye.

Title: How to Clean a Corian Countertop? Utilizing Vinegar, Chemical Solutions and Rust Stain Remover
Content:
Many people prefer to install Corian countertops in their kitchen. That’s because Corian countertops have a sleek and clean look to them. They are perfect for kitchens and bathrooms.

Did you know that you can clean Corian countertops with vinegar? In our guide about how to clean Corian countertops with vinegar, we will explain to you how you can do just that.

As you’re probably aware, Corian countertops require a fair bit of maintenance (like regular cleaning), and various types of protective measures to prevent damage.

Just invest a little bit of time into cleaning and maintaining it, and we can assure you that it will serve you for years.

Can you use vinegar on Corian?

You might be wondering whether or not you should use vinegar to clean your countertop. After all, vinegar can be abrasive in certain cases.

But there is no need to worry. You can safely use white vinegar in order to clean the Corian countertop. In fact, white vinegar is so mild that it can even be used to clean the floors in your house.

And it is one of the most effective ways to remove rust and stains off the countertop. Why is it so effective? The reason is that white vinegar is the best cleanser for your countertop.

Alternatively, you can use commercial cleaners or cleaners that are ammonia-based to clean the Corian countertop. These cleaners are quite effective at removing hard water stains and other types of stains sustained by the countertop.

How to clean Corian countertops with vinegar?

Corian countertops are naturally beautiful, durable and they are also quite hygienic. Therefore, it's ideal for kitchens. But they require regular maintenance and cleaning.

But the best part about Corian countertops is that they are non-porous. This means the food, dirt, and germs sit on its surface and they do not penetrate the surface. That not only makes it hygienic but also makes it easy to clean.

Typically, the countertops that have a darker color tend to show scratches and stains more than the ones with lighter colors. We will show you the entire process of keeping your countertop clean. But before that, you'll have to get the tools ready that are required for cleaning.

You'll need white vinegar, water, a microfiber towel. We recommend you use the microfiber cloth instead of the regular cloth.

With all that said. Let's look at the steps that you need to follow:

(1) For the grime, dirt, and food residue that gets stuck on the countertop daily, you can wipe them clean by using a soft cloth or a wet sponge that's dipped in soapy water.

(2) For the hard water stains, and nasty spills, you have to at first wipe the surface by using a clean soft cloth. This will take out the excess dirt from the surface.

(3) In case you've spilled something on the Corian surface, you have to use the five-second rule and start wiping it down in that instant. That will prevent the surface from getting badly stained.

(4) Now take a bowl and white vinegar and water in it with a 1:1 ratio. And then soak a microfiber cloth into it.

(5) Wipe the entire Corian countertop surface using the cloth dipped in white vinegar. Do this multiple times and keep dipping the cloth in vinegar if you have to.

(6) If the dirt still persists, take an ammonia-based spray and spray it all over the stubborn dirt.

(7) After that rinse the area with a wet cloth.

(8) Take another bowl and mix a small amount of bleach with some cold water.

(9) Submerge a sponge or a rag into the bleach and wipe the surface with that solution. This is done in order to disinfect the surface of your Corian countertop. Although white vinegar has some disinfectant properties, using a bleach solution is a better option.

Removing Burns, Stains and Scratches from Corian Countertops

Although using white vinegar on your Corian countertop will clean the dirt away from it, it'll still have any burn marks or scratches that it might have sustained. You have to remove them as well.

Here are the steps you have to follow:

  • At first, you have to take care of those chalky white hard water stains. You’ll find various cleaners on the market that are specifically made to remove these sorts of stains. Use one of those to clean them.
  • You can also use vinegar or lemon juice to clean the hard water stains if you prefer to go with a natural cleaning solution. Spray some vinegar or lime juice on the stains and let it sit for 10 minutes. Then rinse the area.
  • Now it’s time to take out the scratches and stubborn stains using a mildly abrasive cleaning solution. Just pour a little bit of the cleaner on top of the scratched surface and wipe the area with a wet sponge.
  • After that, rinse the area with warm water. Then wipe it dry with a towel.
  • And if you prefer to go with a natural cleaning solution, you should mix some vinegar with baking soda. Then lay the paste on top of the area. Wait for some time and wipe the area clean.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best cleaner for Corian countertops?

For most types of residue that form on Corian countertops, soapy water, white vinegar or ammonia-based cleaners are quite effective.

How do you restore the shine of Corian countertops?

You can make your Corian countertop shiny and glossy again by using a commercial polish that’s made specifically for countertops.

How can I make my Corian white again?

Make a solution of bleach and water with a ratio of 1:1 and then wipe the countertop down by using this solution. As bleach is a whitening agent it will make the countertop white again.

Can you use soft scrub on Corian countertops?

No, you should not use soft scrub on your Corian countertop as that could cause damage to the surface of the countertop.

Final Thoughts

We hope that you’ve found our article about how to clean Corian countertops with vinegar interesting and helpful. Corian countertops are the best types of countertops out there and the best part about them is that they are quite easy to clean.

As we’ve shown, a simple everyday kitchen substance such as vinegar can be used to clean it. So, what are you waiting for? Get that countertop cleaned as soon as possible!

Resources:

https://www.corian.com/-use-care-

Title: How to Clean Shower Doors with WD40?
Content:
Cleaning the shower door might seem like a chore. But if you don't do it, then you'll have to deal with grime, hard water stains, and scum covering up your precious shower door.

In our guide about how to clean shower doors with WD40, we are going to go through the entire process of cleaning the shower door using a WD40 spray.

You should clean your shower door at least once every month. And using the WD40 spray is one of the best ways of doing it.

So, let’s begin.

There are many products available to clean your shower doors. This article is about using WD-40 to cleanse shower doors. When used right, WD-40 can effectively cleanse shower doors with ease but it should be treated with a bit of caution.

First and foremost, you must wear hand gloves and eye protection when working with WD-40. And you must also wear a mask in order to make sure you don't inhale the WD-40 fumes which could be dangerous.

Once you've taken the necessary precautions, you're good to go. As you're probably aware the WD in WD-40 stands for "Water Displacing" which means it will displace water. And that in turn removes hard watermarks. It also prevents these marks from forming again.

With all that said, let's have a look at the steps that you must take to clean the shower door:

(1) Take the WD-40 can and spray the entire shower door with a thick coat of this substance.

(2) Let it sit for at least half an hour.

(3) After waiting for half an hour wipe the door by using a clean rag or a microfiber towel.

(4) Thoroughly scrub the surface of the shower door to ensure that no watermarks remain on the door once you're done cleaning.

(5) If you think that the door is not clean enough, you should apply the WD-40 again and repeat the previous steps again.

(6) Wipe it down with a clean cloth and let the door dry. And that should be it.

Can WD40 Keep Hard Water Stains Off Glass Shower Doors?

The answer is yes. WD-40 solvent/degreaser is able to remove hard water stains from glass and it also protects glass doors from getting stained. And using WD-40 to clean glass doors is much easier than cleaning other types of doors.

There are also some great alternatives to WD-40 when it comes to cleaning glass doors. And they include Rain-X, Lemon Pledge, and Water Armor.

Are There Any Alternatives To WD-40 For Cleaning Shower Doors?

There are actually several alternatives to WD-40 that can be used to clean shower doors. But we should remind you of the fact that WD-40 is by far the best option for this task.

You can use corn starch, baking soda, hydrogen peroxide, and dishwasher mixture, olive oil, etc. as alternatives to WD-40.

And one of the most popular materials that are sued for cleaning shower doors is white vinegar. So, let's find out if white vinegar is good for cleaning shower doors.

Cleaning Shower Doors with White Vinegar

Vinegar is an extremely versatile substance. And it can be used for cleaning various kinds of things that include shower doors as well. Whether the door is made out of plastic, metal, or glass, you can use white vinegar to clean it.

Here are the steps that you need to follow:

(1) First, you have to find an empty spray bottle and then fill it up with a 1:1 mixture of vinegar and water.

(2) After that, you have to spray it all over the door (front and back). And just like WD-40, you must wait for half an hour.

(3) Take a clean cloth or a sponge and dip that into warm water.

(4) Use the cloth/sponge to wipe down the entire door. Leave no traces of vinegar anywhere on the door.

(5) Use an old toothbrush to clean the runners of the shower door.

And as we have said before, you should always wear plastic gloves throughout the cleaning process. If you get vinegar on your skin that would be quite unpleasant for you.

Final Thoughts

Always remember, cleaning the shower door should be one of your regular maintenance tasks. Otherwise, it’ll get dirty and it would be tough for you to clean the door. The stains on the shower door mainly come from body washers, soap scum, hair conditioners, and shampoos.

Fortunately, you can easily get the stains and dirt out of your shower door if you follow our guide about how to clean shower doors with WD40.

Related Information:

https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-Shower-Doors

https://www.hunker.com/13726993/how-to-clean-shower-doors

Title: How to Clean the Inside of a Double Pane Window by Drilling Holes
Content:
Do you want to know the process of how to clean the inside of a double pane window? If you are, then we are here to help. We will take you through the step-by-step process of cleaning the inside part of double pane windows.

As you’re probably aware double pane windows utilize two cascaded pieces of glass and they also have an airtight seal. And so, cleaning between the panes might seem a bit tricky.

If you see that the windows seem hazy and unclear, then it means the seal has broken and water and dust have entered the space between the two panes.

If that has happened to your windows, then you should immediately get them cleaned by following the procedure outlined below.

Cleaning the Inside of a Double Pane Window by Drilling Holes

This method might seem to be a bit extreme, but I find it to be very effective for clearing up a lot of interior windows in apartments and houses.You will want to drill multiple holes through each of the two inner windows first, to avoid any potential damage.

After drilling the holes move on to the following steps:

  • You must place tiny desiccate packets in those holes in order to absorb the moisture that forms between the window panes over time.
  • This will take out the fog and hazethat usually builds up inside these windows, as well as help keep moisture away from the glass.
  • After that, you should use Isopropyl alcohol for rinsing the dirt and debris that getstrapped inside the window panes.
  • Most of the time just rinsing won't be enough to clean the dirt out. In that case, you need to go to the next level by making your own cleaning device.
  • Tape a sock to a piece of wire and use that to clean the dirt.

There is an alternative method of clearing out the dust from inside the window panes. And that involves using a fan to blow the moisture out of the window panes through its drill holes. This will make it easy for you to clean the window.

We are warning you not to take the glasses apart in order to clean them. That will break the seal between the glasses and you'll have to hire a professional to reseal them back together. That could be expensive.

Furthermore, you should not seal off the drilled holes as you'll need them the next time you clean the window. And if you seal the holethen it'll also trap the moisture inside. You wouldn't wantthat.

Cleaning the Inside of a Double Pane Window, Without Drilling Holes

In case you don't want to go through the hassle ofdrilling holes, then there is another option for cleaning the inside of the double-pane window. It'sa quite simple but effective method.

There are three approaches that you can try out:

(1) Dusting the windows with a cloth or paper towel, then wiping it away with a damp cloth. Or you can use a damp rag.

(2) Place a dehumidifier in the vicinity of the windows. You could either use a dehumidifier machine or you could make a DIY dehumidifier yourself. Just take a container and poke some holes into it. Then pace some charcoal in it.

(3) Use a hairdryer to heat the windows, in the hopes that it evaporates the moisture.

Final Thoughts

That marks the end of this discussion regarding how to clean the inside of a double pane window. If you take the glass of the window apart in order to clean them, then you won’t be able to put them back together.

And so, you have to follow one of the two methods that we have described above. No matter which technique you choose, you’ll have squeaky clean windows in no time.

Title: How to Clean Smoke Damage from Painted Walls
Content:
Are you wondering about how to clean smoke damage from painted walls?

Look, we know that dealing with the aftermath of a fire hazard is an overwhelming experience. That's why we have created a step-by-step guide on how to do that. Our goal is to provide you with the information and tools you need to have a more successful cleanup of your home from smoke damage.

With that said, it's important to have an understanding of what exactly happens to a home after it has been damaged by a fire. We will start with the fundamentals.

Let's begin.

How to Clean Smoke Damage from Painted Walls

 If you’ve had the misfortune of having smoke damage to your house or a building, it can be a very difficult and time-consuming task to remove it. The best way to do this is to remove the smoke damage using the following methods:

1.Make Sure That the Area Is Well Ventilated

Make sure that you have ventilated your house properly. The harsh fumes left by the fire can be detrimental to your health. And if the fumes get mixed with the cleaning products, it can cause breathing difficulties.

So, we suggest you open up all the windows and doors, and make sure there is no smoke, which will make the area a better environment for cleaning. Use fans to get the fumes out of the house.

2. Wear Protection

The best way to prevent any kind of injuries while cleaning smoke damage from painted walls is by wearing safety goggles as well as gloves. When you wear your gloves, your hands will be protected from the chemicals of the cleaning products. And the goggles will make sure you don't get soot in your eyes while cleaning.

3. Cover the Floor with a Drop-Cloth

One of the most effective methods of protecting your carpet or flooring from getting stained is by placing a drop-cloth over them. This will prevent any stain from reaching the floor while cleaning the walls.

4. Remove the Loose Soots from the Painted Walls

Before you start cleaning those nasty stains from your walls, it would be easier to take out the loose soots that cling to the wall. You could either use a vacuum cleaner or a regular sponge to do this. But, using a vacuum cleaner will make the process much faster.

At first, get the plain attachment fixed on the nozzle of the vacuum cleaner. Then move it back and forth over the wall to get rid of the loose soot.

5. Remove the Smoke Damage Using Trisodium Phosphate Solution

After removing the soot from the wall, you can start by cleaning the smoke damage. To do this, use a powerful cleaning solution such as TSP (Trisodium Phosphate). This cleaning solution is quite popular when it comes to cleaning damage off painted walls.

First, fill a bucket with a gallon of warm water and then add one teaspoon of trisodium Phosphate. Then dip a wet sponge into the solution and vigorously clean the walls of the ceiling of your house. This will get rid of the smoke damage.

You might have to keep doing this multiple times and this step is quite tedious. So, we suggest you have patience and take breaks while doing it.

And also make sure you don't overdo it. If you use too much water, then it could seep into the walls and that could cause problems in the future.

If the stains still persist even after thoroughly cleaning the walls with the TSP solution, you should try other cleaning solutions.

6. Look for Other Types of Cleaning Solutions

There are various types of commercial cleaning solutions in the market that are specifically made for removing soot from painted walls. If you think that the TSP solution is a bit too strong to use around children and pets, you should look for better alternatives.

7. Remove the Smoke Odor

You may not have considered this, but just cleaning the smoke damage won't be enough. When a painted wall gets damaged by smoke, it releases a burned smell. The reason for that is, walls can easily absorb smoke and it then leaks the smoke back to the room.

To remove the smoke odor from the walls, you should at first place a large plastic sheet around the base of the walls. Then make a detergent solution out of warm water and two tablespoons of detergent.

Next, gently wipe the walls down with the detergent mixture on the walls using a soft rag or a sponge. You can also use vinegar to get rid of the smoke odor from the walls.

After you're finished, spray Febreeze on the walls as well as the surrounding area.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can smoke damage be removed?

Yes, it’s possible. In fact, the procedure for cleaning smoke damage is pretty straightforward. Just make sure that you do not leave smoke damage behind.

How do you get the smoke residue out of the house?

In order to get rid of the smoky smell from your house, you need to at first open all the windows and increase air circulation throughout the rooms. And then spray an air freshener.

Does sugar soap remove smoke damage?

Yes, it does. Sugar soaps are typically used for cleaning nicotine off painted walls. Just clean the walls using sugar soap and leave it for 30 minutes. Then rinse them off using water.

How do you get black smoke off walls?

You can use TSP, vinegar, or a degreasing dish soap in order to remove smoke damage from walls. You can also buy a commercial smoke remover in order to accomplish that task.

What's the best cleaner for smoke damage?

You can use any cleaner that you like on your walls. However, we'd recommend you use a tri-sodium phosphate solution to remove the smoke damage on the walls.

Final Thoughts

There is absolutely no question that smoke damage causes a lot of problems for a resident. The cost of cleaning the smoke damage can be very expensive and most homes aren't equipped to deal with this issue.

However, you can eliminate smoke damage from your walls by following our guide about "How to clean smoke damage from painted walls". I hope that you found this guide useful. Happy cleaning!

Title: How to Remove Front Cover of Window Air Conditioner
Content:
Are you wondering about how to remove front cover of window air conditioner? Sounds tricky, right?

Typically, window air conditioners come with two different covers that protect the internal components of the AC. The front cover's task is to protect the front part of the AC. In fact, it's the part that you see from inside the room.

The outer cover, on the other hand, protects the AC's internal mechanisms from the outdoor elements. The process of removing the front cover of your AC is fairly simple and requires you to remove some screws on the front. But the process will mostly depend on the brand and model of your AC.

Keep reading to figure out how it's done.

How to Remove Front Cover of Window Air Conditioner

The process is a bit hard to explain verbally. But we will try our best. At first, you should go and fetch the instruction manual for your window air conditioner. There is no doubt that it contains detailed instructions to remove the front cover of a window AC.

Once you have gotten the manual and the tools needed, you are ready to start. Check the manual to figure out where the front screws are located. There are usually two screws that connect the front cover to the AC. If you are having trouble locating the screws, check online by searching the model's name of your AC.

Now, let's look at the steps that you'll have to take:

(1) First and foremost, you have to turn the AC off and then unplug it from the power outlet. Doing maintenance work on the window AC while it's plugged in is extremely dangerous.

(2) After that, you must remove the control knob of the AC using your fingers. Then check for the screws located near the control-knob.

(3) Now you have to remove the screws. Take a Phillips screwdriver and start undoing the front screws of your window air conditioner.

(4) Take care to not take any sharp tools or metal objects out from the back of the window air conditioner.

(5) Lift the front cover up and take it away from your air conditioner. And then unhook the top part of the cover and completely remove it.

You might Be interested to our Video Content:

Final Thoughts

We hope that you've found our analysis regarding how to remove front cover of window air conditioner helpful. As you can see, the process is quite simple and it only requires you to remove a few screws and that’s all.

However, that does not mean that you can do it on a whim. You must be extra cautious while removing the front cover of your window AC. That’s because if you’re not careful enough, that might cause the cover to break or cause damage to the AC. And you surely wouldn’t want that.

Title: How to Clean Burnt Grease from Bottom of Frying Pans
Content:
How to clean burnt grease from bottom of frying pans? Well, that is the question that comes to mind whenever you see burnt grease at the bottom of your frying pan or skillet.

So, what to do? Is my skillet totally ruined beyond all repair? I hear you ask! Don’t worry, it's not completely destroyed.

You'll just need to clean the bottom of your frying pan to be rid of the brown grease.

There are several different ways to clean the bottom of a frying pan. For instance, you can use vinegar, baking soda, ketchup, salt, etc. to clean the gunk from under your skillet.

Let's discuss them in detail.

How to Clean Burnt Grease from Bottom of Frying Pans

Having a frying pan with a burnt underside can be quite problematic. The reason why this happens is that your cooking oil has burnt the grease underneath, thus preventing proper cooking.

It might seem impossible to remove all that greasy mess from your frying pan. Even hours and hours of scrubbing can prove ineffective against the grease. But, if you have the proper knowledge about the matter, you can easily clean your skillet. And that's what we are here to discuss.

To clean the bottom of your frying pan, you'll first need to gather all the necessary tools for this procedure.

Here are the items you will need to perform the cleaning task:

  • Sea salt
  • Baking Soda
  • Vinegar (White)
  • Scrubbing pad/brush
  • Dish Soap
  • Ketchup
  • Toothbrush

The various methods of removing burnt grease from the bottom of a frying pan are illustrated below:

1. Baking Soda

Baking soda is an extremely versatile substance that's highly effective in removing grease from frying pans. Here are the steps for removing grease by using baking soda:

  • Mix baking soda with hydrogen peroxide and water. Add some dawn to it if you can.
  • Use the scrubbing pad to apply this mixture to the bottom of your skillet.
  • Thoroughly move the scrubbing pad around the bottom of the pan and make sure the paste gets into every nooks and cranny.
  • Let it sit for half an hour. And once the paste gets all dried up, scrub the paste out using a toothbrush.

2. White Vinegar

The grease is bound to form on the outside part of your frying pan. This is especially true if you use the pan on a regular basis.

But the good news is that you can use white vinegar to remove that grease. And white vinegar is a common household item. So, this method shouldn't be that difficult for you.

Here are the steps you need to follow:

  • Take a large bucket that can fit the frying pan inside.
  • Mix white vinegar with water with a ratio of 1:2.
  • Submerge the skillet inside the mixture and let it sit for 30-40 minutes.
  • If the grease persists, keep it submerged for an additional 20 minutes.

3. White Vinegar, Dish Washer Liquid, and Baking Soda

Both of the cleaning agents that we have described so far are effective in their own right. But you know what will make an even more powerful cleaner?

All you have to do is mix those two with some dishwashing liquid. Here's what you need to do:

  • Cover the frying pan's surface with baking soda.
  • Pour a few drops of white vinegar and a few drops of dishwashing liquid over the frying pan's bottom surface.
  • Let it sit for a few minutes.
  • Wash the surface with a wet sponge.

4. Ketchup

So, now that you've got all the basic cleaning agents covered, you just need to learn about some unorthodox ways to clean greasy frying pans. I'm sure you didn't know that ketchup could be used to clean frying pans.

Fair warning! This method only works if the pan only has a thin layer of burnt grease on it. I've tried using this technique and I was successful in this endeavor. Here are the steps:

  • Cover the entire bottom surface of the skillet in ketchup.
  • Let it sit overnight. It takes a lot of time for the ketchup to remove the burnt grease.
  • Scrub the surface and then rinse it.

5. Salt

If you have some kosher salt (coarse) lying around in the kitchen, then you can use it to clean your fry pan.

  • Sprinkle some kosher salt on the greasy surface.
  • Add some lemon juice or soapy water to it.
  • Cut a potato in half and use it to scrub the surface and once you're done rinse it.

6. White Vinegar and Salt

Another way to clean greasy coating from your skillets is to use a mixture of white vinegar and salt. This method is quick and easy. This method works best if you mix a little bit of dishwashing liquid into it.

  • Keep the skillet soaked in white vinegar for more than an hour.
  • Pour the kosher salt over it and add a few drops of dishwashing liquid.
  • Vigorously scrub the bottom surface.

7. Oven Cleaner  

I bet you didn’t know that oven cleaner can be used to clean grease from kitchen appliances. Although most people hesitate to use oven cleaner to clean skillets, it’s actually quite effective at removing stubborn grease.

Here is how you can use it to clean your frying pan’s bottom surface:

  • At first, take the spray bottle filled with oven cleaner spray it all over the bottom surface of the skillet.
  • Leave it like this overnight (for at least 12 hours). This will give the oven cleaner enough time to break down the grease particles.
  • After that, use a scrub to clean the loosened grease. You can use a damp cloth or a sponge for that.
  • After you’re done scrubbing, you have to thoroughly wash the frying pan so that no burnt grease is left on its bottom surface.

Tips for Cleaning Burnt Grease of Frying Pans

If you want to keep your frying pan in the best possible condition, you should follow the tricks given below:

  • You should soak the skillet in water as soon as you’re done cooking your meal. This will make it easy for you to clean the grease.
  • Put a coat of ketchup on the surface of the frying pan in order to make it shiny.
  • Refer to the instruction manual and follow the instructions given by the manufacturer in order to maintain your frying pan properly.

Final Thoughts

So, did you find our methods of cleaning burnt grease interesting and helpful? Hopefully, our guide on how to clean burnt grease from bottom of frying pans has helped you understand that the process is not as complicated as it seems.

But we should warn you, it might not work on the first try and you may need to use different techniques to accomplish this task. Still, you should remember, no matter how tough the grease is, it will definitely break down at some point.

Title: Shark Steam Cleaner SC630 Review: Features, Technical Details and More!
Content:
Are you curious to learn about the new Shark SC630 steam cleaner? Well, our detailed article about the Shark Steam Cleaner SC630 review will definitely help you understand each and every aspect of this product.

After reading this, you’ll have all the knowledge you need in order to decide whether this product is for you or not.

In case you're unaware, the SC630 is a low-cost, handheld steam cleaner made by Shark. It can be used for sweeping and sanitizing various surfaces and for steaming garments.

Let's dig even deeper into the nitty-gritty of this product, shall we?
